finding: rs2334499 was linked to type 2 diabetes with PoO specific associations, where the paternal allele increased risk (OR=1.13) and the maternal allele decreased risk (OR=0.73). It was in high linkage disequilibrium (r^2=0.84) with the 11:1680825:A:T variant associated with similar effects.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: SNP rs73404549 achieved genome-wide significance in the MetaNONRES and MetaALL analyses on chromosome 11 (p=5.6×10^-11 and p=7.7×10^-13, respectively). It is located near the HBE1, OR51B4, and HBB genes and was found to be monomorphic in Southern and East African populations. The SNP is in linkage disequilibrium with rs334, which is associated with the sickle cell trait.
title: Genetic Association and Transferability for Urinary Albumin-Creatinine Ratio as a Marker of Kidney Disease in four Sub-Saharan African Populations and non-continental Individuals of African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs12252-C was associated with disease severity in COVID-19, indicating that individuals carrying this variant may experience more severe manifestations of the disease. This finding was reported in the context of interferon-induced transmembrane protein 3, which is known to play a role in the immune response against viral infections. The presence of the minor allele (rs12252-C) was linked to a lower ability to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection and impact mortality, further emphasizing its significance in understanding COVID-19 outcomes.
title: SARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance identifies naturally occurring truncations of ORF7a that limit immune suppression

finding: This SNP, located in the C2 domain of the MYBPC3 protein, exhibited a missense mutation resulting in an arginine to histidine substitution at position 419 (p.Arg419His). This mutation was found to significantly destabilize the interaction between MYBPC3 and ACTC1, highlighting its potential role in contributing to congenital heart disease pathology.
title: Computational analysis of congenital heart disease associated SNPs: Unveiling their impact on the gene regulatory system

finding: The SNP rs174592 located at 11q13.1 was associated with general psychiatric risk, cholesterol, triglyceride measurements, and male baldness, and had previously been linked to bipolar disorder.
title: Isolating the genetic component of mania in bipolar disorder

finding: Individuals with the GALNT18 rs4910008 CC genotype were found to have an increased response to tocilizumab compared to those with CT and TT genotypes, suggesting a positive influence on treatment effectiveness.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The rs2292912 variant of the CRY2 gene showed a mild positive association with late evening time stroke, indicated by an odds ratio of 1.738, with a p-value of 0.0488.
title: Clinical implication of time of stroke among post stroke survivors from eastern India: A circadian perspective

finding: The SNP rs10840273 was found to be genome-wide significantly associated with leg BMD, with a P-value of 4.52×10^-9, supporting its role in BMD traits.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs10832558 was associated with shared genetics of head BMD and IA, showcasing its direct implications for both skeletal and vascular health.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs415895 was a missense variant within SWAP70, associated with changes in expression due to a C to G base change resulting in a Q to E amino acid alteration, consistent with findings from mass-spectrometry measurements.
title: Dual site proteomic analyses reveal potential drug targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: Linked to <italic>ODF3</italic> in 11p15.5, this variant showed significant respect to PSA levels, highlighting its relevance in prostate cancer research.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Impacting the understanding of PSA variations, this variant has shown notable associations with prostate cancer studies.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Identified as having a significant impact on BFP, HDL, and TG with paradoxical effects indicating complex metabolic relationships.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs12279250 in the NELL1 gene displayed a dominant genotypic effect and was associated with high LDL-C levels with clinically significant odds ratios (OR >= 2.5) and statistical significance (p < .001) on simple logistic regression analysis.
title: Variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels among Filipinos

finding: SNP rs661946, located 6 bp upstream of the NXPE1 transcriptional start site, perfectly correlated with mPAS staining in all studied samples. Heterozygous C/T individuals displayed distinct staining patterns, where NXPE1 protein was absent in mPAS positive crypts. Expression levels of NXPE1 were found to be significantly lower in samples with the T allele compared to those with the C allele, confirming the direct relationship between the SNP, NXPE1 expression, and mPAS phenotypes.
title: NXPE1 alters the sialoglycome by acetylating sialic acids in the human colon

finding: The BP allele of rs2270448 was associated with decreased expression of SF3B2 in the brain cerebellum (P = 1.28×10^-5).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: rs6589386 was identified as the most significant SNP (p=2.9e-12) associated with addiction risk factor (addiction-rf). It was intergenic but closest to DRD2 (Dopamine receptor 2), which showed a significant association in gene-based analyses (p=7.9e-12) and acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in the cerebellum.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs1846476 marked an ASD-SV in GRM5, found in 22% of ASD cases, potentially disrupting a FOXA1 binding site and indicating dysregulation in individuals with ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs1566734 in PTPRJ was associated with carcinoma of the colon. This non-synonymous single nucleotide variant (SNV) caused an amino acid change from Q276P, highlighting its potential relevance in cancer pathology.
title: A newly identified pathology of Episodic Angioedema with Hypereosinophilia (Gleich’s Syndrome) revealed by Multi-Omics Analysis

finding: The minor G allele of rs174592 was associated with a higher risk of bipolar disorder (BPD) and lower levels of plasma arachidonic acid (ARA). This finding aligned with the observed directionality in prior Mendelian randomization analyses, supporting the BPD risk locus within the FADS1/2/3 gene cluster.
title: A metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization study identifies dysregulated arachidonic acid synthesis as a potential causal risk factor for bipolar disorder

finding: The sentinel variant rs174556 was found to be associated with a significant increase in arachidonic acid levels in breast milk, with a per major allele effect size of 17%. This suggested that genetic variation at the FADS1/2/3 cluster could influence ARA levels, which may modulate BPD risk.
title: A metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization study identifies dysregulated arachidonic acid synthesis as a potential causal risk factor for bipolar disorder

finding: Unique among the loci, rs2229177 was noted for its association with male reproductive traits, particularly prostate cancer.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Identified as being linked to reproductive health traits while also presenting connections to thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP was part of the findings relating to reproductive health traits, alongside thyroid-associated genetics.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The rs772677709 variant in SORL1, resulting in a p.Y1816C substitution, was associated with early-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) across three unrelated families. The variant segregated with AD in these families, and individuals carrying this variant had an age at onset ranging from 50 to 69 years. Functional studies indicated that the p.Y1816C variant impaired SORLA receptor maturation, reduced trafficking to the cell surface, and resulted in enlarged endosomes in engineered neurons, consistent with AD pathology. These findings provided strong genetic and biochemical evidence supporting the conclusion that the rs772677709 variant is pathogenic and causal for AD.
title: The SORL1 p.Y1816C variant causes impaired endosomal dimerization and autosomal dominant Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs35705950 was associated with the RA-UIP subtype of RA-ILD in a manner similar to its association with IPF. This finding indicated a shared risk factor between these conditions, supporting the hypothesis of common pathogenic pathways.
title: Rheumatoid arthritis and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: a bidirectional Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The NUMA1 variant rs10898815 was associated with an increased likelihood of switching antihypertensive medications (HR 1.16, p=0.0009).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The SNP rs1892971, located near MMP13, which encodes matrix metalloproteinase-13, was identified for its role in structural integrity of atherosclerotic plaques, providing a new connection to CAD.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The genotype at rs174535 was significantly associated with the abundances of plasmalogens that inversely correlated with future ASCVD events. Higher levels of two associated plasmalogen metabolites were influenced by this SNP, establishing a potential genetic link to ASCVD risk.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: Although not directly associated with ASCVD events in this study, rs174547, which is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs174535, was noted to increase risk for aortic stenosis in Europeans. Thus, it suggested a broader relevance for cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: Similarly to rs174547, the minor T allele of rs174546, also in linkage disequilibrium with rs174535, was linked to increased risk for coronary artery disease. This SNP reinforced the findings regarding FADS genetic influences on ASCVD.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: The SNP <italic>rs7941686</italic> showed negative associations with ease of skin tanning in European ancestry, with different effect directions observed in non-African ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: In the HELIOS study, rs2051466 was identified as the top variant associated with circulating 3BH5C levels, demonstrating a significant positive association (Beta [SE] per A allele = 0.50 [0.04], P = 7.9×10−43). This finding was replicated in larger studies, confirming the impact of this SNP on cholesterol metabolism and, by extension, cardiovascular risk.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: The SNP rs10488763 was highlighted as a potentially causal variant in the locus associated with 3BH5C levels and coronary artery disease (CAD). It showed a strong association with reduced 3BH5C concentrations and increased CAD risk, particularly in Asian populations. Its association with CAD was recognized in the Japanese population, indicating a significant link between the variant and cardiovascular health.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: Unlike in European populations, rs1443120 was shown to have a strong association with CAD in Japanese cohorts. The variant, along with rs10488763, was indicated to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) and both exhibited comparable effects on 3BH5C levels and CAD risk, solidifying their role in cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: The variant rs2846734 was recognized as the top cis-eQTL for the expression of the gene FDX1. It demonstrated a significant association with plasma 3BH5C levels (P<sub>SMR</sub> = 8.5×10<sup>−10</sup>). This finding underscored the regulatory effect of genetic variants on metabolite levels and their implications for cardiovascular disease pathology.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel cis-meQTL for cg14999724 near RP11-872D17.8. It showed an association with Cystatin C levels, underlining its potential significance in kidney function pathology.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was part of the significant loci for anxiety disorders and was noted for its pleiotropic effects, particularly in relation to cardiometabolic traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of major anxiety disorders in 122,341 European-ancestry cases identifies 58 loci and highlights GABAergic signaling

finding: This SNP in PATL1 was found to have significant association with ischemic stroke at p < 1 × 10−10, particularly noted for its rarity in European Caucasians.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: The SNP rs5744249 was identified as a significant 'cis' pQTL for IL-18, showing a protective association with lung cancer risk. A genetically predicted increment in blood IL-18 concentration was associated with a reduced risk of lung cancer (OR: 0.85 [95% CI: 0.79-0.92]), particularly for adenocarcinoma (OR: 0.80 [95% CI: 0.72-0.89]). This protective effect was linked to the expression of IL-18 in lung tissue and was thought to be influenced by the minor allele of this SNP, which may have been introgressed from Neandertals, reflecting an evolutionary immune response.
title: IL-18 and Lower Risk for Lung Cancer: Triangulated Evidence from Germline Predictions, Pre-Diagnostic Measurements, and Tumor Expression

finding: The variant rs1135071 was negatively associated with blood donorship and had a strong increasing effect on AHSP levels, thereby stabilizing hemoglobin assembly.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The SNP rs1800497, commonly known as the TaqIA SNP located in the coding region of ANKK1, was associated with alcoholism, schizophrenia (SCZ), and eating disorders. The expression of blood- and brain-derived ANKK1 eQTLs was negatively correlated with both major depressive disorder (MDD) and SCZ, suggesting that shared genetic risk for these neuropsychiatric disorders might be partly driven by ANKK1 gene expression.
title: Local genetic correlations exist among neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases

finding: The intronic variant rs661348 demonstrated a suggestive association with intracerebral hemorrhagic stroke, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.3 and a p value of 8.0×10^-8. Notably, while rs661348 was not previously linked to stroke, it was found in linkage disequilibrium with other previously associated variants (rs569550 and rs1973765). Additionally, rs661348 showed a nominal association with hypertension in both PGR and UKB cohorts.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: The rs10898815 A allele in the NUMA1 gene was associated with increased risks of CCB discontinuation, with a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 1.07 (95% CI 1.02-1.12) overall and 1.17 (95% CI 1.05-1.29) in participants with high polygenic scores for fat mass and lean mass. This finding indicated a significant relationship between this variant and the treatment adherence of dihydropiridine calcium channel blockers (dCCBs).
title: Combining pharmacogenetics and patient characteristic polygenic scores to improve outcome prediction for Calcium Channel Blocker treatment

finding: The PDE3B p.R783X variant (rs150090666) demonstrated a significant association with lower WHR_adjBMI and aligned with previous reports linking it to lower triglyceride levels and higher HDL, indicating a beneficial role in fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The PLCB3 p.V806I variant (rs145502455) was found to be genome-significant in women regarding fat distribution, indicating it as a positive original finding.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The SNP rs174576 was previously identified and was associated with bipolar disorder (BD), particularly implicating the FADS1 and FADS2 genes. Its association was only determined after excluding self-reported data from the meta-analysis.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP was identified as a splice donor 5th base variant in the APOA5 gene. It was associated with higher triglyceride (TG) concentrations, showing a high donor loss potential with a Delta Score of 0.97. The SNP had the largest effect size among 6 coding variants in APOA5 associated with TG, with a beta of 1.10 (SE 0.079) and a significance of P = 7.0 × 10^-4.
title: Exome wide association study for blood lipids in 1,158,017 individuals from diverse populations

finding: rs139341533 was part of a cluster with an average effect size of -0.097, which indicates a potential negative correlation related to blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: This SNP joined rs139341533 in the same cluster with an average effect size of -0.097, suggesting a risk association for blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: This SNP was also allocated to the cluster with an average effect size of -0.0438, indicating a negative relationship concerning blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: The SNP rs76950800 was associated with RBS-R restricted with p = 2.4 × 10^-7 and is located within E2F8, a transcription factor regulating SNRPN, which is linked to several neurodevelopmental conditions including autism.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SORL1:rs11218343-C variant was identified as protective in the analysis of variants related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The minor C-allele of SNP rs12364973 was associated with increased IFITM1 gene expression in SS patients, suggesting a genetic determinant of gene regulation that could impact inflammatory responses.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The SNP rs766826 was identified as the most likely causal variant at the ELF5 locus, with a PP of 99%. It was associated with a >4-fold higher risk for severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio of 4.85 and a p-value < 3.1×10^-7. It specifically increased ELF5 expression in lung tissue, which is critical due to ELF5's role in epithelial cells that likely serve as targets for SARS-CoV-2. The major C-allele was linked to higher plasma levels of ELF5 and greater risk of severe outcomes in COVID-19.
title: ELF5 is a respiratory epithelial cell-specific risk gene for severe COVID-19

finding: SNP rs2344609 was significantly associated with MYSM1 expression and was identified in the cross-trait meta-analysis related to both endometriosis and IBS.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The SNP rs149808404, associated with the apoA-V Q252X variant, resulted in a premature truncation of the protein, which eliminated the C-terminal hydrophobic region. Carriers of this variant exhibited significantly elevated plasma triglyceride (TG) levels and increased TG to apolipoprotein B (apoB) ratios compared to matched non-carrier controls. This finding supported the pathogenicity of the variant, indicating its role in loss of function related to lipolysis and triglyceride metabolism.
title: Comparison of the structure-function properties of wild-type human apoA-V and a C-terminal truncation associated with elevated plasma triglycerides

finding: The SNP rs2075291, linked to the apoA-V G162C variant, was identified as a rare loss-of-function variant associated with elevated plasma triglycerides. Carriers of this variant showed significantly higher plasma TG levels and increased TG to apoB ratios, reflecting apoA-V's specific effect on the lipolytic process, consistent with previous reports linking this variant to hypertriglyceridemia and related cardiovascular complications.
title: Comparison of the structure-function properties of wild-type human apoA-V and a C-terminal truncation associated with elevated plasma triglycerides

finding: The variant rs174564A>G was associated with levels of phosphatidylcholine (PC) species, specifically PC(36:4), with a beta coefficient of -0.62 and a p-value of 8.1 × 10^-72. This finding linked the SNP to lipid metabolism alterations observed in children with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), indicating its relevance to cardiometabolic disease.
title: Plasma lipidomics identifies a signature of NAFLD in children that couples with cardiometabolic outcomes in adults

finding: The SNP rs12275055 was found within a novel independent association signal at chr11 68810837-69542062, demonstrating pleiotropic associations with multiple cancer types. It acted as an eQTL in various tissues affecting TPCN2, relevant for cancer cell processes.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The SNP rs3212870, located intronic in the CCND1 gene, was established as the most likely causal variant in one of the newly identified credible sets. Its association with PrCa was previously unreported, attributed to weak marginal associations connected with moderate linkage disequilibrium.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The SNP rs174575 was identified as the leading SNP of the most significant locus related to MetaboAgeMort. It was located near or within the genes FADS1 and FADS2 on chromosome 11, demonstrating a significant association with the new aging measure.
title: Heterogeneous metabolomic aging across the same age and prediction of health outcome

finding: The rs779406084 SNP in the PICALM gene was significantly associated with HMSE scores in the LASI-DAD cohort. This rare missense variant exhibited a higher prevalence in South Asians compared to European ancestries, with a MAF of 0.075%. It had a high CADD score of 24, placing it in the top percentiles of deleterious SNVs, indicating a potential impactful role in cognitive function, marking it as the first known association of this variant with cognitive measures.
title: Region-based analysis with functional annotation identifies genes associated with cognitive function in South Asians from India

finding: The SNP rs12799883 showed an association with both prostate cancer risk and the expression level of CCND1e.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: This variant showed association evidence with both p.H1047R and any PIK3CA mutation.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The study found that the common variant rs11042158 was linked with lower cerebellar volume in a UK Biobank sample of 40,374 individuals. Specifically, the C allele of this variant was associated with not only decreased cerebellar volume but also with lower expression of the SCUBE2 gene in the cerebellar tissue as indicated by the GTEx v8 data. The statistical significance of this association was strong, with a p-value of 6.94×10^-13, suggesting a reliable correlation between the variant and the cerebellar phenotype.
title: Rare variant aggregation highlights rare disease genes associated with brain volume variation

finding: A missense variant with implications in neurotrophic factor signaling that was correlatively prioritized in analyses related to cardiac traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs4071559, located in the MLLT10 locus, was associated with both endometriosis and ovarian cancer types, showing significant overlaps with multiple biofeatures indicating functional relevance.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs11031005 displayed a strong association with endometriosis and HGSOC, located in the vicinity of the FSHB gene and showed functional importance within regulatory regions.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs10835638 was associated with the FSHB gene, indicating its role within reproductive traits and diseases while being significant in relation to endometriosis.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs11031006 was also located near the FSHB gene and associated with transcriptional regulation, contributing to the understanding of endometriosis risk.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs2078267 in SLC22A11 was associated with a higher risk of insulin resistance (IR) under the recessive model. Individuals carrying the T/T genotype exhibited an OR of 3.72 (95% CI 1.22-11.28; p < 0.0091), indicating a significant association with IR.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs1076560 in the DRD2 gene was associated with personality traits and anxiety in individuals with polysubstance use disorder. This finding highlighted the role of the dopaminergic pathway in the context of substance use disorders and related behavioral traits.
title: The pleiotropic contribution of genes in dopaminergic and serotonergic pathways to addiction, aggression, and related behavioural traits

finding: The variant rs35705950, located between MUC5AC and MUC5B, was significantly associated with increased MUC5B expression and linked to pulmonary diseases, with a p-value of 2.1 x 10^-8 in males.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs587779834 SNP associated with ATM showed a significant hazard ratio of 2.5 (p = 2.7 x 10^-5), reflecting its impact on lifespan reduction.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The study found that participants with obesity performed worse on a working memory task depending on their Taq1A genotype (rs1800497). This SNP is known to affect dopamine receptor density in the striatum and has been associated with obesity-related outcomes, suggesting that individuals with a potentially vulnerable genotype may exhibit subtle cognitive impairments.
title: Working Memory Gating in Obesity: Insights from a Case-Control fMRI Study

finding: Associated with dopamine receptor D2 (DRD2) on chromosome 11, this SNP showed a p-value of 1.81E-09. It was linked to smoking behaviors, particularly regarding reward pathways in addiction.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP was found in NCAM1 on chromosome 11 with a p-value of 5.44E-12, indicating its role in modulating dopamine signaling and its impact on smoking-related traits.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in the BDNF gene on chromosome 11, with a p-value of 7.18E-09, was associated with substance use disorders, emphasizing its importance in synaptogenesis and memory in relation to smoking.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs948445 was associated with four N-acetylated aromatic amino acids, suggesting its relevance in amino acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The choline phosphate variant in CHKA linked it to lipid metabolism functions.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This variant in FDX1 was associated with 3beta-hydroxy-5-cholestenoate, implicating its metabolic role in cholesterol biosynthesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP showed significant association (p=2.50E-09) near NCAM1, implicated in behaviors linked to substance use.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs73392700, associated with the CDKN2B gene, was found to have a p-value of 4.84×10^-17 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.12, reaching genome-wide significance for rIA and contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for this condition.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: The SNP rs35705950 within the MUC5B gene positively affected the outcome of lung diseases, showing protective effects against COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs10890563 was found to be significantly associated with gestational diabetes (OR = 1.88, P = 3.53×10^-8). This is a 3'UTR variant located in the GUCY1A2 gene, which encodes a soluble guanylate cyclase subunit.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs10830963, located near the MTNR1B gene, was identified as a significant association with glucose metabolism, showing a meta-analysis p-value of 2.9 x 10^-89. However, its association was absent in non-fasting samples from the UK Biobank, indicating the influence of sample preparation on replicability.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The lead SNP rs11601507 associated with TRIM5 was linked to 42 lipid and lipoprotein traits, suggesting its effect on metabolic pathways that may predispose to coronary artery disease, presenting a possibility for developing alternative therapeutic approaches.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: SNP rs174564 was significantly associated with omega-6 PUFA ratios, indicating its role in fatty acid metabolism.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The rs4757137 SNP in the promoter region of the core clock gene BMAL1 was found to be associated with increased difficulty awakening after conditioning on chronotype (β Conditional = 0.012, SE = 0.002, p = 2.02×10^-10). Moreover, it was associated with morning chronotype after conditioning on difficulty awakening (β Conditional = -0.05, SE = 0.007, p = 1.10×10^-12), indicating its significant genetic involvement in both traits.
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: This SNP functioned as an expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) linked to FADS2, underscoring its potential genetic impact on RA.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This trans-pQTL in the MS4A4A locus associated with higher plasma TREM2 levels and was shown to correlate with lower Alzheimer’s disease risk. The association was supported by previous research linking this variant to increased CSF TREM2 levels.
title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: The rs11217020 SNP associated with the DDX6 gene was found to interact heavily with several other candidate genes including CXCR5, in CD4+ T cells, which had significantly higher CXCR5 expression, suggesting multifaceted roles in SSc pathogenesis.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNPrs187115 variant in the CD44 gene was identified as a predictive biomarker that could aid in selecting patients likely to benefit from pancreatic resection. This finding was derived from retrospective analyses that indicated this SNP had an association with an over 2-fold increased risk of tumour-related death, with a hazard ratio of 0.38 and a significant p-value of up to 1x10^-8.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The SNPrs353630 polymorphism, also located in the CD44 gene, was associated with an increased risk of tumour-related death in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients. The retrospective analyses showed a hazard ratio up to 0.38, reaffirming the relevance of this SNP in predicting survival outcomes related to PDAC.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The rs10835187 SNP was associated with accelerated brain aging, bone density, and brain volume measurement. It is an intergenic variant located between genes LGR4-AS1 and LIN7C, with previous studies linking variations in LIN7C to ADHD.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The SNP rs76289836 located at 11q13.4 showed a strong association with cortical thickness in the right banks of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) with a p-value of 6.4×10^−20. This locus had not been previously reported, but its nearest gene, IGF2 (insulin growth factor 2), was linked to anxiety and PTSD.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The promoter variant <italic>TYR</italic> c.-301C>T [rs4547091] was identified as a fetal retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) selective eQTL. This variant was found to alter the binding site for the transcription factor <italic>OTX2</italic> in the <italic>TYR</italic> promoter, resulting in a significant reduction in promoter activity <italic>in vitro</italic>. Furthermore, this variant modulated the penetrance of a prevalent, disease-associated missense change, <italic>TYR</italic> c.1205G>A [rs1126809].
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The missense variant <italic>TYR</italic> c.1205G>A [rs1126809] was shown to decrease TYR enzymatic activity <italic>in vitro</italic> and was associated with multiple phenotypes such as skin/hair pigmentation and iris color. It was reported to act as a hypomorphic variant that can cause a mild form of albinism when in a compound heterozygous state with a complete loss-of-function <italic>TYR</italic> mutation, despite having a minor allele frequency (MAF) of around 27% in European populations.
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The missense variant <italic>TYR</italic> c.575C>A [rs1042602] was also identified to decrease TYR enzymatic activity <italic>in vitro</italic> and was linked to phenotypes including skin/hair pigmentation and macular thickness. This variant was part of a haplotype that conferred a very high risk of albinism, with an odds ratio >77, and was associated with reduced vision in participants from the UK Biobank.
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The SNP rs149483638 was associated with a lower risk for type 2 diabetes (T2D). This SNP was located in the INS-IGF2 gene, which is situated near the INS gene. The findings suggested that this genetic variation might influence the regulation of INS gene expression, potentially providing protective effects against the development of T2D.
title: The TH01 microsatellite and INS VNTR are strongly associated with type 2 diabetes and fasting insulin secretion

finding: The eQTL rs3751033 demonstrated a pleiotropic effect influencing the gene RP11-890B15 in the hippocampus, and SNX19 in both the hippocampus and hypothalamus. This finding was significant for its role in both neuropsychiatric disorders and chronotype.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: Associated with TIRAP, this variant functions as an eQTL and a splicing QTL for related genes, indicating its potential role in glycosylation through regulatory mechanisms.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The SNP rs2508372 showed a novel association in the intergenic region between PGR and TRPC6. This association was linked to mechanisms related to glomerular function and pregnancy-related vascular responses, indicating its potential role in the pathogenesis of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: Associating with lifestyle factors such as alcohol consumption, this SNP also contributed to the understanding of behavioral influences on heart failure risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs10830963, located within the intron of the MTNR1B gene, was significantly associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) susceptibility, with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 1.57 (95% CI 1.45, 1.70) and a p-value of 4.42×10-29. This SNP was recognized as the most significant locus associated with GDM, although its effect on type 2 diabetes was described as modest.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: This SNP was identified as a splice acceptor variant in high LD with the lead variant rs4910165 (r² = 0.69) in the gene MRVI1. It demonstrated a substantial predicted impact on protein function, suggesting a role in migraine mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The lead variant rs4910165 was significant for migraine and was associated with a splice acceptor variant rs11042902 (r² = 0.69) which indicates that splicing could potentially influence susceptibility to migraines.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: This significant lead SNP was associated with the CALCA/CALCB genes, which encode calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP), a target for migraine-specific therapies, highlighting its relevance to migraine biology (P = 2.43 x 10^-10).
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: Identified as a migraine with aura-specific variant showing statistical significance, underlining its potential relevance to this subtype.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs7116990, located between CNTN5 and JRKL at locus 11q21, demonstrated significant interactions with alcohol exposure, holding a p-value of 1.80×10^-5. The major allele (A) increased the odds of NSCL/P when periconceptional alcohol was present and provided protective effects in its absence.
title: Genome-wide interaction study implicates VGLL2 and alcohol exposure and PRL and smoking in orofacial cleft risk

finding: In the RA locus tagged by rs4409785, the SNP was found to be a strong causal quantitative trait locus (caQTL) for chromatin peaks (FDR 5.52e-07) and displayed allelic imbalance (FDR 1.01e-03). It was associated with the creation of a new CTCF binding site affecting the gene SESN3, linked to autoimmune disease pathogenesis.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: This SNP was linked to significant changes in chromatin accessibility (8.2-fold increase) within an LD region, directly affecting nearby regulatory elements and their influence on associated gene expression.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: Alterations in chromatin conformation lead to increased activity in regulatory elements associated with rs968567. It resulted in closer interactions with FADS genes, crucial for RA pathogenesis.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The rs174537 SNP in the FADS cluster was significantly associated with various metabolic traits in Hispanic populations. Specifically, the T allele of rs174537 demonstrated a strong positive correlation with higher circulating triglycerides (TGs), with effect sizes averaging 21.27 mg/dL for GT genotype compared to GG, and 29.94 mg/dL for TT compared to GG. This finding highlighted its role in lipid metabolism and indicated that higher proportions of Amerind ancestry corresponded to increased levels of TGs.
title: Amerind ancestry predicts the impact of FADS genetic variation on omega-3 PUFA deficiency, cardiometabolic and inflammatory risk in Hispanic populations

finding: The variant rs174557 was examined for its association with LC-PUFA levels and showed similar trends to rs174537 when adjusted for genetic ancestry. Specifically, higher proportions of Amerind ancestry were correlated with decreased levels of n-3 and n-6 LC-PUFAs, as well as increased levels of TGs, suggesting that this SNP also plays a significant role in fatty acid metabolism in Hispanic populations.
title: Amerind ancestry predicts the impact of FADS genetic variation on omega-3 PUFA deficiency, cardiometabolic and inflammatory risk in Hispanic populations

finding: The variant rs375882485 was associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and was observed frequently in individuals of Northwestern European (NWE) ancestry. It was reported in 10 instances in the gnomAD dataset, with a significant concentration of carriers from NWE regions including the UK, Ireland, Belgium, the Netherlands, and others. Additionally, the penetrance of this variant was assessed, suggesting that it is commonly found among cohort participants, thereby indicating a notable connection to HCM in this demographic.
title: The penetrance of rare variants in cardiomyopathy-associated genes: a cross-sectional approach to estimate penetrance for secondary findings

finding: The study mentioned the MUC5B genotype which refers to the promoter polymorphism rs35705950. This SNP was related to clinical traits such as forced vital capacity (FVC) and the diffusing capacity of lung for carbon monoxide (D<sub>LCO</sub>). It was discussed in the context of identifying distinct disease endotypes in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF), indicating its relevance in understanding pathogenesis and patient stratification.
title: Cluster analysis of transcriptomic datasets to identify endotypes of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs174528 was associated with DHA levels, demonstrating a highly significant association with a p-value less than 1E-300, highlighting the importance of FADS genes in n-3 LCPUFA genetics.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs509360 was linked to omega-3 fatty acids with a p-value less than 1E-300, reaffirming the significance of FADS genes in the regulation of omega-3 fatty acid levels.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs964184 was identified as having the most significant independent association with MUFAs, with a joint analysis p-value of 6.08E-207, reflecting a strong connection to polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acid traits.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The variant rs9795439 showed evidence of association with mode of the cingulum, contributing to the shared genetic influences with sleep traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs3867239 variant had genetic associations with features in the brain network systems related to chronotype.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs667730 was analyzed concerning its role in the intersection of genes affecting sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: In 17q21.31, rs174541 had implications for brain features relative to sleep and disturbances.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11605348 was involved in genetic studies, connecting sleep conditions with myocardial wall thickness.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP demonstrated genetic overlaps with insomnia and heart-related conditions.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The MUC5B promoter polymorphism rs35705950 was found to be associated with an increased risk for acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) in both the VALID and BioVU cohorts of at-risk hospitalized adults. In the VALID cohort, the association was particularly strong among older patients, where each T-allele was linked to an odds ratio of 1.44 for ARDS. In BioVU, this polymorphism consistently increased the risk for EHR-ARDS across all ages (OR: 1.20), demonstrating the potential of EHR-derived algorithms to replicate genetic associations. An additional novel association was identified with oxygenation impairment in patients receiving mechanical ventilation, where each T-allele correlated with a mean decrease of 8 mmHg in the PaO2:FiO2 ratio.
title: Electronic health record biobank cohort recapitulates an association between the MUC5B promoter polymorphism and ARDS in critically ill adults

finding: The variant rs35705950 in the <italic>MUC5B</italic> locus demonstrated a much larger effect in males for IPF susceptibility, indicating a significant sex heterogeneity in disease risk.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs7107356, located near AGBL2, was found with a p-value of 1.43×10−10. This novel association adds to the understanding of genetic factors influencing alcohol intake behaviors.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs2514218 at the DRD2 locus showed a significant association (p=4.59×10−08) and was reaffirmed as relevant for understanding the relationship between genetic variance and alcohol-related traits.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs10838725 was identified as an AD risk locus in the CELF1 region. In the analysis of brain samples from Alzheimer's disease (AD) and control individuals, a significant decrease in CELF1 expression (-31.9%, p=0.021) was observed for individuals with the risk allele (C) compared to those without it. This indicated that rs10838725 influences CELF1 levels, which in turn correlated with different splice variants of KLC1, establishing a direct relationship between the SNP and the molecular mechanisms underlying Alzheimer's disease.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease pathway uncovered by functional omics: the risk gene CELF1 regulates KLC1 splice variant E expression, which drives Aβ pathology

finding: The BDNF gene variant rs6265 was found to be associated with PAU, possibly influencing neurodevelopmental pathways that affect addiction behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The rs35705950 SNP, located in the promoter region of the MUC5B gene, was identified as the largest genetic risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). In the UK Biobank, it was significantly associated with IPF risk, with odds ratios (OR) ranging from 2.06 to 3.09. This effect was notably lower than the previously reported OR of 5.06 (CI: 4.69, 5.47) in clinically-derived datasets and 4.99 (CI: 3.74, 6.66) in a meta-analysis. The study concluded that while there was a significant association observed in UK Biobank data, the effect size was attenuated compared to results from clinically-derived studies.
title: Using genetic information to define idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs117203606 at 11p12 was associated with CAP (p=2.90×10^{-8}), located intergenic to LINC02740 and HNRNPKP3, indicating potential involvement in immunity.
title: A genome-wide association study of adults with community-acquired pneumonia

finding: The SNP rs11235667, located on chromosome 11, was associated with Crohn's disease (CD) in a genome-wide association study (GWAS). It was also found to fall within a peak in the top 10% for both DC populations M-9 and M-12, indicating its relevance in the context of immune cell states pertinent to autoimmune diseases.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: The SNP rs2155219, also located on chromosome 11, was identified as a genome-wide risk locus for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). This SNP resides within a peak in the top 10% for myeloid cell state M-6, suggesting its involvement in the genetic architecture of autoimmune conditions and its association with cell state dynamics.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: The SNP rs11236797, found on chromosome 11, was similarly linked to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). This locus was located within the same peak as rs2155219, situated in the top 10% for M-6, highlighting its potential role in modulating genetic risk factors for autoimmune diseases via its dynamic regulatory elements.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: The SNP rs11229119 was identified as the top association in the OUD-MTAG analysis, with a p-value of 7.03×10⁻¹¹, linking it to both TMX2 and CTNND1 genes. This highlighted its potential significance in the genetic framework of OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This SNP (rs1940701) showed significance in the OUD-MTAG findings with a p-value of 9.63×10⁻¹⁰, mapping to NCAM1, indicating its contribution to the genetic underpinnings of OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs7933438 was prioritized as the candidate causal SNP linked to T2D. It was shown to be involved in regulatory activities via its position within an islet enhancer, but specific details about its causal effects were less emphasized compared to other variants.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs75336838 was prioritized by the model as a candidate causal variant for HbA1c, with the T allele increasing its enhancer probability and significantly affecting transcription factor binding within human beta cell extracts, indicating a role in T2D-related regulatory processes.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: This SNP was associated with a combined response of multiple drugs (p=2.51 x 10^-9), showing particular relevance for tamoxifen, BI.2536, and belinostat. It is within the TSKU gene, which underscores the relationship between genetic variants and broad drug efficacy in AML treatment.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The variant p.G78V, corresponding to the SNP rs963128995, was identified as a rare non-synonymous variant in the CSRP3 gene, crucial for cardiomyocyte function. While it was previously reported, its presence was confirmed in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) but absent in 100 ethnicity-matched control individuals, suggesting its potential pathogenic role in heart disease.
title: Mutations in CSRP3/MLP, a Z-disc associated gene are functionally associated with dilated cardiomyopathy in Indian population

finding: The SNP rs1847639939, located in the AMPD3 gene, interacted with LTST regarding LDL-c levels. This interaction exhibited significant associations.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs59374498, mapping to TEAD1/RASSF10, interacted with LTST in its association with TG levels, indicating a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The variant rs2237892 at KCNQ1 was also a known association with T2D and demonstrated statistical significance in the adult group's marginal test.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with increased type 2 diabetes risk in some populations, linking it specifically to an impaired glucose-stimulated insulin release.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: ZNF259 harbored this SNP, which was also identified as a shared signal across multiple FA traits, indicating its role in fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The SNP was found in the FADS1 gene and was noted as a potential causal variant associated with several FA traits, including its influence on gene expression for MYRF.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified within CPT1A, this SNP was recognized for its colocalization potential with FA traits and associated with significant metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: In the SBF2 gene locus, this SNP was recognized as potentially causal for FA-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Located in DGKZ, this SNP was linked to several molecular phenotypes including chromatin accessibility and histone modification.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was associated with omega-3% and was noted for its joint influence on multiple molecular phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Reported in relation to omega-3/omega-6 ratios indicating its significant association with FA traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Linked to multiple molecular phenotypes related to omega-3 PUFAs.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified in association analyses related to various fatty acid metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This locus had been reported in previous meta-analyses involving Japanese and European cohorts, indicating its association with atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Linked with atopic dermatitis, this SNP is intronic to SIK3, suggesting relevance in skin barrier dysfunction and inflammation.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs28737416 T allele was associated with lower CSF concentrations of TNF and IFNγ, and with higher susceptibility to TBM (OR 1.24, 95% CI 1.03, 1.49; p=0.021). Furthermore, the T/T and T/C genotypes were linked to a significantly higher mortality rate from TBM compared to the C/C genotype, as found in a Vietnamese cohort.
title: MUC5AC genetic variation is associated with tuberculosis meningitis CSF cytokine responses and mortality

finding: The study identified the rs10732516 polymorphism at the IGF2/H19 locus as associated with genotype-specific trends in placental DNA methylation. This finding was particularly relevant for prenatally alcohol-exposed newborns, where the polymorphism influenced not only placental DNA methylation patterns but also had implications on head circumference measurements. Furthermore, the association of this SNP with placental DNA methylation and birth weight was confirmed in another study involving newborns conceived by assisted reproductive technology.
title: Chromatin remodeler developmental pluripotency associated factor 4 (DPPA4) is a candidate gene for alcohol-induced developmental disorders

finding: The rs1799963 SNP, linked to Prothrombin G20210A, was also considered a risk variant for inherited thrombophilia, contributing similarly to doubling the risk of VTE in Covid-19 patients.
title: Venous Thromboembolism in Ambulatory Covid-19 patients: Clinical and Genetic Determinants

finding: The MUC5B promoter variant rs35705950 was identified as the strongest common risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). It was found that individuals carrying one copy of the disease allele had a fivefold increased odds of developing pulmonary fibrosis compared to those with no copies, and those with two copies had a twentyfold increased odds. This variant is significant in understanding the role of MUC5B expression in IPF risk.
title: The causal relationship between gastro-esophageal reflux disease and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP represented a significant eQTL in the gene MADD in brain tissues, which is involved in neuronal cell death and highlighted its importance in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was linked to CELF1 and showed weak correlation with eQTLs for MADD, suggesting its role in the network of genes associated with AD.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: Associated with COVID-19 hospitalization and critical illness, demonstrating genome-wide significance in the meta-analysis.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The rs45550635 variant in the gene CSRP3 was found to be associated with increased straincirc and left ventricular ejection fraction. This missense variant, which is rare (MAF 0.5%), relates to cardiomyopathy, particularly hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), and had not been previously identified in GWAS.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: The rs4755720/HSD17B12 variant was associated with BMI, HDL-C, T2DM, CAD, as well as showing connectivity with LV end-diastolic volume indexed to body surface area, indicating its relevance in HF traits.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: Both the admixture mapping (AM) and GWAS approaches identified the association of rs73398698 with 'Sickle Cell Anemia' in Hispanic Latinos, although the odds ratio was notably higher for the GWAS association, indicating a stronger effect.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The SNP rs35705950 was identified as a common variant in the promoter region of the MUC5B gene, which was the largest genetic risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) with an odds ratio greater than 4. Notably, this allele was associated with increased IPF risk but was protective for severe COVID-19, indicating that while related to IPF, its influence on COVID-19 severity was in the opposite direction.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: The sentinel variant rs77599934 was associated with an increased risk of COVID-19 hospitalization (Odds Ratio [OR]=2.27, 95% Confidence Interval [CI]=1.70-3.04, p=2.26×10^-8). This variant was noted as a novel risk locus located in the DDIAS gene.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: Found in super variant chr11_114 (OR=1.321, p=7.03×10−7), which was associated with COVID-19 related mortality. It is located in the NCAM1 gene, relevant for immune response.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This intronic variant for gene ZBTB16 was part of a super variant linked to COVID-19 mortality (OR=1.321, p=7.03×10−7), suggesting its impact on immune function.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The rs1126809 SNP, representing the TYR:c.1205G>A (p.Arg402Gln) variant, was identified to significantly increase the probability of receiving a diagnosis of albinism when present in combination with the OCA2 variant in a heterozygous state, with an odds ratio of 12.8. This finding originated from data analysis conducted on individuals with albinism.
title: The co-occurrence of genetic variants in the TYR and OCA2 genes confers susceptibility to albinism

finding: The SNP rs35705950 located at locus 11p15.5 was associated with IPF, showing a remarkable P-value of 2.09×10−25 and an OR of 2.94 (95% CI = 2.40, 3.60). This variant is well-known for its role in the promoter region of MUC5B, emphasizing its significance in IPF pathogenesis.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs61869029, related to BRSK2, showed significant associations in H-MAGMA analyses, linked to neuron polarization and axonogenesis, indicating its relevance in the midbrain for sensation seeking traits.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: This SNP was associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids and was located in the gene TMEM258. It contributed to significant associations with various metabolic traits, particularly those related to lipoproteins and blood cell counts.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: This SNP was linked to the RP11-355N15 antisense gene and was significantly associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids, further contributing to understanding associations in metabolic traits.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: The common variant rs72918674 in the MS4A gene region was identified as the most significant locus influencing sTREM2 levels. This SNP was noted for its robust association with altered CSF sTREM2 levels.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The secondary signal rs10897026 located within the MS4A4A intron showed significant association with altered sTREM2 levels, adding to the list of SNPs affecting TREM2 biology, confirming its regulatory significance.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The missense variant rs583791 (p.A112T) in the MS4A6A gene was validated for its role in modulating sTREM2 levels and related to Alzheimer’s disease risk through epistatic effects.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs6591561 (p.M178V) in MS4A4A was confirmed to impact CSF sTREM2 levels and its associated risk for Alzheimer's disease was corroborated through significant findings in the study.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The C allele of rs12252 in the IFITM3 gene was identified as a genetic risk factor for COVID-19 hospitalization and severe outcomes, known for inhibiting influenza virus entry into host cells.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs11246066 (A) allele frequency, linked to increased IFITM3 expression, was significantly observed in the Indian population, suggesting modulation of susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The variant rs9666637's frequency in the Indian population was highest amongst all groups, associated with increased IFITM2 expression and possibly lower COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency of rs7931303 was found relevant for IFITM2 expression regarding COVID-19 susceptibility, displaying a significant pattern in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Frequency of rs1042838 was found significantly different in the Indian population and is associated with reduced ACE2 transcript stability affecting viral susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The G allele frequency of rs6598045 in IFITM3 gene was identified, suggesting an association with decreased fatality in COVID-19 cases.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Associated with expression of <italic>C1QTNF4</italic>, this sentinel variant at 11p11.2 suggested genetic links influencing lung cancer risk.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This SNP was identified as an eQTL for the <italic>CHEK1</italic> gene and showed an increased association with lung squamous cell carcinomas, indicating its role in DNA repair mechanisms related to lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs1800057-G in the ATM gene was associated with an increased risk for CHIP, presenting an odds ratio (OR) of 1.28 (95% CI: 1.18-1.37) and a significant p-value of 1.3 x 10^-10. The risk allele was predicted to be deleterious by functional annotation tools.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The SNP rs2237892 was associated with placental weight (PW) and showed a strong parent-of-origin effect (POE), specifically carried by the maternally transmitted allele, aligning with maternal-only expression observed in nearby imprinted genes.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: The SNP rs234864 was reported to have a maternal-transmitted effect only on birth weight (BW), indicating distinct associations between this SNP and placental weight.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: The SNP rs174546, located within the FADS gene cluster, was linked to variations in long-chain omega-3 fatty acid levels, suggesting a potentially protective role against schizophrenia. This relationship was highlighted in the context of omega-3 fatty acids, particularly docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), which indicated a lower risk of schizophrenia (ORIVW: 0.83, 95% CI: 0.75-0.92).
title: Causal associations between fatty acid measures and schizophrenia – a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This variant was noted with a probability of causality of 0.70, found near the hemoglobin gene cluster on chromosome 11, which is crucial for understanding genetic influences on fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: In East Asian analysis, this SNP reached genome-wide significance for beta thalassemia (p=2.43e-14, MAF=0.002, OR=58.56), demonstrating its strong association.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The promoter variant rs35705950:G>T in MUC5B showed a decreased risk for COVID-19 severity (OR = 0.50, P = 3.9 × 10^-80).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: This missense variant in SORL1 was significantly associated with proxy Alzheimer’s disease, causing a serine to leucine substitution (p.S602L) in a conserved region. It had a CADD score of 26.2, indicating a high likelihood of pathogenicity.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Identified as significant in SORL1, this missense variant resulted in a glutamine to histidine substitution (p.Q614H), with a CADD score of 24.2, predicted to affect protein stability.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This rare variant in SORL1 was linked to proxy Alzheimer’s disease. It caused a stop codon (p.W450*) in exon 9, signifying a possible implication in disease pathogenesis.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This missense variant was also significantly associated with proxy Alzheimer’s disease, leading to an amino acid change but without clear evidence for impacting protein function.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The previously unreported missense variant rs7110845 (p.His154Arg) was associated with psoriasis at the POU2F3 locus (P=2.3×10^-13) and was connected to keratinocyte differentiation.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The variant rs610932 in the gene MS4A6A was identified as correlating with decreased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding was supported by several meta-analyses. Furthermore, colocalization analysis revealed that this variant shared causal effects with other loci, enhancing its relevance to AD. A transcriptome-wide association study (TWAS) indicated that increased expression of MS4A6A in monocytes was associated with AD risk, and a DNA methylation study suggested that this expression might mediate AD risk. Additionally, MS4A6A was noted for its involvement in atherosclerosis and its differential association with various classes of lipids between AD cases and controls.
title: Local genetic covariance analysis with lipid traits identifies novel loci for early-onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs1800497 SNP in the ANKK1 locus displayed a significant association with LiD (Beta = 0.24, p = 8.89 × 10^-3), contributing to the genetic variability influencing LiD in the studied population.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs6265 SNP was found to be associated with LiD in the BDNF locus, showing a Beta of 0.19 (p = 4.95 × 10^-2), indicating its contribution to the risk of developing dyskinesia.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10750025 was identified as the top genetic variant associated with the common liability to addiction. It was located on the dopamine receptor D2 gene (DRD2), which supports the role of dopamine in the risk of addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study
