finding: The SNP rs35023999 was included in the 42 SNPs associated with common liability to addiction, suggesting a role in the genetics of addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The DRD2 SNP rs1801028 showed significant correlations with PANSS negative symptoms in African American patients.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Variants at the DRD2 locus, specifically rs1125394, were associated with improved response to clozapine, indicating a role in treatment efficacy.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs2514218 was associated with decreased expression of the DRD2 gene in the caudate nucleus, which was considered a counterintuitive result given the gene's known function in dopamine signaling and schizophrenia. This finding indicated a potential mechanism of increased genetic risk for schizophrenia through the modulation of presynaptic dopamine release.
title: Genetic and environmental regulation of caudate nucleus transcriptome: insight into schizophrenia risk and the dopamine system

finding: The rs1531249 variant demonstrated associations with both volumetric and shape measures of the brain, reaffirming its role in influencing brain structure.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Analysis of rs34077344 revealed relationships with brain shape features, reinforcing its earlier associations with brain volumes.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The study highlighted rs10892133’s relationship with brain shape, corroborating its previous links to brain volume metrics.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This SNP was linked to sleep traits, adding depth to the understanding of its impact on brain structure and health.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This intronic signal associated with decreasing height at SLC12A1 had an allele frequency of 0.0002, with known associations to height and Bartter syndrome. It illustrated the potential for identifying rare non-coding mutations impacting phenotypes.
title: A Genomics England haplotype reference panel and the imputation of the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs11031006 at the 11p14.1 locus was connected to FSHB for multiple gynecological traits through a single-cell multimodal pituitary dataset. This linkage showcased the variant's role in follicle-stimulating hormone production, critical for ovarian function, which could not be established by other bulk-based methods.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The intronic variant rs1591491477 was linked to the ATM gene, which is associated with hereditary cancer-predisposing syndrome. This finding was part of the study's broader examination of non-coding variants linked to clinically reported mutations, enhancing the understanding of genetic contributions to Mendelian diseases.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The SNP rs10736549, located within the CNTN5 gene, was identified as a female-specific locus associated with neuroticism, reaching genome-wide significance.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The rs72995548 locus, situated within multiple genes including HSPB2, was identified as female-specific and reached genome-wide significance for neuroticism.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead variant for an eQTL for DGAT2, with the gout risk allele correlating to decreased expression in blood.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The risk allele of rs61897795 G-allele associated with increased expression of FADS2 in blood, highlighting its importance in inflammatory processes related to gout.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: For the type 2 diabetes candidate causal variant rs571342427, pancreatic islet cells and pancreatic beta cells were inferred as high confidence cell types, with the insulin gene (INS) identified as a target gene. This result highlighted the importance of these cell types and the gene in the context of type 2 diabetes.
title: Inferring causal cell types of human diseases and risk variants from candidate regulatory elements

finding: The ATM variant c.7271T>G (rs28904921) was described as rare but globally widespread, with a strong association to breast cancer, as noted in the context of the ORCADES research cohort.
title: Two founder variants account for over 90% of pathogenic BRCA alleles in Orkney and Shetland

finding: The SNP rs7934107-T in the CADM1 gene was found to be associated with the behavior of 'working up a sweat'. This association extended previous knowledge of genetic influences on physical activity behavior.
title: Genome-wide association study of liking of physical activity in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6589488-A also located in the CADM1 gene was previously associated with anorexia nervosa, highlighting the genetic correlations between dietary behaviors and physical activity-liking traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of liking of physical activity in the UK Biobank

finding: Identified as associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting a genetic contribution to less aggressive forms of the disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Associated with T2D, this SNP exhibited a higher odds ratio of 1.89, further supporting its relevance to T2D pathogenesis.
title: Rare variants of the glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP1R) gene are overrepresented in a severe obesity cohort and associated with type 2 diabetes in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs35705950:G>T located in the promoter of MUC5B was found to be protective against hospitalization (OR = 0.83, P = 6.5 × 10^-9), and it was noted for its role in increasing expression in lung tissue and its association with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: In the HA cohort, the rs35705950 variant was associated with alveolar or parietoalveolar pneumonitis. Previous studies established the rs35705950-T allele's connection to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, suggesting it acts as a protective variant for COVID-19.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The rs964184 SNP, associated with ZPR1, was found to have a significant interaction effect with sex, affecting VLDL cholesterol concentrations specifically in women. This finding suggests its role as a risk factor for metabolic syndrome and coronary artery disease (CAD), as well as indicating significant sex-dependent effects that emphasize the need for further research on gender differences in metabolic health.
title: Pleiotropic and sex-specific genetic architecture of circulating metabolic markers

finding: The MUC5B promoter variant rs35705950 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and was identified as the strongest known genetic risk factor for interstitial lung abnormalities (ILA) and RA-related interstitial lung disease (RA-ILD). In the analysis, RA cases exhibited a higher odds ratio of 4.15 (95% CI 2.17 to 7.97) for ILA compared to non-RA comparators, and for those with RA, the odds ratio for fibrotic ILA was significantly higher at 9.26 (95% CI 3.82 to 22.44). These findings highlighted the importance of the rs35705950 variant in the context of RA and interstitial lung disease.
title: Prevalence and mortality associations of interstitial lung abnormalities in rheumatoid arthritis within a multicenter prospective cohort of smokers

finding: This SNP was linked to heart failure by affecting a protein-coding sequence in a new locus, contributing to our understanding of HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Associated with heart failure through its missense mutation role in MYBPC3, highlighting a key domain for protein interactions relevant to HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Tagged the missense variant in MYBPC3 which is critical for understanding heart failure mechanisms.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs174572 was highlighted as a significant SNP within the FADS2 locus with a probability of inclusion above 0.50 in a credible set in the East Asian dataset including self-report data. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors involved in bipolar disorder.
title: Genetic diversity enhances gene discovery for bipolar disorder

finding: SNP rs174564, located in the FADS2 gene, was recognized as a major shared causal variant between circulating PUFA levels and bipolar disorder. The A allele was associated with increased DHA% (β = 0.28, P < 1 × 10^-300) and omega-3% (β = 0.39, P < 1 × 10^-300), along with a reduced risk for bipolar disorder (OR = 0.93, P = 6.24 × 10^-13).
title: Shared genetic basis informs the roles of polyunsaturated fatty acids in brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs3817334 was associated with BMI and was also found to be a mQTL variant associated with the CpG cg17580616 and an eQTL variant associated with gene ACP2, showing a probability of colocalization H4 of 100%.
title: Expression quantitative trait methylation analysis elucidates gene regulatory effects of DNA methylation: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The SNP rs10838738 was associated with BMI and was identified as a mQTL variant for the CpG cg17580616 and an eQTL variant for gene ACP2, indicating a probability of colocalization H4 of 100%.
title: Expression quantitative trait methylation analysis elucidates gene regulatory effects of DNA methylation: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The SNP rs1064608 was associated with BMI and was linked to CpG cg17580616 as a mQTL variant and gene ACP2 as an eQTL variant, with a probability of colocalization H4 of 100%.
title: Expression quantitative trait methylation analysis elucidates gene regulatory effects of DNA methylation: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The SNP rs12790261, located in an intron of the KDM2A gene, was found to be associated with pulmonary function parameters in Europeans.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The SNP rs174573, which is a missense variant in the FADS2 gene, was significantly associated with hypothyroidism (P_hypothyroidism=1.30e-07) and chronic sinusitis (P_chronic sinusitis=1.04e-07). This finding suggests that rs174573 may be involved in common pathways related to these comorbidities.
title: Shared genetic etiology between hypothyroidism and complex diseases: a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs12806363, located in the intron of the RPS6KA4 gene, was found to be significantly associated with both hypothyroidism (P_hypothyroidism=6.4e-08) and sarcoidosis (P_sarcoidosis=1.52e-06). This highlights its potential role in the shared genetic architecture of these conditions.
title: Shared genetic etiology between hypothyroidism and complex diseases: a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The variant rs7481951 in the ANO5 gene was linked to adult-onset muscular dystrophy, with an effect size of 0.05 and a significant role in regulating cTnI levels.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs312777 was identified as an intronic variant at the LRP5 gene locus, which was exclusively linked to preterm delivery. It showed a significant association, with a p-value of 6.6×10−9. This SNP also demonstrated weak evidence of association with gestational duration (p-value = 3.9×10−3), indicating it likely influenced mechanisms involved only in early parturition.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The SNP rs174576, located near FADS1/2, was associated with higher biosynthesis rates of polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA), which in turn, were linked to higher odds of several cardiovascular diseases, particularly ischemic stroke, peripheral artery disease, and venous thromboembolism.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs174546, situated in the FADS1/2 locus, was found to be related to lower levels of shorter chain omega-3 (ALA) and omega-6 (LA) fatty acids, while being associated with increased concentrations of longer chain omega-3 (DHA) and omega-6 (AA) fatty acids, and showed pleiotropic effects on various non-fatty acid traits including lipid and glycaemic traits.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1582763 was identified as an intergenic variant in the MS4A locus associated with reduced risk for Alzheimer disease (AD) and higher cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) soluble TREM2 levels. Carriers of the rs1582763-A allele showed a trend for decreased proportions of nuclei in the activated microglia state (Mic.1) and increased proportions in a proinflammatory microglia state (Mic.3), suggesting its influence on microglial activation states in the context of AD. A gene ontology analysis indicated the involvement of cytokine response and lipopolysaccharide response pathways, reflecting the SNP's role in modulating neuroinflammation in AD.
title: A landscape of the genetic and cellular heterogeneity in Alzheimer disease

finding: It was strongly associated with beta Thalassaemia (ICD10: D56) despite its low frequency in non-Finnish Europeans (AF=0.005%). It introduces a premature stop codon affecting beta-globin production.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The splice site variant was shown to be associated with lower corpuscular hemoglobin concentration, primarily detected in South Asians (AF=0.4%).
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The C allele of SNP rs907612, previously associated with monocyte abundance, increased the expression of the lymphocyte specific protein 1 (LSP1) and decreased the expression of IFITM10, evidencing the SNP's regulatory roles on different gene expressions.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs968567 was associated with the expression of FEN1, FADS1, and FADS2, linking it to the regulation of fatty acid metabolism and illustrating the complexity of genetic relationships in metabolic processes.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: This SNP was linked to the MUS81 gene, which is essential for telomere recombination via ALT, demonstrating its role in maintaining telomere integrity.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The study identified rs174564 as a significant factor driving the causal association between polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and cerebral aneurysm (CA). This conclusion was reached through a series of sensitivity analyses including the leave-one-out method, which indicated that removing rs174564 and nearby SNPs within 500 kb of the FADS2 locus resulted in all p-values exceeding 0.0033, suggesting that rs174564 was pivotal in establishing the causal link to cerebral aneurysm.
title: Predicting the causal relationship between polyunsaturated fatty acids and cerebral aneurysm risk from a Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was identified as significant in the context of NAFLD for African Americans, showcasing its relevance to the disease within that group.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was associated with NAFLD as a coding missense variant reaching genome-wide significance.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs1944862, which tagged the deletion of <italic>OR4P1P</italic>, was connected to an HR of 2.341 for late rejection, highlighting its role as a risk factor for LT complications.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The SNP rs11031005 was associated with early age at first birth but higher risk of genitourinary system diseases and early age at menopause, suggesting a genetic trade-off in reproductive traits.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs11218343 was associated with the hub gene SORL1, indicating its possible involvement in AD.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The missense SNP rs140201358, situated in PNPLA2, encodes adipose triglyceride lipase, essential for triglyceride hydrolysis in the liver. Its deficiency leads to hepatic steatosis.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: For type 2 diabetes, the SNP rs234866 was fine-mapped with a PIP of 0.97 and linked by cS2G to the target gene CDKN1C with a linking score of 1.00, demonstrating its strong association with type 2 diabetes.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: Similarly, for type 2 diabetes, rs74046911 was fine-mapped with a PIP of 0.92 and also linked by cS2G to CDKN1C, indicating its relevance in the disease through strong linkage.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: This SNP was associated with traits related to the female reproductive system, including endometriosis and ovarian cysts. It is also linked with abnormal pregnancy weight gain and was validated as a significant risk locus for HG.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: This SNP is a risk locus for HG located in PGR and was found to be in linkage with the risk locus for preeclampsia.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: Detected as one of the novel pleiotropic SNPs, rs11018564 was included in the analysis showing associations with age-related ocular disorders.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: This SNP was replicated as part of the pleiotropic analysis investigating genetic correlations among ocular conditions.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: Discovered as a credible variant in the pleiotropic loci, rs10898526 was predicted to interact with the ME3 gene, which is involved in metabolic processes linked to macular thickness.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs35705950 was implicated in prior associations with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), and the association for rs779167905 with chronic sputum production was shown to be independent of this variant.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The SNP rs11603634 was previously associated with moderate-to-severe asthma, influencing the findings related to the chronic sputum production signal in this study.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: This variant was found in the MUC5B locus and was noted for conferred protective effects for interstitial lung diseases (ILDs) despite being a risk factor for COVID-19.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The study found that homozygous carriers of the rs580382 CC genotype had a significant reduction in AD risk, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 0.31 (95% CI: 0.17-0.57, p<0.001). This association was observed within the context of increased circulating CD34+CD133+ endothelial progenitor cells, specifically in individuals with vascular pathologies.
title: Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cells Reduce the Risk of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs4144611 TT genotype carriers were found to have a significant reduction in AD risk, demonstrated by a HR of 0.29 (95% CI: 0.15-0.57, p<0.001). Similar to rs580382, this relationship was significant when accompanied by high levels of CD34+CD133+ endothelial progenitor cells in participants with cerebrovascular pathologies.
title: Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cells Reduce the Risk of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The common nonsynonymous variant rs6265 in the BDNF gene caused a Val66Met substitution, which was highly significantly associated with BMI (SLP = -21.86) in the analyzed sample. This variant had previously been linked to anorexia nervosa and minimum BMI in affected patients, and it showed a per-allele effect size of -0.19 on BMI.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200 000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects characterises effects of rare genetic variants on BMI

finding: This SNP in the MS4A6A locus was associated with AD and recognized among the significant SNPs impacting AD risk.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs11605427 was found to have associations with AD, contributing to the genetic understanding of MS4A6A in AD susceptibility.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: This SNP was identified among the significant variants in the MS4A6A locus linked to AD risk, emphasizing its importance in the genetic factors of AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs610932 was noted to have associations with AD, strengthening the evidence of MS4A6A's role in AD susceptibility.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: This SNP was included in the significant variants of the MS4A6A locus associated with AD, highlighting its relevance in genetic studies related to AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: In the MS4A6A locus, rs1286289 was significantly associated with AD, showcasing protective effects according to findings.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: Similar to HGFAC, this locus was implicated for the first time by the newly identified coding variant in RELA, which showed a low linkage disequilibrium (r2 = 0.002) with the previously reported SNP.
title: Sequencing of over 100,000 individuals identifies multiple genes and rare variants associated with Crohns disease susceptibility

finding: At the MTNR1B locus, rs10830963 was found to have a posterior probability exceeding 0.9, suggesting its strong candidacy as a causal variant for T2D.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs149580940 in FIBIN was positively associated with FVC (P=7.89×10^-10, β=0.0449). No previous associations were mentioned.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs968567 within the FADS2 gene showed a significant association with serum IgA levels (Beta=0.12, P=2.42×10^-41), further linking it to immune system regulation.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: This SNP at the TMEM258-FADS2 locus was associated with IgA levels, yielding a Beta of 0.07 and a P-value of 3.60×10^-29.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs10896045 was associated with IgA nephropathy, having a Beta of 0.07 and P=2.57×10^-22, indicating its relevance in immune disorders.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs4938518 at the POU2AF1 locus exhibited a significant connection with IgA levels, displaying a Beta of 0.056 and P=7.01×10^-16, drawing attention to its role in B-cell responses.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs3729989 was recorded as a variant in the MYBPC3 gene, which is associated with known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs3794153 was also identified as a novel locus with a CADD score above 20, indicating potential pathogenicity.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs683250 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with all rare variants in the DLG2 region associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This variant was previously linked to increases in shape asymmetry when comparing controls to demented populations, and this association was contextually important as it suggests a potential role of DLG2 in AD-related phenotypic variations.
title: Region-based analysis of rare genomic variants in whole-genome sequencing datasets reveal two novel Alzheimer’s disease-associated genes: DTNB and DLG2

finding: The SNP rs286043 exhibited suggestive evidence of association with AD risk in the International Genomics of Alzheimer's Project (IGAP) with a P-value of 5e-06. This variant was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with 4 out of 10 variants from the DLG2 region identified as associated with AD in this study, indicating a potential allelic heterogeneity in the context of AD.
title: Region-based analysis of rare genomic variants in whole-genome sequencing datasets reveal two novel Alzheimer’s disease-associated genes: DTNB and DLG2

finding: Similar to rs11066188, the SNP rs10840606 was classified as an outlier by MR-PRESSO without distorting the results from the estimates. This SNP was relevant in the context of assessing the positive association between adult BMI and LADA, as results post-outlier exclusion were comparable to those from IVW.
title: Birth weight, BMI in adulthood and latent autoimmune diabetes in adults: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was identified as a high LD variant regulating gene expression and was associated with metabolic pathways affecting liver conditions, indicating its potential relevance in cALT risk.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs76201528 was identified as the lead SNP for the locus PANX1, which presented a highly significant p-value of 3.93e-350. This finding established the association of PANX1 with cfDNA features in the study.
title: cfGWAS reveal genetic basis of cell-free DNA features

finding: The SNP rs1946143444 was identified in the replication of the PANX1 locus, with a p-value of 6.31e-10. Despite being an insertion-deletion type and not analyzed in the discovery study, its replication provided strong evidence for the association with cfDNA.
title: cfGWAS reveal genetic basis of cell-free DNA features

finding: At the 11q22 locus, rs3018700 was identified near genes PGR and TRPC6, with significant implications for progesterone signaling and vascular function during pregnancy.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: At the HEM3 locus (rs1006195), a trivariate GWAS signal was detected involving PAD, CAD, and smoking (trivariate P=1.9×10^-9). This locus was previously associated with several cardiometabolic traits, highlighting its importance in atherosclerosis.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The variant rs163184 was associated with a lesser response to treatment in Chinese patients, suggesting it could be a biomarker for glycemic response to exenatide.
title: Precision medicine in type 2 diabetes: A systematic review of treatment effect heterogeneity for GLP1-receptor agonists and SGLT2-inhibitors

finding: The locus rs1351522, found on chromosome 11, was recognized as a significant finding associated with AN. It also overlapped with the findings related to BMI, indicating genetic links between these conditions.
title: An Evolutionary Perspective on the Genetics of Anorexia Nervosa

finding: The SNP rs34445652 on chromosome 11 was identified as significant in the overlap between AN and BMI. This underscores its relevance in understanding the genetic basis of both conditions.
title: An Evolutionary Perspective on the Genetics of Anorexia Nervosa

finding: The SNP rs80356779 in the gene CPT1A was associated with lower plasma levels of 55 proteins, indicating a significant impact on systemic inflammation and cardiovascular markers, related to its known role in fatty acid modulation.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: At the CPS1-ERBB4 locus, the lead SNP rs75472842 showed that an extra copy of the T allele decreased glycine levels in maternal plasma by 60.92 µmol/L, marking a significant finding related to amino acid metabolism in pregnant women.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The VSTM5-HEPHL1 locus (lead SNP rs16919711) indicated a decrease in homocysteine levels by 0.08, providing insights into cardiovascular disease biomarkers.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The intergenic SLC29A2-NPAS4 locus (lead SNP rs11227478) was novelly associated with sarcosine levels, presenting new insights into amino acid metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The FOLR1-FOLR2 loci (lead SNP rs35954619) was novelly associated with 5-methyltetrahydrofolate, suggesting its relevance in folate metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The PDE3B locus (lead SNP rs10766189) showed a known association with 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3 levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The DHCR7 locus (lead SNP rs12789751) confirmed a known relationship with vitamin D levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The FDX1 locus (lead SNP rs1073527) was associated with 11-Deoxycortisol levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The APOA5 locus (lead SNP rs3741298) was also associated with other metabolic pathways.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP, an intronic variant in the GALNT18 gene, replicated in two fully independent populations and was specifically associated with the Hospitalized/Not_Hospitalized phenotype. Its association complements previous findings relating to modulation of the IL-6 pathway, suggesting a potential strategy for treating severe COVID-19.
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: The SNP rs12420134 was significantly associated with hyper-arousal in individuals with PTSD, particularly linked to the SOX6 gene, which plays a critical role in the development of the central nervous system. This association highlighted the gene's potential relevance in PTSD-related symptoms.
title: Mapping the epigenomic landscape of post-traumatic stress disorder in human cortical neurons

finding: The SNP rs1800497 was implicated in PTSD through its association with the DRD2 gene, where previous studies suggested a link between dopamine receptor polymorphisms and various psychiatric disorders, including PTSD. This finding indicated the relevance of dopamine pathways in PTSD pathology.
title: Mapping the epigenomic landscape of post-traumatic stress disorder in human cortical neurons

finding: Evidence from previous studies suggested an interaction between the C-allele of rs174575 in the FADS2 gene and breastfeeding status, leading to higher IQ in breastfed children carrying the C-allele compared to GG homozygotes. However, the current study failed to replicate this finding, showing that additional copies of the C allele were associated with decreased verbal-numerical reasoning instead.
title: No evidence of interaction between FADS2 genotype and breastfeeding on cognitive or other traits in the UK Biobank

finding: Initial studies indicated potential interactions between the G-allele of rs1535 and breastfeeding affecting cognitive outcomes, similar to those seen in rs174575. The current study corroborated that rs1535 associated with cognitive traits, including verbal-numerical reasoning, but found no significant interaction with breastfeeding when population structure was controlled.
title: No evidence of interaction between FADS2 genotype and breastfeeding on cognitive or other traits in the UK Biobank

finding: Previous findings hinted at an association between rs174583 and cognitive function in relation to breastfeeding, tracking with rs174575 and rs1535. In contrast, the current study also identified an effect of rs174583 on verbal-numerical reasoning, but no interaction with breastfeeding was validated after adjusting for confounding factors.
title: No evidence of interaction between FADS2 genotype and breastfeeding on cognitive or other traits in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs35705950 variant at the MUC5B locus had a notable association with idiopathic fibrosing alveolitis (IPF), presenting an OR of 2.83 (p=4.12 × 10^-191). This finding indicated a significant relationship between this SNP and severe respiratory conditions.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was identified as a cis-pQTL for MMP1.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs674379 showed an association with CD5, illustrating its role in cis-pQTL.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: This SNP was associated with IL18, making it a key cis-pQTL.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs11024102 variant was classified as associated with primary angle closure glaucoma predominantly in East Asian populations, highlighting disease subtype influences on overall associations.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs2276035 variant was discussed in the context of significant associations with susceptibility to POAG and PACG shared loci.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs499684 was linked to prostate and testis expressed protein 4 (PATE4), significant only in males. This protein has been reported to play a role in male fertility, particularly in copulatory plug formation.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The G allele of rs702966 was found to be associated with increased mortality risk in African-American subjects with COVID-19, demonstrating its role as a risk factor related to lower circulating type I IFN levels.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: The TT genotype of rs4963128 was associated with protection from mortality in acute COVID-19 in African-American subjects, linking higher type I IFN levels with better outcomes.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs2237884, located within the INS, IGF2, and KCNQ1 loci, showed no association with either the AFR-EAS or AFR-EUR axes, indicating similarity in allelic effects across African, East Asian, and European ancestry groups, all reporting an odds ratio (OR) of 1.03. However, the heterogeneity for this signal was attributed to associations with the third axis of genetic variation which separates Hispanic and South Asian groups (OR of 1.01 for HIS and 0.97 for SAS).
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide study in >2.5 million individuals reveals heterogeneity in mechanistic pathways of type 2 diabetes and complications

finding: The variant rs34598529 within the HBB gene was linked to lower MCH, MCV, and hematocrit (HCT). Its association was replicated in multiple independent studies, affirming its role in influencing erythrocyte parameters.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs11549407 variant, a loss-of-function variant within HBB, showed significant association with multiple RBC traits in TOPMed and was corroborated in previous studies regarding its effects on MCH, HGB, and related traits.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This variant located in HBB contributed to lower RBC metrics, reinforcing previously established results in population genetics.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs33915217 variant was recognized for its association with HB and related RBC performance metrics, reaffirming findings from historical data.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The study reported that carriers of the G allele of IFITM3 rs6598045 had an increased risk of mortality when infected by the SARS-CoV-2 delta variant. This finding highlighted the role of host genetic determinants, specifically the rs6598045 SNP, in influencing COVID-19 severity outcomes.
title: Integration of human organoids single-cell transcriptomic profiles and human genetics repurposes critical cell type-specific drug targets for severe COVID-19

finding: The study found that the MUC5B gene polymorphism, specifically the rs35705950-T variant, conferred protective effects against COVID-19 hospitalization. However, it did not show an impact on severe disease or mortality. This finding was significant in understanding genetic influences on COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Cohort Profile of the Chilean COVID-19 Biorepository: a Multicentric initiative for multi-omics research on COVID-19 and LONG-COVID in a Latin American population

finding: The SNP rs10830963, located in the MTNR1B locus, was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) at genome-wide significance (p=4.3×10−54). This SNP was also associated with higher fasting plasma glucose and 1-hour plasma glucose in pregnant women, as well as having implications for offspring birth weight.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs612611 in the 11q13.3 region showed an inverse association with multiple cancers (OR=0.90, P=2.3x10^-8). This association remained stable across analyses but was not genome-wide significant.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs7110099, located near the insulin-insulin like growth factor 2 gene (INS-IGF2), exhibited a potentially protective effect on Parkinson's disease (PD) risk as indicated by a Wald ratio odds ratio of 0.95 (95% CI 0.89-1.00, p=0.055). This finding was part of a broader analysis exploring the association between type 1 diabetes (T1D) and PD.
title: Potential protective link between type I diabetes and Parkinson’s disease risk and progression

finding: Genetically decreased levels of B3GAT1 were associated with increased prostate cancer risk, with a MR effect size of -0.080 and a p-value of 1.9x10^-7; rs78760579 showed significant cis association (p=3.7x10^-8) and was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs878987.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: This SNP was implicated as a lead variant in a large case-control prostate cancer GWAS with a p-value of 4.8x10^-8 and had a significant LD relationship with rs78760579.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: This SNP was noted for its association with AAMDC through a cis-link and its impact on intrinsic epigenetic age acceleration, with an MR effect size of 0.22 and significant colocalisation evidence.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: This SNP was considered one of the 18 novel shared SNPs demonstrating a genetic correlation between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The minor allele of rs3135506 in APOA5 (p.S19W) was significantly associated with elevated median TG levels among individuals of AA, showing a moderate effect size (β=0.12). This finding aligned with prior observations in European ancestry and Hispanic populations, confirming its impact on TG metabolism in the AA population.
title: Characterizing genetic profiles for high triglyceride levels in U.S. patients of African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs11032789 in the EHF gene showed a novel association with apoprotein A (apoA), indicated by a p-value of 6.40E-10.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: SNP rs11039202 associated with SPI1 indicated significant findings with a p-value of 2.88×10^-9 during stage 3.
The SNP rs3781831 associated with SORL1 was found to be significant with a p-value of 2.85×10^-10 in stage 3 analyses.

The study established that the <italic>MUC5B</italic> promoter variant rs35705950 was a significant genetic risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) with adjusted odds ratios of 4.8 for heterozygous (GT) and 12 for homozygous (TT) carriers. The variant was found to increase airway expression of the MUC5B gene, which is implicated in the severity of lung scarring associated with both IPF and asbestosis.
title: What role for asbestos in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis? Findings from the IPF job exposures study

finding: The study also reported an association between a locus containing an African-enriched missense variant in SLC22A11 and M2 Macrophages, with a p-value of 4.55e-8 and a beta value of -0.48.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The ETS1 gene SNP rs73013527 conferred increased protection from rheumatoid arthritis when the minor allele was present.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The rs601314 variant in EFEMP2 showed a strong association with FSGS in the European-American cohort with a p-value of 8.1×10^-9 and an odds ratio of 13.24. However, this association was not replicated in African-Americans and showed a nominal p-value in Latin-Americans, indicating that the finding is less robust.
title: CR1 variants contribute to FSGS susceptibility across multiple populations

finding: The rs117071588 variant in CCDC82 was significantly associated with FSGS in the European-American group (p=4.0×10^-6, OR=11.66). However, it was absent in the African-American and Latin-American datasets, raising doubts about the strength of this association.
title: CR1 variants contribute to FSGS susceptibility across multiple populations

finding: Identified at 11q22.3-<italic>ATM</italic>, this variant was associated with overall CH susceptibility, underscoring the importance of DNA damage repair pathways in CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs10501696 mapped to the GRM5 gene was found to be significant only in females for broad depression, identifying a sex-specific marker related to the pathophysiology of major depressive disorder (MDD). This finding was part of a larger set of eleven loci that passed genome-level significance in females, illustrating potential sex-dependent genetic pathways for clinical depression.
title: A Sex-Specific Genome-Wide Association Study of Depression Phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs76377757 located in an intergenic region downstream of SLN displayed significant association with RPD, with genome-wide significance shown by a p-value of 4.3e-08. This was part of the novel findings for RPD.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: An intronic variant of NECTIN1 showed associations across all diverse populations, being associated with various cancer risks.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Near LINC01395-TMEM45B, this variant showed strong signals in association with adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This variant was linked with lung cancer susceptibility, impacting mechanisms controlled by JAML.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This exonic variant rs56009889 of ATM was associated with adenocarcinoma risk confirmed across trans-ethnic studies.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs34632468 was associated with TUD with a significant p-value of 1.04E-11, related to the DRD2 gene which is known for its role in dopamine transmission and nicotine dependence.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs9919558 was associated with TUD with a p-value of 4.44E-12, linked to the NCAM1 gene, suggesting its role in modulating dopamine signaling related to smoking.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Associated with ELF5 and CAT, this SNP showed a correlation to critical COVID-19, with implications for lung function.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: SNP rs1847134 was linked to the Phecode for Other non-epithelial cancer of skin. This finding was captured using the Gold-standard logistic regression model, signaling a significant association.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The rs11229555-G variant was found to decrease the risk of NMSC with an OR of 0.95 (95% CI 0.91-0.99), categorizing it as a validated original finding.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The lead SNP rs28624253 was located upstream of the MUC5AC gene on chromosome 11. The study found it significantly associated with pneumonia susceptibility, alongside three other mucin genes within 400 kilobases, suggesting a critical role for these mucins in pneumonia pathophysiology.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: SNP rs3838785 was confirmed to be conditionally independent of previously published BMI-risk SNPs, suggesting its potential as a novel contributor to obesity risk.
title: WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING ANALYSIS OF BODY MASS INDEX IDENTIFIES NOVEL AFRICAN ANCESTRY-SPECIFIC RISK ALLELE

finding: The analysis identified an FVC-associated SV deletion that exclusively mapped to the gene FLI1. This deletion was linked to lung function measures and pulmonary heart disease risk through phenome-wide MR and colocalization analyses, highlighting the role of FLI1 in respiratory disease-related pathways.
title: Imputation of structural variants using a multi-ancestry long-read sequencing panel enables identification of disease associations

finding: The study confirmed that the rs5128 polymorphism was associated with altered plasma levels of apolipoprotein C3 (APOC3) and lipid levels, which are important factors in metabolic diseases. This finding aligned with previous research linking APOC3 variants to metabolic syndrome and type 2 diabetes, particularly relevant for aging populations.
title: Menopause Hormone Replacement Therapy and Lifestyle Factors affect Metabolism and Immune System in the Serum Proteome of Aging Individuals

finding: The SNP rs2120430 was identified as an eQTL for CBL in melanocytes, linking it to melanoma risk and showing associations with gene expression.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs61898347 was found to have a marginal correlation with CBL expression and was part of fine-mapped variants regulating CBL.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs11217853 was associated with CBL expression as an eQTL in melanocytes, contributing to the understanding of its role in melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs61900794 was shown to regulate CBL expression via CRISPRi experiments, strengthening the connection between CBL and melanoma risk.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: Linked to the ROBO3 gene, this SNP had a p-value of 6.12×10^-17 and was noted for its involvement in axonal navigation, relevant to retinal biology.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This SNP near NCAM1 was significantly tied to impulsivity and previous associations with substance use behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: At the 11p15.4 locus, this SNP achieved suggestive significance in the replication GWAS (p=1.87×10^-6, OR=3.25), being located within an intron of TRIM22.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs950802 caused a synonymous mutation in the MS4A7 gene and was associated with spleen iron (beta=0.086, p=7.7e-26). This variant was linked to an alternative splicing event disrupting a transmembrane domain, providing insights into a potential mechanism influencing spleen iron levels.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The SNP rs7936928 was identified in the 11q24.3 region relevant to cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) volume, demonstrating a connection between heart traits and neuroanatomical features.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs11039348 was linked with multiple brain eQTL expressions and associated with mental health traits like depression and well-being.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs11222084 was identified with regional brain volumes and demonstrated associations with cardiovascular health, indicating its broad relevance across traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs7107356 was linked to various brain eQTLs, indicating its significant role in both cardiovascular risk and cognitive traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs7106434 was one of the key loci identified in the colocalization analysis between PTSD and cardiovascular traits.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs4275621 was included in the comprehensive look at genetic markers linking PTSD to cardiovascular phenotypes.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs117937125 located at the 11q23.3 locus was identified as a novel risk locus for both major depressive disorder (MDD) and myocardial infarction (MI). This SNP colocalized with quantitative traits of blood lipids (BL) and was linked to the gene ZNF259, which has been previously associated with dyslipidemia and increases the sensitivity of coronary endothelial cells to oxidative stress.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs964184 was noted for being associated with dyslipidemia and coronary artery disease, reinforcing its potential relevance in the cardiovascular context and the study of MDD comorbidity.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The variant rs35705950 was found to colocalize with the gene MUC5B specifically in lung tissue for individuals with severe COVID-19, indicating that organ specificity played a crucial role in gene expression related to disease outcomes.
title: Colocalization of expression transcripts with COVID-19 outcomes is rare across cell states, cell types and organs

finding: The SNP rs79878474 was identified as the most promising SNP associated with anxiety and depression through both mega-analysis (p=4.03E-7) and meta-analysis (p=1.13E-6). This SNP was located in the USH1C gene, which is highly expressed in the brain and plays a role in the assembly of Usher protein complexes, with mutations linked to Usher syndrome type 1C and sensorineural deafness.
title: Cross-continental environmental and genome-wide association study on children and adolescent anxiety and depression

finding: The SNP rs537626 located in the LINC01488 gene at 11q13.3 demonstrated a strong negative association with ROR-P. This SNP was originally discovered in GWAS for early onset breast cancer and was associated with a decreased risk of more aggressive breast cancer forms, despite being implicated in increased risk of ER-positive cancer as noted in an admixture mapping study involving African-American women.
title: Development and testing of a polygenic risk score for breast cancer aggressiveness

finding: The SNP rs117912622 was classified as a novel locus associated with CBC setpoints, shedding light on genetic underpinnings of blood indices.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: This SNP, located outside the 19q13.32 region, was recognized as a substantial contributor to the shared genetic risks for LOE and AD. Its relevance highlighted the complex genetic relationships involved.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Positioned near the PICALM gene, rs618679 emerged as an AD-specific risk SNP, emphasizing its distinct role in the genetic risk profile for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Similarly identified as a LOE-specific risk SNP, rs567075 was mapped to the snoU13 gene, further underscoring the genetic nuances specific to late-onset epilepsy.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The lead SNP rs3740688-T was noted for its association with increased prostate cancer risk and reduced autoimmune disease risk, particularly Hashimoto's thyroiditis, while promoting SPI1 gene expression.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: Fine-mapped for height but not significant in certain populations due to LD.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The rs35705950 SNP at the MUC5B locus was associated with a five-fold increase in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) risk. Interestingly, this risk allele (T) appeared to confer a protective effect against severe COVID-19, particularly in older adults, indicating a complex role of MUC5B in respiratory health.
title: Shared genetic etiology between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID-19 severity

finding: This SNP was implicated in maternal gestational age and associated with APLNR, a receptor important for maintaining normal placental function.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The rs12276362 SNP was associated with proteinuria in the maternal genome and was linked to the PIWIL4 gene, highlighting its relevance in preeclampsia diagnoses.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: This SNP showed correlation with the severity of proteinuria in mothers, providing insights into the genetic risks linked to preeclampsia.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The SNP rs78587207 was found to have a significant association with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), with a p-value of 5.28x10^-12 in the GWAS meta-analysis. It was located on chromosome 11q12.1 and was previously associated with several neuropsychiatric traits including schizophrenia (SCZ) and depressive symptoms. Notably, the closest gene to this SNP, CTNND1, was identified as putatively causal for OCD, based on evidence from multiple gene-based tests.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 30 obsessive-compulsive disorder associated loci

finding: The intergenic variant rs146257041, located between SLC5A12 and FIBIN, reached genome-wide significance associated with reduced survival in sepsis patients. It was identified as part of genetic variants contributing to sepsis outcomes.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Study of Survival in Patients with Sepsis

finding: This SNP overlapped a microglia specific enhancer linked to PICALM, revealing a novel association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: This SNP also overlapped a microglia specific enhancer associated with PICALM, contributing to the understanding of Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The ACTN3 R577X polymorphism was significantly associated with smaller masseter muscle volume (MMV) in men. This relationship suggests that the genotype at the ACTN3 locus could influence muscle mass characteristics, particularly in the context of sarcopenia among older adults.
title: Masseter Muscle Volume and Its Association with Sarcopenia and Muscle Determinants with Insights from ACTN3 Polymorphism in Older Japanese Adults: the Bunkyo Health Study

finding: The SNP rs2049046 was associated with job burnout, as noted in a study that reported an inverse association between job burnout and serum BDNF levels. Specifically, the study found that individuals with different genotypes of the BDNF rs2049046 polymorphism exhibited variations in sBDNF levels and their correlation to emotional exhaustion (EE) and other burnout dimensions. This connection was supported by multiple studies, including those by Sertoz et al. (2008) and He et al. (2017), which confirmed the relevance of this SNP in understanding the physiological mechanisms behind job burnout.
title: Method of combining multiple researches to determine non-infectious disease causes. Analysis of Depression and Celiac disease causes

finding: This SNP in GAB2 was shown to be involved in inflammatory signaling during tumorigenesis, facilitating cancer cell proliferation.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The intronic variant in SOX6 was noted for its potential role in apoptosis and cancer progression, with implications for skin cancer associated traits.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Located near FAM76B, it acts as an eQTL for SESN3, impacting immune responses during aging.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Associated with FADS2 and linked to higher cholesterol levels, implicating it in cancer risk through inflammatory biomarkers.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Near TPCN2, linked to pigmentation traits, indicating genetic implications on skin cancer susceptibility.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Linked with ATM, this SNP was associated with DNA damage responses relevant to skin cancer.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Identified as a missense variant in ATM, previously implicated in melanoma susceptibility.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The study identified c.33C>A mutation, associated with beta Thalassemia, as an original finding. This SNP was linked to some of the discordant cases during HPLC testing.
title: The spectrum of rare and novel indel mutations responsible for β Thalassemia in eastern India

finding: The c.47G>A mutation was identified as a notable original finding in the beta Thalassemia research, contributing to the understanding of mutation spectrum in affected patients.
title: The spectrum of rare and novel indel mutations responsible for β Thalassemia in eastern India

finding: The common IVS 1-5 mutation (NM_000518.4:c.92+5G>C) was reported to be prevalent among beta Thalassemia carriers, with a significant portion of the study population demonstrating its presence.
title: The spectrum of rare and novel indel mutations responsible for β Thalassemia in eastern India

finding: The IVS 1-1 mutation (NM_000518.4:c.92+1G>A) emerged as another significant finding associated with beta Thalassemia, highlighting its relevance in genetic screening.
title: The spectrum of rare and novel indel mutations responsible for β Thalassemia in eastern India

finding: The SNP rs7123010 was significantly associated with higher tic severity in Tourette syndrome (TS) cases, reflecting a main effect related to tic severity after correction for multiple testing (F= 7.99, P= 0.0004). The AA genotype demonstrated a positive association with tic severity.
title: Investigation of gene-environment interactions in relation to tic severity

finding: The risk allele rs10896045-A at the OVOL1/RELA gene was associated with decreased galactosylation and reduced sialylation at O-glycans. This allele was validated as a significant factor in IgAN susceptibility in a multi-ancestry GWAS.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: The SNP rs45472704 was positively associated with an IBS clinical phenotype, exhibiting an adjusted odds ratio (aOR) of 2.41 (95% CI=1.26-4.60), indicating a significant correlation with diagnosis of IBS.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs45529131 demonstrated a positive association with IBS, having an adjusted odds ratio (aOR) of 2.36 (95% CI=1.23-4.52), reinforcing its relationship with the IBS clinical phenotype.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2277296 was negatively associated with the IBS phenotype, with an adjusted odds ratio (aOR) of 0.76 (95% CI=0.62-0.93), additionally noted for impacting TREH expression levels in gastrointestinal tissues.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: Similar to rs2277296, rs2277297 showed a negative association with the IBS phenotype (aOR=0.76, 95% CI=0.62-0.93) and affected TREH expression levels, both SNPs being in strong linkage disequilibrium.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: At locus rs17748, the minor allele number was significantly associated with decreased risk of IBS-C, showing an aOR range of 0.57-0.59 (95% CIs from [0.38-0.84] to [0.40-0.87]).
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7928371 also contributed to reduced risk for IBS-C, with cumulative associations observed involving multiple loci.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The minor allele frequency at rs2276065 was linked with a decreased risk of IBS-C, supporting findings from other TREH variants.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: Variants including rs10790256 contributed to the cumulative association indicating lower odds for IBS-C.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The association of rs12225548 with decreased risk for IBS-C was noted as part of the broader analysis of TREH-related SNPs.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs10892251 was linked to both decreased risk of IBS-C and decreased sugar consumption behavior as noted in the UK Biobank dataset.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The protective allele of rs74685827 near SORL1 was enriched among centenarians, emphasizing its role in preventing AD by influencing amyloid precursor protein trafficking.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The synonymous SNV on MS4A6A was suggestive in the logistic regression as well as in the AD-age score, demonstrating its potential link to Alzheimer's disease.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The Xmn1-HBG2 SNP rs7482144 had a significant effect on HbF production, accounting for 7% of HbF variation when co-occurring with HbS, contributing to a protective effect against malaria while increasing gametocyte prevalence.
title: Fetal hemoglobin enables malaria parasite growth in sickle cells but augments production of transmission stage parasites

finding: The SNP rs1800497 in the DRD2 gene was included in the polygenic DGRS associated with ICBs in patients with Parkinson's disease. This association suggested that variations in this SNP contributed to differences in dopamine receptor activity and consequently influenced ICB manifestations when patients were treated with dopamine agonists.
title: Performance on the Balloon Analogue Risk Task and Anticipatory Response Inhibition Task is Associated with Severity of Impulse Control Behaviours in People with Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The locus was located downstream of METTL15 on chromosome 11. It showed a strong association with ADHD-CUD, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.06 and a P-value of 1.45×10^-18. This locus was also genome-wide significantly associated with ADHD and CUD, contributing to the observed genetic overlap.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant eQTL for the DRD2 gene in the cerebellar hemisphere, with a P-value of 6.5×10^-6. It was part of significant variants related to ADHD-CUD.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: Situated within a chromatin region interacting with DRD2, this variant was associated with ADHD-CUD and highlighted the involvement of dopamine in the risk of CUD and ADHD.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: The lead eQTL variant rs2455569 for ARHGAP42 demonstrated strong associations with blood pressure traits and decreased expression in aorta in CAD cases from STARNET, indicating its role in disease pathways.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs604723, an eQTL located upstream of ARHGAP42, was shown to modify ARHGAP42 expression in smooth muscle cells by affecting transcription factor binding, suggesting its functional significance in CAD.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs10737153 connected to MYEOV was associated with PRC thickness and exhibited links to breast cancer risk, suggesting shared pathways affecting both phenotypes.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs4672 was noted as a missense variant in the gene FKBP2 with a CADD score of 22.5. It was not listed in ClinVar, suggesting a unique position in the context of BD genetics.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: Identified with (p=6.7E-03), this SNP was replicated as a significant genetic factor contributing to tuberculosis in the study.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The rs1126809 variant was a missense variant in TYR and was associated with cancer types showing an odds ratio (OR) between 1.13 and 1.23, indicating its potential impact on cancer susceptibility.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: SNP rs34312154 was identified as having a high CADD score of 31, suggesting it may be potentially harmful. This SNP was associated with genes ranging from HOXB1 to HOXB8, implicating it in potential adverse genetic risk factors.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The T allele of rs35705950 was shown to be associated with increased MUC5B expression, suggesting that it is the causal SNP driving the association with severe COVID-19 and IPF, evidenced by strong colocalization analysis.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The polymorphism rs1815739 in the ACTN3 gene was associated with both lung cancer incidence and mortality. The protective effect of faster walking pace was significantly more pronounced among participants carrying a higher number of T alleles, with a P interaction value of 0.04 for both lung cancer incidence and mortality. Stratified analyses revealed that participants with the TT genotype had lower hazard ratios for incident lung cancer associated with brisk walking pace compared to those with other genotypes.
title: Endurance and power genes modify the protective effect of fast walking pace on lung cancer risk: a UK Biobank prospective cohort study

finding: The rs9787874 variant at the PICALM locus was identified as having one of the top Population Attributable Risk (PAR) estimates in individuals of Latino, East Asian, Black/African American, and European ancestries in relation to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The variant rs11604583 near TRIM51 was identified as a new common DVT variant, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.84 in the GWAS. It was replicated in the UK Biobank target cohort with OR of 0.87 and also in FinnGen with OR of 0.88. This suggests a protective effect against DVT.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The rare variant rs187725533 near CREB3L1 was linked to a 2.2-fold higher risk of DVT. It was the most significantly associated rare variant observed, with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.47 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.005, noted in 112 DVT cases.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The rs1799963 variant at the F2 locus, linked to prothrombin mutation (PTM), showed significant association with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.16, marking it as a key risk factor for DVT in the studied population.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs757081 was also identified as potentially deleterious, highlighting its role in chronic pain and pain intensity as part of the genetic landscape.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs11234902, located on chromosome 11, was found to be a novel locus for PCOS, being a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the RNA gene RP11-736K20. This implicates its relevance to the mechanisms underlying PCOS.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: The variant rs662094 at locus 11q13.2 was linked to chronotype and demonstrated colocalized effects with muscle fat infiltration.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: This SNP was highlighted in prior literature as being related to mumps susceptibility and was identified in the study context for its potential implications in immune response.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene PRR5L, being prioritized due to strong evidence from expression colocalization in immune cell types.
