title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: This SNP was within the intron of PRR5L and ranked second in priority, supporting its candidate status based on expression data.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The study indicated that the DRD2 rs2075654 polymorphism was related to long-term remission of obesity in a retrospective cohort of Chinese children and adolescents. This finding contextualized the genetic risk for obesity correlating with personality traits like Extraversion.
title: The association of personality traits with childhood obesity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs1582763 variant was associated with a protective effect on delirium, with an odds ratio of 0.991 [0.988 - 0.994]. It has been previously linked with decreased risk of Alzheimer disease.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: Among the analyzed SNPs, rs34598529 was identified with a significantly higher minor allele frequency in the African American IBD cluster (cluster MAF: 2.2e-03, Fisher's exact test p-value: 1.52e-09) compared to the general biobank MAF of 3.023e-05. It was also significantly higher in the West African IBD cluster (cluster MAF: 0.014, Fisher's exact test p-value: 0.010), showcasing its implications in populations with African ancestry.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs34999973 showed significant differences in allele frequency, with a cluster MAF of 2.89e-04 in the African American IBD cluster, while the general biobank had no instances (biobank MAF: 0.00, Fisher's exact test p-value: 2.9e-04). This finding highlighted its potential relevance in analyzing African ancestry.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The risk allele of rs529623 was associated with lower expression levels of FXYD2 in pancreatic islets, particularly in individuals with T2D. This insight highlighted the potential for modulating FXYD2's expression for therapeutic purposes in T2D.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The missense variant rs1126809-A in TYR was significantly associated with thickening specifically of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), highlighting its influence on RPE morphology.
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The variant rs145341070 (MAF=1.0%) was linked to a nearly 15-fold increased risk for the inflammatory skin disease panniculitis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 14.96.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: In the analysis of the NCT02430480 cohort, rs61890184, associated with the gene PPFIBP2, was found to play a significant role in the response to neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy (NADT). Mediation analysis indicated that this SNP combined with CMB 236 significantly contributed to individual treatment responses (total effect p < 0.05; average causal mediation effects p < 0.05). Moreover, results showed its independent prognostic value while adjusting for cellular morphometric biomarkers and clinical factors.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The protective variant rs1582763 was associated with elevated CSF sTREM2 levels, reduced AD risk, lower chemokine and cytokine immune responses, and increased MS4A4A expression. This variant acted to shift microglia toward an interferon state, aiding in reduced inflammatory responses and enhancing lipid metabolism pathways.
title: MS4A4A modifies the risk of Alzheimer disease by regulating lipid metabolism and immune response in a unique microglia state

finding: The risk variant rs6591561 was linked to decreased CSF sTREM2 levels and increased AD risk. This variant was associated with reduced MS4A4A expression, elevated inflammatory cytokines, chemokines, and inflammasome responses, which promoted a pro-inflammatory state in microglia.
title: MS4A4A modifies the risk of Alzheimer disease by regulating lipid metabolism and immune response in a unique microglia state

finding: The rs35705950-T variant in the MUC5B gene was found to be protective in the context of COVID-19 infection. Specifically, the presence of this allele was associated with fewer hospitalizations (OR=0.86, p=7.4 x 10^-5) and post-COVID-19 pneumonia events (OR=0.85, p=0.008) among individuals of European ancestry. This association was established in a trans-ethnic meta-analysis including data from the Million Veteran Program (MVP) and the COVID-19 Host Genetics Initiative (HGI). Additionally, a phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) revealed that rs35705950-T was linked to increased risk for certain respiratory conditions like idiopathic fibrosing alveolitis, highlighting its complex role in pulmonary health.
title: A MUC5B gene polymorphism, rs35705950-T, confers protective effects in COVID-19 infection

finding: This SNP, located in the precursor gene of miR-1908-5p and intronic to FADS1, was associated with metabolic traits and lipid fractions, indicating its role in lipid and obesity traits.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with hypertension, reinforcing the theme of blood pressure regulation.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The SNP rs75393320 was found to be significant for anti-NMDAR encephalitis, residing in the ACP2 gene. It had an odds ratio of 2.20 (P = 3.78 × 10^-8), suggesting a pivotal genetic influence in the development of the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies two new loci associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis

finding: SNP rs11039155 was also linked to anti-NMDAR encephalitis, situated near the NR1H3 gene. It shared the same P-value and odds ratio as rs75393320, underscoring its importance in the genetic landscape of the condition.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies two new loci associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis

finding: The SNP rs1131665 was connected to the IRF7 gene within both neutrophils and naïve CD4+ T cells in lupus patients. This connection highlights the gene's potential role in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The study established that the SNP rs35705950 in the MUC5B promotor was associated with interstitial lung disease (ILD). Specifically, it was found that unaffected relatives of ILD patients had a lower frequency of the risk allele 'T' at 18.8%, compared to 45.2% in known ILD patients and 35.7% in relatives diagnosed with preclinical ILD. This highlighted the genetic predisposition to ILD within families and suggested that the presence of this SNP could serve as a genetic marker for assessing risk.
title: Preclinical interstitial lung disease in relatives of familial pulmonary fibrosis patients

finding: The rs138326449 variant, associated with genetically lowered circulating APOC3 levels, was found to reduce the odds of coronary artery disease (CAD). The odds ratio for reduced CAD risk per standard deviation increase in the protein levels due to this variant was reported as 0.90 (95% CI, 0.82–0.99), suggesting a beneficial effect on CAD risk.
title: Drug-target Mendelian randomization analysis supports lowering plasma ANGPTL3, ANGPTL4, and APOC3 levels as strategies for reducing cardiovascular disease risk

finding: The SNP rs174546 was associated with genetically elevated PUFA desaturase activity, which was linked to a higher risk of colorectal and lung cancer. This finding suggested that the mechanism involved may be increased inflammation, demonstrating that this SNP had a significant impact on both fatty acid metabolism and related health outcomes.
title: Relationship between Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids and Inflammation: evidence from cohort and Mendelian randomization analyses

finding: The SNP rs1944683 was recognized as a lead SNP for substance use disorders (SUDs) in African-ancestry individuals. This SNP had not been previously genome-wide significant (GWS) or linked to any GWS SNPs in African substance-related GWAS, although it was associated with traits related to alcohol consumption and tobacco in European studies.
title: Combining Transdiagnostic and Disorder-Level GWAS Enhances Precision of Psychiatric Genetic Risk Profiles in a Multi-Ancestry Sample

finding: The BDNF gene polymorphism (Val66Met, rs6265) indicated that carriers of the Met66 allele exhibited a greater positive effect from intellectual enrichment on cognitive function compared to non-carriers.
title: Intellectual enrichment and genetic modifiers of cognitive function in Huntington’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3847634 was identified as a genome-wide significant variant associated with light sensitivity, specifically impacting chronotype. Additional T allele dosage at this SNP enhanced the morningness effect of daytime light exposure and correlated with increased expression of the ARL14EP gene in brain and retinal tissues. This SNP also had a positive marginal effect linked to eveningness, an effect not previously documented in earlier studies.
title: Genome-wide gene by environment study of time spent in daylight and chronotype identifies emerging genetic architecture underlying light sensitivity

finding: The rs35705950 variant, which includes the MUC5B risk allele (TT or TC genotype), was associated with a lower prevalence of qualifying variants (QVs) among patients, indicating a complex interplay between common and rare genetic variants in IPF.
title: Rare variants and survival of patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The rs174547 variant was strongly associated with blood Arachidonic Acid (ARA) levels demonstrated by a statistical significance of p=3.0×10^-971. This SNP was retained as an instrumental variable in a study examining the causal effect of ARA on colorectal polyp incidence, although no association was found between ARA and colorectal polyp incidence.
title: Investigation of the association between high arachidonic acid synthesis and colorectal polyp incidence: a Mendelian randomisation approach

finding: Associated with AUD and displayed direct effects in mediation analysis.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Located in TMX2, this SNP showed strong associations with AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This variant in TMX2 was associated with AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The SNP rs116714277 was associated with the glycemic locus 11q13.4 mapping to the known type 2 diabetes gene ARAP1/STARD10. It showed genome-wide significance with a p-value of 2.8 × 10<sup>−8</sup>.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The SNP rs2438321 was implicated at the 11q22.1 locus with a p-value of 1.3 × 10<sup>−8</sup> in African ancestry individuals. This locus was part of a multivariate analysis that identified significant loci.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The SNP rs12792379 was discussed as the lead SNP at the CCKBR locus, which was linked to increased PUD risk in an HP-dependent manner. The risk allele associated with PUD was in high LD with the eQTL allele that correlated with higher CCKBR expression.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: SNP rs592068, which influences <italic>GPR83</italic> expression, was demonstrated to interact with rs3746619 at <italic>MC3R</italic>. The expression-increasing T alleles at this SNP worked in conjunction with <italic>MC3R</italic> function-increasing alleles, leading to an earlier age at menarche in white European women.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs11031006, located near the gene <italic>FSHB</italic>, was part of several AAM and ANM signals. It showed significant associations directing reproductive lifespan earlier or later, suggesting its relevance in both AAM and ANM outcomes.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The rs73404549 variant showed association with sickle cell anemia in the African population, and it was in strong linkage disequilibrium with the better-known rs334 variant, which is linked to sickle cell anemia. Analysis indicated that rs334 had a stronger effect size for the disease than rs73404549.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: Located at the BDNF locus, rs61888800 was found to contact multiple gene promoters, thus demonstrating its significance in the context of childhood obesity's genetic landscape.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: This SNP at the METTL15 locus interacted with gene promoters linked to obesity, highlighting its potential role in the disease.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs12576934 near the LRRC4C gene showed a cross-ancestry association with Alzheimer's disease with a genome-wide significance level of P=5.4×10^-9. The odds ratio (OR) indicated an increased risk (OR=1.12) across multiple ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11606884 was another novel locus identified in the study, also showing suggestive associations (p < .05) with metabolic traits, contributing to the understanding of the genetic overlap and shared pathways between MDD and CVD.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: SNP rs500571 was included as a significant novel locus from the latent MDD-CVD GWAS, with suggestive associations (p < .05) to metabolic traits, further confirming its potential involvement in the shared genetic risk factors for MDD and CVD.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs11031006 at the FSHB locus (11p14.1) reached significance at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 1.17x10^-3 regarding endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs72638188 at the WT1 locus (11p14.1) showed significant association at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 2.85x10^-4 in the context of endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The missense variant rs2186797 (p.Phe608Ser) in the ANO1 gene was precision-mapped to be causal with a probability of 97.0%. This variant was linked to gut motility, where ANO1, expressed in interstitial cells of Cajal, is involved in intestinal peristalsis. Disruption in ANO1 function could potentially affect HEM risk via impaired gut motility.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: SNP rs641325 was related to increased risks of PTSD and frontal surface area (FSA). It was observed to contribute to the understanding of PTSD's genetic links to brain structure.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: Found to have high colocalization (H4 of 99%) with schizophrenia and ADHD traits, indicating its potential impact on these co-occurring conditions with autism.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: SNP rs554219, found on chromosome 11q13 upstream of CCND1, was ranked as a top GWAS hit for breast cancer. It exhibited a similar hazard ratio of 1.24, providing supporting evidence for its involvement in the genetic risk of breast cancer.
title: Potential Misrepresentation of Inherited Breast Cancer Risk by Common Germline Alleles

finding: The SNP rs591592 was implicated in the association with angina, with an OR<sub>IVW</sub> of 1.005, 95% CI of 1.003 to 1.007, and a p-value of <0.001, indicating a notable genetic influence on the susceptibility to angina.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The variant rs1200389078 was identified as a high confidence missense variant (p.S440L) in SORL1's conserved region and showed a moderate association in the replication dataset (P=1.28×10-5). This suggests its relevance to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s disease/Dementia

finding: The analysis indicated that the sentinel variant rs5744249 from the IL-18 gene locus exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with at least one top cis-variant from each analyzed outcome dataset, suggesting potential causal associations with several outcomes including atrial fibrillation (AF), heart failure (HF), cardio-embolic stroke, chronic kidney disease (CKD), and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This finding was derived from colocalization analyses which, despite indicating suboptimal power, pointed towards a significant relationship between IL-18 signaling and these cardio-metabolic conditions.
title: Genetically Predicted IL-18 Inhibition and Risk of Cardiovascular Events: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs35723406 variant in the TKFC gene near the FADS1-2-3 region showed effect heterogeneity between men and women for the fatty acid desaturase index (D6D in TAG). This finding was statistically significant with a P-het value of 6.2×10^-6, suggesting potential differences in lipid metabolism related to this variant that warrants further investigation.
title: Lipidome- and genome-wide study to understand sex differences in circulatory lipids

finding: The lead variant rs72925197 was identified as significant in a genome-wide SNP-by-sex interaction analysis, with a P-value of 1.34 × 10⁻¹¹. It was found to be an intronic SNP located in the NRXN2 gene. This variant had no previous associations with cardiac or sex-specific traits but was noted as an eQTL for VEGFB in heart and adipose tissues.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: This SNP was both originally identified in an ancient Chinese individual and associated with GDM in the study, showing higher allele frequency in East Asian populations compared to European ones.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: This SNP was also identified as an independent signal in the COJO analysis for GDM risk, showing significant association with GDM.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: The SNP rs530537 in the CASP1 gene was associated with gastric cancer (OR = 1.23; p = 0.019) in adjusted models, indicating its relevance in cancer risk within the studied population.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs174535 at the FADS locus reached a highly significant p-value of 1.6x10^-12 in the upstream analysis regarding its interaction with dietary long-chain omega-3 fatty acid (dN3FA) intake and inflammation as measured by hsCRP. This finding demonstrated the potential of the decomposition approach to identify gene-environment interactions, as the same SNP did not show a significant interaction in downstream analysis (p = 0.94) nor in the standard pathway (p = 0.097), indicating a distinct variation in interactions depending on the analytical approach employed.
title: Decomposed interaction testing improves detection of genetic modifiers of the relationship of dietary omega-3 fatty acid intake and its plasma biomarkers with hsCRP in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs35705950 in the MUC5B gene was associated with a strong risk for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), identified through meta-analysis involving 17 studies. It revealed an odds ratio (OR) of 3.85 (95% CI 3.24-4.47), indicating that the T allele significantly increased susceptibility to IPF, particularly among European populations.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: rs595366 was found to have a significant association with elevated serum ALT levels (p=1.9×10^-11), with evidence from eQTL studies suggesting its involvement in liver and adipose tissues.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: This SNP was associated with HbA1c levels in the UK Biobank (beta=0.1, p=8.5×10^-9), demonstrating a potential link to metabolic syndrome in the context of liver disease.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: This SNP was associated with early childhood caries (ECC) and demonstrated significant generalization in the GLIDE-adults cohort with an effect allele frequency of 0.53 and P=0.03, indicating its relevance in adult dental health.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Study of Early Childhood Caries

finding: The SNP rs6589386 was identified as a convergent lead SNP with significant associations for both AUD and SCZ, showing a cross-disorder p-value of 5.7e-18. It was noted as an eQTL for the gene DRD2 in cerebellar hemisphere tissue, which has been implicated in both disorders through recent GWAS. Additionally, this SNP was involved in associations with neuroticism, subjective well-being, alcohol consumption, and cigarette smoking.
title: Investigation of convergent and divergent genetic influences underlying schizophrenia and alcohol use disorder

finding: The rs6265 SNP, known as Val66Met, was associated with differences in TMS-derived or behavioral measures. Specifically, Val/Val homozygotes showed more reliable neuromodulatory effects than Met allele carriers across various conditions, including healthy individuals, stroke, and depression. In particular, Val/Val homozygotes demonstrated greater improvements in depression symptoms compared to Met allele carriers after rTMS.
title: The Impact of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor Polymorphism and Stimulation Parameters on the Response to Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: A Systematic Review

finding: The FADS2 Indel polymorphism rs66698963 was identified as a significant predictor of colorectal polyp prevention efficacy in individuals taking eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA). In the context of a randomized trial, it was found that EPA users with at least one I allele displayed a 50% reduction in colorectal polyp numbers, highlighting the interaction between the I allele and EPA treatment, distinct from the lack of such an effect with aspirin. This association was consistent with prior findings indicating the I allele's role in increasing levels of arachidonic acid, which EPA counteracts.
title: FADS2 Indel polymorphism rs66698963 predicts colorectal polyp prevention by the n-3 fatty acid EPA

finding: The SNP rs11020245 was associated with the downregulation of KCNMA1 expression in colorectal cancer through epigenetic mechanisms. This result indicated the importance of epigenetic regulation in cancer development, specifically pointing to the reduced expression of KCNMA1 as a significant factor in the progression of colorectal cancer.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Signaling Pathways Associated with the Progression of Glioblastoma multiform

finding: The SNP rs732934 was identified to have significant interaction effects regarding serum 25-hydroxy vitamin D (25OHD) concentrations, specifically showing a gene-sex interaction. In females, it decreased serum 25OHD by -2.04 nmol/L, while in males it decreased by -2.79 nmol/L. Additionally, rs732934 demonstrated significant eQTL effects on the expression of DHCR7 in skin tissues, with the 25OHD-decreasing allele associated with increased overall transcript abundance.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs12794714, a synonymous variant of CYP2R1, exhibited significant interaction effects with BMI and smoking status, indicating that genetic effects related to vitamin D levels weakened with increased BMI.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs61147618 demonstrated interaction effects with BMI, suggesting that its genetic influence on serum 25OHD concentrations could be modified by body mass.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The study referenced the IFITM3 rs12252 C variant, which had a significant association with COVID-19. This finding suggested that variations in the IFITM3 gene could influence an individual's susceptibility to the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), highlighting a genetic risk factor related to the immune response during the pandemic.
title: Impact of BNT162b first vaccination on the immune transcriptome of elderly patients infected with the B.1.351 SARS-CoV-2 variant

finding: The SNP rs751343, associated with ATM, indicated an increased susceptibility for mLOX and was linked to breast cancer, showcasing the overlapping genetic risk for neoplasms.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The novel European ancestry-specific rare variant rs181802264 in FOLH1 exhibited a strong association with high myopia (P = 2.00 × 10^-8, OR = 10.24). This gene is involved in processes relevant to neurotransmission, suggesting a potential mechanism linking it to high myopia.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The SNP rs6265, known as G196A, located in the promoter region of the BDNF gene, was identified as responsible for an amino acid change at codon 66, specifically Val66Met. This change was linked to a deficit in the release of BDNF, which in turn affected the efficiency of BDNF-TrkB signaling. Such signaling is crucial for memory processes and long-term potentiation (LTP), suggesting that the polymorphism may play a significant role in cognitive functions and neuroplasticity.
title: The MultiMusic multidomain intervention including choral practice in community-dwelling older people: A study protocol for Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) salivary biomarkers, audiometric and neuropsychological parameters

finding: The G allele of rs4753834 was associated with lower risk of having somatic mutations in the ATM gene and increased expression of ATM in normal tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: Variants in LD with rs4753834 (including rs672964) were associated with TMB in non-small cell lung cancer.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs3136516 was utilized to instrument prothrombin concentrations, providing suggestive evidence for a decrease in basal cell carcinoma risk (OR 0.66, 95% CI 0.53-0.81, q-value=0.067). This SNP was also identified as a sQTL for the F2 gene encoding prothrombin in liver tissue, showing a normalized effect size of 0.63 (P=3.1 x 10-12).
title: Association between circulating inflammatory markers and adult cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: Linked with rs3136516 in high LD (r2=0.83), this missense variant was implicated as a contributing factor to the prothrombin concentrations and, by extension, the potential decrease in basal cell carcinoma risk (OR 0.66, 95% CI 0.53-0.81, q-value=0.067).
title: Association between circulating inflammatory markers and adult cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The genetic locus rs5072 was associated with early-onset AMI and linked to lipid metabolism via the APOA1-AS gene. It had an OR of 1.545 and a p-value of 8.61 × 10−6.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The DRD2 SNP rs6277 (C957T) was identified as a significant susceptibility factor for schizophrenia in the Bulgarian population. This finding highlighted the role of genetic variations in the dopamine receptor D2 gene in the context of schizophrenia, thereby contributing to the understanding of the genetic basis of this psychiatric disorder.
title: DRAGON-Data: A platform and protocol for integrating genomic and phenotypic data across large psychiatric cohorts

finding: The variant rs77750788 at 11q25 near IGSF9B was linked to increased risk of HPC, with an OR of 2.07 (95% CI: 1.61, 2.68; p=2.03×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The intronic variant rs181194133 in OPCML was associated with increased risk for HPC (OR: 3.44, 95% CI: 2.24, 5.31; p=2.09×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The variant rs181777026 located near TENM4 was associated with increased risk of HPC within the European population, though specific results were not noted.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The study mentioned that the MUC5B rs35705950 promoter polymorphism was well known in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). This indicates a significant association with IPF, providing context for its relevance in understanding interstitial lung abnormalities (ILA), although it was not specifically reported as associated with ILA in this study.
title: Blood Gene Expression Risk Profiles and Interstitial Lung Abnormalities: COPDGene and ECLIPSE cohort studies

finding: SNP rs1940701 was identified as one of the most significant variants associated with opioid use disorder (OUD) and alcohol use disorder (AUD), located in the locus containing the gene NCAM1. It demonstrated significant genetic correlation across multiple substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs4479020 was shown to be associated with cannabis use disorder (CUD) and smoking initiation (SMK), also located within the locus containing NCAM1. It was an intronic variant in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs1940701.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs7110786 was another intronic variant in MTMR2 that showed a novel association with substance use disorders.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs12360992 was identified as an intronic variant in ANKK1 showing significant associations with alcohol use disorder (AUD).
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs2686880 was a novel GWS variant in CNOT4, associated with multiple substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: Variant rs174570 was associated with five of the eleven FADS-associated metabolites, including three oxylipins, demonstrating a significant role in fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The FADS variant rs174564 explained 9.4% of the variance of arachidonic acid as a trait, highlighting its importance in the genetic architecture of fatty acids.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The genetic variant rs10830963 located in the MTNR1B gene was found to have a cluster-specific enrichment related to diabetes. Participants in cluster 3 exhibited a higher frequency of the diabetes-associated G allele compared to those in cluster 1, with an uncorrected p-value of 0.00036. Moreover, differences were reported within the beta-cell group, indicating that the pathophysiological implications of this SNP were significant, with p-values of 0.001 uncorrected and 0.007 after Benjamini-Hochberg correction. This suggests that the genetic variant played a crucial role in identifying subphenotypes at increased risk for type 2 diabetes.
title: Pathophysiology-based subphenotyping of individuals at elevated risk for type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4930642 was marked as an outlying genetic variant; however, excluding it still demonstrated a significant association of SLE with increased CHF risk. This indicated a potential causal relationship between SLE and CHF.
title: The potential causal association of systemic lupus erythematosus with congestive heart failure in the East Asian population: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The A528T variant was associated with a small increase in Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, with an odds ratio of 1.11 (p=5.79×10^-8). It was carried by 3.6% of individuals in the sample, indicating some level of clinical significance.
title: Effect of prioritized SORL1 missense variants supports clinical consideration for familial Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The D2065V variant was associated with a 1.36-fold increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the GWAS, with a p-value of 1.61×10^-6, showing a statistically significant increase in AD risk.
title: Effect of prioritized SORL1 missense variants supports clinical consideration for familial Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs3200401 showed an increase in the expression of the lincRNA MALAT1 with the risk allele C in OA cartilage (meta-Φ=0.54), indicating its potential role in OA pathology.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs2514895 was associated with paliperidone-induced LDL changes (p = 4.96e-09, FDR = 0.004) and is located near the KIRREL3 gene.
title: Pharmacogenetic Study of Antipsychotic-Induced Lipid and BMI Changes in Chinese Schizophrenia Patients: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The variant rs140226575 (Thr370Met) in the ARRB1 gene was linked to a greater reduction in HbA1c levels after GLP-1RA treatment. Carriers of this low-frequency variant experienced a 2.7 mmol/mol greater reduction in HbA1c per Methionine allele compared to non-carriers, supported by a p-value of 5.2×10^-6. This variant had a notably higher occurrence in Hispanic and American Indian populations.
title: Pharmacogenomics of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists: A genome wide analysis of observational data and large randomized controlled trials

finding: The SNP rs11228623, located at 11q12, was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with olfactory dysfunction. It was enriched for olfactory receptor genes and showed associations with various phenotypes such as blood cell counts, kidney function, skeletal muscle mass, cholesterol levels, and cardiovascular disease. Two-sample Mendelian Randomization analyses provided evidence for causal associations between olfactory dysfunction and these health outcomes.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-Analysis Uncovers Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Olfactory Dysfunction

finding: The SNP rs12786376 was independently significant across the genomic risk locus at 11q12 in the GWMA. It exhibited directionally consistent effects in both ancestry-stratified and multi-ancestry analyses and was associated with olfactory dysfunction, with some evidence suggesting a link to gene expression involving age-dependent interactions.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-Analysis Uncovers Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Olfactory Dysfunction

finding: The interaction between TREH rs12225548 and FUT2 rs281379 was found to influence alkaline phosphatase levels, suggesting a novel epistatic effect.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs2074227 contributed to more than 80% of the posterior probability of colocalization between CD6 protein levels and genetic associations with all-stroke.
title: Genetically predicted levels of the human plasma proteome and risk of stroke: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The rs174551 variant was found in the 5-UTR of the FADS1 and FADS2 genes, located at region 11q12.2. It associated strongly with heart failure (P = 6.92×10^-50) and is implicated in the regulation of fatty acid metabolism, affecting pathways related to heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: Located at region 11p11.2, the variant rs34312154 exhibited the highest CADD score of 31, indicating potential deleterious effects. It had a notable association with heart failure (P=3.38×10^-09), suggesting significant relevance to the disease.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs149261869 was significantly associated with the risk of ischemic stroke in the subgroup randomized to low-dose vitamin supplementation (P=5.6 × 10−5). This finding was part of a gene-based analysis involving CYP2R1.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs117335120 was significantly associated with ischemic stroke risk in the low-dose vitamin supplementation subgroup (P=9.2 × 10−5). This SNP was evaluated within the context of the CYP2R1 gene-based tests.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs11040550 was associated with the timing of adjuvant chemotherapy and survival outcomes in colorectal cancer based on findings from Petrelli et al. (2019). The systematic review emphasized that there were optimal time windows for treatment that influenced overall survival, particularly highlighting that adherence to these timings could be crucial for patient prognosis.
title: The impact of lag time to cancer diagnosis and treatment on clinical outcomes prior to the COVID-19 pandemic: a scoping review of systematic reviews and meta-analyses

finding: The SNP rs615540, identified within the CCDC88B gene, was found to be a novel genome-wide significant locus for PMR, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in this inflammatory disease.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with osteoarthritis (OA) across multiple ancestry groups (EUR, AFR, HIS, and ASN) in Veterans, implicating its potential role in OA pathogenesis.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs2524296 in the 11q12.2 locus near the FADS1 gene was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) influencing gene expression in the left lung. It also demonstrated potential regulatory roles in gene expression by binding 12 transcription factors.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs4937515, located in 11q24.3, was associated with the vertical cup-to-disc ratio (VCDR_regressed_left) and cerebrospinal fluid volume (CSF volume). Bayesian colocalization analysis indicated a shared causal variant between these two traits, with a posterior probability of 0.997.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4936099, also in 11q24.3, showed genetic influences linked to cerebrospinal fluid volume and the vertical cup-to-disc ratio (VCDR_regressed_left), where it was part of the described causal relationship.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12807936 in 11q13.3 indicated shared genetic influences between the ninth principal component of the Vgg19 model on fundus image (Vgg19_PC9) and functional connectivity in the auditory network, with a high posterior probability (PPH4 = 0.994).
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2875238 shared genetic relationships derived from the vertical cup-to-disc ratio (VCDR_regressed_left) and was associated with known genetic risk factors for glaucoma.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The study evaluated the BDNF rs6265 genotype in patients to determine the association with recovery outcomes following rehabilitation. Specifically, genotyping categorized patients into groups based on whether they were 'non-carriers' (homozygous GG) or 'carriers' (heterozygous AG or homozygous AA). This analysis aimed to explore potential differences in motor recovery and rehabilitation response linked to the Val66Met substitution, highlighting the BDNF gene's role in neural plasticity and recovery processes post-stroke.
title: Rehabilitation with and without Robot and Allied Digital Technologies (RADTs) in stroke patients: a study protocol for a multicentre Randomised Controlled Trial on the effectiveness, acceptability, usability, and economic-organizational sustainability of RADTs from subacute to chronic phase (STROKEFIT4)

finding: The SNP rs59039403 was found within the NLRP10 locus, and likewise, demonstrated strong population-specific frequency in East Asian populations, where it reached 12.4%, compared to less than 0.1% in European populations. This indicated a potential role in the pathogenesis of atopic dermatitis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: Variant rs12785905 in KDM2A gene was found to be 10 times more frequent in UKB-EUR (0.06) compared to UKB-AFR (0.006) and was associated with prostate cancer, highlighting its significance in genetic studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Variant rs12575252 of TRIM66 demonstrated a frequency of 0.54 in UKB-AFR and 0.35 in UKB-EUR (p = 1.4 x 10<sup>-194</sup>) with an association to waist-hip ratio, illustrating its importance.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Variant rs2236682 related to creatinine levels showed varying frequencies among different populations and was significant in the context of trait comparisons.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Rs10840031 was found to be associated with the expression of TRIM66, indicating its potential role in immune responses in the context of T1D.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs800139 was associated with C11orf21 expression and its relevance to immune phenotypes was highlighted in the context of T1D. Specific effects were not detailed.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs1940701 was identified as the leading SNP of the most significant locus (locus 13) in the multi-ancestry GWAS. It was located in the NCAM1 gene on chromosome 11, highlighting its relevance to the biology of TBI.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: At the INS locus, fine-mapping resolved likely causal variants at all three independent risk signals, including rs7948458 with a PIP of 0.96, contributing to T1D susceptibility.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: At the INS locus, rs11042966 was identified as a likely causal variant at one of the three independent risk signals, with a PIP of 0.99, linking it to T1D risk.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: At the INS locus, the variant rs3842753 had a lower causal probability (PIP=0.135) compared to rs689, indicating its lesser role in T1D risk as the more significant rs689 variant superseded its influence.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs1468291, in the exonic region of the SERGEF gene, was identified as one of the lead SNPs for anxiety, although functional significance was not elaborated.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP represented a rare pathogenic variant associated with DM risk, showing an odds ratio of 4.72 (95% CI: 1.33-13.94; P=8.8x10^-3) when comparing the survivor group with diabetes to healthy controls, reinforcing its classification as a significant risk factor.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: Similar to rs200142185, this SNP was identified as a rare pathogenic variant. It conferred a much higher diabetes risk with an odds ratio of 19.77 (95% CI: 2.26-236.43; P=3.2x10^-3) when comparing cases to controls, which further established its relevance as a risk locus for DM.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: This SNP was noted as a missense variant in the TRPT1 gene, potentially influencing the gene's function in BD pathophysiology.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: This variant was the most significant novel association among 41 GWS loci revealed by cross-ancestry GWAS, with a z-score of 5.92 and a p-value of 3.3×10^-9. It was located in an intronic region of the CNTN5 gene, recognized for its potential involvement in neurodevelopment.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The rs8177398 SNP in TIRAP was significantly associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 8.82 x 10^-9) and suggested to have a statistical association with venous thrombosis in GWAS.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The most significant SNP, rs3842724, was associated with a large increase in plasma OT levels (β = 1.14, p-value = 4.98 × 10<sup>-6</sup>). This SNP is situated in the exon 14 of the TH gene, which is critical for dopaminergic activity that impacts OT release.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs11040813 was associated with pleiotropic effects between depression and gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD). It was identified as significantly pleiotropic with a p-value of 3.70 × 10^-5 for one direction and 3.80 × 10^-8 for the other direction, indicating its role in the genetic correlation between these disorders.
title: Phenomic Network Analysis for Depression Reveals Comorbidity Architecture, Genomic Relationships, and Pleiotropic Variants

finding: The SNP rs9919558, situated within the NCAM1 gene on chromosome 11, demonstrated a very strong association in the EXT GWAS, with a p-value of less than 6.50x10^-59. This highlighted its notable importance as one of the top SNPs influencing externalizing behaviors.
title: Parsing Genetically Influenced Risk Pathways: Genetic Loci Impact Problematic Alcohol Use Via Externalizing and Specific Risk

finding: This SNP was identified as associated with fractures in the studied cohort, linking it to both fracture risk assessment and the understanding of bone strength from a genetic perspective.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: This SNP was identified as having a protective effect against AD, with a beneficial association reported independently of the ε2 allele, suggesting it may act as a modulator of AD risk.
title: Inter- and intra-chromosomal modulators of the APOE ε2 and ε4 effects on the Alzheimer’s disease risk

finding: The variants in CHEK2 were associated not only with breast cancer but also with colorectal and thyroid cancers, uterine leiomyoma, benign meningeal tumors, and ovarian cysts. This represented a positive original finding connecting CHEK2 to multiple cancer traits.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Ranked among both the top IBI and GWAS SNPs, rs1794108 contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing hypertension, reflecting its relevance in both analyses.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: This intron variant was identified by IBI as significant in a limited number of patients, indicating its relevance in hypertension even if overlooked by GWAS.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs174547 was identified as a key variant related to the FADS1 gene, which has a causal feedback loop involving HDL cholesterol levels. It was reported that dietary intake of linoleic acid could modulate the impact of this SNP on HDL-cholesterol levels, underscoring its functional relevance and confirming previous associations noted in the literature.
title: Differentially expressed genes reflect disease-induced rather than disease-causing changes in the transcriptome

finding: The SNP rs174564 was associated with the lipid species PC(18:0_20:4), showing a highly significant P-value of 4.63×10<sup>-220</sup>. This association highlighted its importance in lipid metabolism and its putative link to coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs174601 was identified as genome-wide significant in bipolar disorder (BD) analysis, with a p-value of 8.0e-10 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.99. This SNP was reported near the FADS1 gene, linking it to genetic components of BD. Additionally, the analysis demonstrated a strong effect in distinguishing BD from major depressive disorder (MDD) with a significant effect observed (P<1.0e-05) and an odds ratio of 0.93. However, the correlation with MDD was not significant (P>0.1), indicating a potential distinct genetic association primarily for BD with depressive onset.
title: Identifying genetic differences between bipolar disorder and major depression through multiple GWAS

finding: This SNP was identified as being associated with antibodies against Toxoplasma gondii at the seven-year clinic (EA = T, P = 1.2×10⁻¹², β = 0.20). Although this association persisted at later clinical time points, its replication in UK Biobank was not successful.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: At the MS4A6A locus, rs1151105 was identified as an MPRA-active variant that only showed transcriptional activity in proinflammatory macrophages, demonstrating condition-specific enhancer activity.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The SNP rs2306029 was linked to the protein LRP4, which was found to have shared variants associated with MI risk in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs4752946 was identified in association with LRP4 and linked to MI risk during the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs964184 shared variants with MI risk through its association with the protein Apo C-III, as confirmed in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs10743116 was linked to the SWAP70 protein, identified in the analysis as sharing variants with MI risk when the threshold was lowered to 0.7.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs12271923 was associated with SWAP70 and was found to share genetic variants with MI risk during the analysis at a lowered threshold.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs2645017 shared genetic variants with MI risk via its association with the SWAP70 protein, as confirmed by the analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs415895 was associated with SWAP70 and was found to share variants linked to MI risk based on the analysis results.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs79478137 was found to be associated with WHRadjBMI in women (P=3.64×10^-9). It is intronic to the SLC22A18AS gene and is linked to conditions associated with genetic imprinting. The finding was replicated in a Hispanic/Latino cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The SNP rs3168072 was associated with waist circumference adjusted for body mass index (WCadjBMI) in combined sexes (P=4.21×10^-8). It was found to be significantly associated with the expression of the TMEM258 gene and exhibited potential for regulatory activity.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The variant rs10792832, located within an open chromatin region, was associated with lower open chromatin signal and gene expression of the PICALM gene. This was consistent with a predicted reduction in accessibility as indicated by DeepSEA predictions, and it correlated with decreased DNase accessibility and H3K4me1 ChIP-seq signal in monocytes. Thus, this SNP was recognized as a risk factor for Alzheimer's Disease (AD) in prior studies.
title: Genetics of the human microglia regulome refines Alzheimer’s disease risk loci

finding: The finding indicated that Val66Val carriers of the BDNF polymorphism (rs6265) exhibited less aphasia severity compared to Met allele carriers. This result was determined after adjusting for factors such as lesion volume and time since the stroke. Furthermore, Val66Val carriers displayed expected age-related effects on aphasia severity, along with positive associations with cortical excitability and stimulation-induced neuroplasticity, contrasting significantly with Met allele carriers who experienced weaker age effects and negative associations.
title: Genetic and neurophysiological biomarkers of neuroplasticity inform post-stroke language recovery

finding: RS201870990 in ANO1 was associated with ascending aorta maximum and minimum area, showcasing effects of approximately 41.95 mm² and an effect size of 0.22 s.d. units (P = 7.6 × 10^-11), indicating its potential link to cardiac structures.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The study identified that a combined IFITM3 haplotype involving the reference alleles of rs12252 correlated with the standardized mortality ratio of ethnic groups in England regarding COVID-19. This finding suggested a significant role for this SNP in the clinical outcomes of COVID-19.
title: Host genome analysis of structural variations by Optical Genome Mapping provides clinically valuable insights into genes implicated in critical immune, viral infection, and viral replication pathways in patients with severe COVID-19

finding: Alongside rs12252, the rs34481144 SNP also formed part of the combined IFITM3 haplotype that was found to be linked to COVID-19 mortality rates among different ethnic groups. It highlighted the potential importance of this genetic variant in the pathogenesis of severe COVID-19.
title: Host genome analysis of structural variations by Optical Genome Mapping provides clinically valuable insights into genes implicated in critical immune, viral infection, and viral replication pathways in patients with severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs11601507, a missense variant of TRIM5, was identified by SuSiEx as associated with total bilirubin, with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) greater than 99%. Although this credible set did not achieve genome-wide significance due to limited statistical power, the causal probabilities were estimated at 0.998 for EUR, 0.743 for AFR, and 0.994 for EAS populations, suggesting that it may represent a shared variant across populations.
title: Fine-mapping across diverse ancestries drives the discovery of putative causal variants underlying human complex traits and diseases

finding: This SNP served as a proxy for rs536995174 in replication studies and was used to ensure the robustness of the discovered associations with VTE.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The intergenic SNP rs11224340 was related to ARHGAP42, suggesting a connection with blood pressure regulation and its implications in VTE.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs11212617 was reproducibly associated with glycaemic response to metformin, this variant was located at a locus including the ATM gene, giving insights into how genetic factors might influence metformin's efficacy in type 2 diabetes.
title: The Effect of Metformin Treatment on the Circulating Proteome

finding: The SNP rs4930561 located at 11q13.2 was associated with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) with a genome-wide significant P-value of 2.15 × 10^-8 (OR 1.17, 95% CI 1.11-1.24). It was linked to the KMT5B gene and indicated involvement in AML risk irrespective of subtype.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: A 1bp insertion in exon 13 of IGHMBP2 was found, expected to result in a frameshift mutation associated with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease. Functional testing indicated potential abnormal splicing.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: An intronic SNV in IGHMBP2 was identified as a variant of uncertain significance (VUS) in ClinVar, impacting splicing with a potential cryptic exon formation.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: The rs3842753 C allele was found to be associated with increased INS mRNA expression and variance in pancreatic beta cells. Specifically, it was shown that cells containing the C allele (either homozygous or heterozygous) had significantly higher INS expression compared to those with the A/A genotype. This included the observation that the heterozygous A/C genotype had the highest levels and variance of normalized INS expression among the studied groups. Furthermore, this increase in INS expression was linked to elevated ER stress marker gene expression, indicating a possible mechanism by which inherited risk of type 1 diabetes could be associated with enhanced insulin production and beta cell stress.
title: The type 1 diabetes at-risk allele at rs3842753 increases beta cell INS mRNA expression and variance in a meta-analysis of single cell RNA sequencing data

finding: The variant rs7936928 located in the ADAMTS8 gene was associated with a decrease in AAA prevalence. The p-value was 7.51 x 10^-9 and the odds ratio for the T allele was 0.786, indicating a protective effect.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Selection was evident on rs1393350 in the TYR gene, showing a selected coefficient of about 0.011, which is associated with freckling and blue/green eye color.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The analysis indicated that the rs1815739 SNP, located within the ACTN3 gene, played a significant role in muscle contractions and exhibited a synergistic epistatic effect with rs362584. This interaction reached a significant Chi-squared value of 33.758 and p-value close to 0, highlighting its relevance in distinguishing elite and sub-elite gymnasts from sedentary individuals.
title: Detection of epistasis between ACTN3 and SNAP-25 with an insight towards gymnastic aptitude identification

finding: The SNP rs2019090 was established as the functional variant associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) risk through mechanisms involving the transcription factors FOXC1 and FOXC2. This association was investigated using fine mapping and epigenome editing approaches, demonstrating that binding of these transcription factors enhanced expression of the gene PDGFD via the CAD-promoting A allele. Additionally, rs2019090 was found to serve as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), showing significant association with increased PDGFD expression in vascular tissues. The involvement of this SNP in the genetic regulation of CAD highlighted its role in vascular smooth muscle cell dynamics and inflammatory processes during atherosclerosis.
title: Molecular mechanisms of coronary artery disease risk at the PDGFD locus

finding: Associated with FADD in the context of rQTLs linked to the NFATC1 protein network, rs7939734 supported the genetic interactions identified in the analysis.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The SNP rs35865896 was associated with splicing of exon 4 in IRF7, significantly impacting 12 out of 18 tested tissues. Increased skipping of this exon correlated with a decreased risk of lupus erythematosus, suggesting a connection to immune system function.
title: The impact of genetically controlled splicing on exon inclusion and protein structure

finding: The SNP rs10838698 was reported to be significantly associated with SPI1 expression in monocytes and macrophages. This finding supported an increase in SPI1 expression linked to Alzheimer’s disease, particularly noting that it acted as a master regulator of several AD-risk genes.
title: Monocyte-specific changes in gene expression implicate LACTB2 and PLIN2 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11040527 was linked to <italic>PSMD3</italic> regulation, influencing HER2 stability in breast cancer, highlighting its role in HER2-positive subtypes.
title: A Comprehensive Meta-Analysis of Breast Cancer Gene Expression

finding: Located in the intron of the gene PPFIA1, rs1061328 showed signatures of positive selection and was linked to the expression of critical genes in cell adhesion and migration processes, potentially involved in placental development.
title: Accounting for diverse evolutionary forces reveals the mosaic nature of selection on genomic regions associated with human preterm birth

finding: The SNP rs78540526, found in the CCND1 locus on chromosome 11, was also recognized as a known susceptibility locus for breast cancer. It had a significant P-value of less than 5.0 × 10⁻⁸. Although the individual heterogeneity test revealed evidence for heterogeneity by estrogen receptor status (ER) and grade, this SNP did not achieve genome-wide significance in standard logistic regression or polytomous models.
title: A Mixed-Model Approach for Powerful Testing of Genetic Associations with Cancer Risk Incorporating Tumor Characteristics

finding: The SNP rs621313 was found to be associated with increased risk for early AMD (P=6.8x10^-4) and was located near the gene TYR. The G allele of this SNP was also linked to traits such as melanoma risk and skin color, emphasizing its relevance beyond AMD.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis for early age-related macular degeneration highlights novel loci and insights for advanced disease

finding: SNP rs1042602 was identified as a missense variant near TYR and is classified as a GWAS lead variant for skin color and macular thickness. The allele associated with increased thickness in the retina also showed an increased risk for early AMD, potentially linking its functional implications to AMD etiology.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis for early age-related macular degeneration highlights novel loci and insights for advanced disease

finding: The SNP rs11040457 was highlighted in the 2019 study by Frisch et al. as being related to STIM-Orai channels and their role in generating reactive oxygen species (ROS) within the tumor microenvironment. This finding indicated that the presence of this SNP correlated with how immune cells interacted with melanoma cells, affecting patterns of cytotoxicity and resistance.
title: Combined CTL and NK cell cytotoxicity against cancer cells

finding: The rs2155248 SNP was associated significantly with various cancer-related gene expressions among populations.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The SNP rs10770141 of the tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) gene was found to be part of a double SNP combination and later a triple SNP combination linked to the risk of developing late-onset treatment-resistant schizophrenia (L-TRS). The findings suggested that individuals with the T(+) allele had relatively higher TH gene expression, contributing to dopaminergic dysregulation associated with schizophrenia.
title: Genetic combination risk for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs1800497, also known as TaqIA of the DRD2 gene, was identified in a risk combination for L-TRS. The findings indicated that individuals with the A1(+) allele could have lower DRD2 gene expression, which was suggested to be linked to dopaminergic system impairments and a higher risk of schizophrenia.
title: Genetic combination risk for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs10792832 was associated with non-neuronal peak acetylation and was identified as a sentinel SNP in the context of PICALM expression regulation, indicating its potential effects in microglia and/or oligodendrocytes related to Alzheimer's Disease pathology.
title: Cell type-specific histone acetylation profiling of Alzheimer’s Disease subjects and integration with genetics

finding: The SNP rs3851179, closely linked with rs10792832, also overlapped non-neuronal peaks, suggesting its involvement in affecting PICALM expression in microglial and/or oligodendrocytic contexts. This association further emphasizes the significance of regulatory mechanisms in AD pathology.
title: Cell type-specific histone acetylation profiling of Alzheimer’s Disease subjects and integration with genetics

finding: The SNP rs174546 was identified in the 3' UTR region of the FADS1 gene. It was found to potentially exhibit horizontal pleiotropy, suggesting that it was associated with multiple traits beyond n3-PUFA, including metabolic traits (e.g., cholesterol and triglycerides), cardiovascular traits (e.g., heart rate), and psychiatric traits (e.g., sleep duration and irritability), which are related to major depressive disorder (MDD). This pleiotropic effect indicated that the association between genetic determinants of n3-PUFA and MDD could be confounded by other biological pathways.
title: A role for vitamin D and omega-3 fatty acids in major depression? An exploration using genomics

finding: It displayed significant effects based on previous analyses linking it to the modified phenotype.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The rs585809 variant, mapped to the TRIM29 gene, was found to interact significantly with CAG_exp size (P = 0.01). This suggested that it might modulate the age of onset (AO) of Machado-Joseph disease (MJD) through epistatic interaction with CAG_exp.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies genetic factors that modify age at onset in Machado-Joseph disease

finding: The rs11529293 variant, located within the C11orf72 and RAG loci, exhibited the strongest signal in the genome-wide association study (P = 3.30 × 10^-6). The association highlighted the involvement of the RAG genes, involved in DNA repair, which could potentially impact age of onset (AO) in MJD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies genetic factors that modify age at onset in Machado-Joseph disease

finding: The lead SNP rs9420 demonstrated a 90.1% co-localization probability with expression of MED19, a regulator of neuronal gene expression, identifying it as a pivotal eSTR for schizophrenia in the analyzed tissue.
title: Multi-tissue analysis reveals short tandem repeats as ubiquitous regulators of gene expression and complex traits

finding: The rs1076560 polymorphism in the DRD2 gene was linked to schizophrenia-related intermediate phenotypes, suggesting a role in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia.
title: Screening of the Key Genes and Signaling Pathways for Schizophrenia Using Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: SNP rs12420140 was found as the peak variant within the BCO2 locus. Both FiniMOM and SuSiE methods produced confident credible sets with this variant, which was also supported by evidence in the replication GWAS, confirming its role in the associated complex traits.
title: Genetic fine-mapping from summary data using a non-local prior improves detection of multiple causal variants

finding: The SNP rs2155380 was identified as a lead variant in the CBL region associated with platelet count and platelet crit phenotypes. It was noted that, upon conditioning for this variant, the highly polymorphic CGG repeat in the promoter of CBL became the primary signal indicating its role as a causal variant in platelet traits.
title: Polymorphic short tandem repeats make widespread contributions to blood and serum traits

finding: The SNP rs7108857, changing the second CGG repeat to TGG within the CBL region, was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs2155380. It demonstrated significant associations with platelet count (p=9e-86) and platelet crit (p=4e-98), and it was suggested that the presence of this SNP influenced CBL expression, making it a significant variant in understanding the regulation of platelet-related traits.
title: Polymorphic short tandem repeats make widespread contributions to blood and serum traits

finding: The SNP rs10830237, associated with the TYR gene encoding tyrosinase, showed the highest posterior probability for induced G×T interaction among the analyzed feature-SNP pairs, demonstrating a pronounced treatment effect on genotype interactions.
title: Probabilistic classification of gene-by-treatment interactions on molecular count phenotypes

finding: The study provided evidence that the MALAT1 rs664589 polymorphism inhibited binding to miR-194-5p, which contributed to colorectal cancer risk, growth, and metastasis. This finding highlighted the role of this specific SNP in the molecular mechanisms underlying colorectal cancer, linking it to alterations in microRNA interactions and suggesting potential implications for understanding tumor biology and developing targeted therapies.
title: Multi-omic study of genome-edited human colonoid models of colorectal cancer reveal genotype-specific patterns of microRNA regulation

finding: At the FADS1 locus (rs174546), associated with fatty acid metabolism, strong selection signals were detected, showing that much of the selection occurred in Neolithic populations before their arrival in Europe.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The FADS2 locus (rs174581), which is also associated with fatty acid metabolism, demonstrated significant selection, indicating that changes in diet during the Holocene influenced its allele frequency.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The rs35705950 SNP was found to overlap with the lncRNA AC061979.1 and demonstrated a significant association with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF). This SNP exhibited a high incidence rate (approximately 40%) in diverse populations, including Caucasian, Hispanic, and Asian, and individuals with homozygous variants were at higher risk for developing the disease and had increased mortality rates. The polymorphism was implicated in elevated transcription and translation of MUC5B, contributing to atypical mucus overproduction in patients, which led to harmful cellular responses in the lung epithelium.
title: The Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis-associated single nucleotide polymorphism rs35705950 is transcribed in a MUC5B Promoter Associated Long Non-Coding RNA (AC061979.1)

finding: The allele rs174570C connected with fatty acid metabolism significantly increased in frequency from around 20% in Eastern Baltic and Western Russian hunter-gatherers to approximately 50% among individuals from the Corded Ware Culture (CWC) period.
title: Genetic ancestry changes in Stone to Bronze Age transition in the East European plain

finding: The rs11568818 polymorphism was associated with MMP-7 expression at an extra-articular site, which provided insights into the genetic factors influencing MMP expression in the context of rheumatoid arthritis. This finding contributed to the understanding of how genetic variations may impact arthritis-related inflammation.
title: Albumin-binding RNAi Conjugate for Carrier Free Treatment of Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs648044 was positively identified as mediating the effects of glucocorticoids on ZBTB16 gene expression. It was associated with educational attainment in two genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and showed significant links with neurobehavioral traits and generalized cortical thickness, indicating a role in adult cortical morphology. Specifically, this SNP modulated glucocorticoid-induced increases in ZBTB16 expression, which was tied to beneficial postnatal outcomes such as higher educational attainment and positive neuroimaging phenotypes.
title: Temporal regulation of ZBTB16 expression by glucocorticoids alters human cortical neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs11040205 was associated with the study by Šafranko et al. (2023), which investigated a synthetic approach for obtaining N-doped carbon quantum dots and their utility in the selective detection of Fe(III) ions. The findings suggested that this SNP may play a role in enhancing the detection capabilities of the nanoparticles synthesized from similar biochemical pathways, potentially linking to the plant growth effects observed with the CNPs from *Catharanthus roseus*.
title: Novel carbon nanoparticles (CNPs) from Catharanthus roseus petals for metal ion sensing and root growth modulation

finding: The SNP rs11020146 was associated with altered cholesterol metabolism, which is linked to the mTORC1 signaling pathway. This finding contributed to the understanding of how dysregulated mTOR activity might influence neurodevelopmental disorders, as it was noted that low cholesterol levels are related to various such disorders. The study highlighted the role of mTORC1 as a transcriptional regulator, thus establishing the significance of rs11020146 in the context of cholesterol biosynthesis in the developing brain.
title: mTOR driven gene transcription is required for cholesterol production in neurons of the developing cerebral cortex

finding: The AD variant rs10792831 was associated with the gene PICALM in microglia from control subjects, but the association was insignificant in microglia from Alzheimer’s disease (AD) subjects.
