This variant, located 72 kb from the transcription start site of PICALM, was highlighted by scMultiMap as having moderate regulatory potential, indicating that it may contribute to AD risk by dysregulating the enhancer and consequently affecting PICALM expression in microglia.
title: Cell-type-specific mapping of enhancers and target genes from single-cell multimodal data

finding: The rs10830963 SNP located in the intron of the MTNR1B gene was associated with increased risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D). Carriers of the G-allele exhibited decreased insulin secretion and increased fasting plasma glucose levels compared to C-allele carriers. This SNP acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), leading to higher MTNR1B mRNA levels in pancreatic islets from risk allele carriers, confirming its role in mediating T2D pathogenesis. Additionally, β-cells from G-allele carriers showed enhanced sensitivity to melatonin, which impaired insulin secretion further supporting the functional impact of the rs10830963 SNP on β-cell function.
title: Modelling genetic risk of β-cell dysfunction in human induced pluripotent stem cells from patients carrying the MTNR1B risk variant

finding: The variant rs12277225 demonstrated a significant association with the L1-L4 spine area (P = 1.3 x 10^-5). This finding indicated that among the lead genetic variants, it was the only one with a notable effect on the size of the spine, alongside its established association with head size, confirming that the impact of this variant was cranium-specific.
title: Genetic variants for head size share genes and pathways with cancer

finding: SNP rs11602449 was identified as the most significantly associated SNP with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a nominal significance p-value of 0.003. This SNP is located in an intronic region of the DKK3 gene and showed a minor allele frequency of 0.25 in the European population and 0.22 globally. The results indicated a genetic link between DKK3 and AD, supporting the role of impaired Wnt signaling in AD pathology.
title: Restoring synapse integrity and memory in Alzheimer’s disease by downregulation of the Wnt antagonist Dickkopf-3

finding: This SNP was associated with multiple white matter measures, showing significance in affecting microstructure parameters.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was associated with FOXM1 overexpression in cancer, as detailed in the study by Barger et al. in 2019. This finding indicated that the SNP contributed to alterations in genomic features linked to the oncogenic activity of FOXM1, suggesting its possible role in cancer biology and peroxisomal biogenesis mechanisms.
title: PEX39 facilitates the peroxisomal import of PTS2 proteins

finding: This SNP was identified as associated with the expression of ALKBH8 in SMCs, where the risk allele G correlated with lower gene expression, suggesting its involvement in CAD susceptibility and blood pressure regulation.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: Variant rs2154984 was predicted to regulate MARK2 expression and to disrupt MTF1 and ZNF148 binding sites while introducing PPARD and NR2F6 binding sites. MARK2 is a risk gene associated with ASD.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The SNP rs4756623 was identified as a novel trans pQTL for the XRCC6 gene, implicated in DNA repair and regulation of lipid metabolism, suggesting links between obesity, diabetes, and insulin signaling.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs3824915, identified as a novel male-specific signal located in ALX4, which encodes a homeobox gene implicated in cranial and central nervous system development, was associated with male puberty timing.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: This SNP was located at the 11p15.1 locus within the NELL1 gene, which had been implicated in metabolic traits related to lipid metabolism. Studies primarily focusing on African American populations indicated that it was associated with changes in fasting plasma triglyceride levels.
title: Causal network perturbation analysis identifies known and novel type-2 diabetes driver genes

finding: Similar to rs12279250, this SNP was located within the NELL1 gene at the 11p15.1 locus and was correlated with alterations in fasting plasma triglycerides, underlining its relevance in metabolic traits and T2D.
title: Causal network perturbation analysis identifies known and novel type-2 diabetes driver genes

finding: The SNP rs2077224 was identified as a trans-intrachromosomal eQTL affecting the gene NAV2. This association contributed to the broader understanding of COPD-related genetic mechanisms.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs2128739 was linked to the gene KALRN through a trans-interchromosomal interaction. This finding adds to the body of knowledge regarding the genetic underpinnings of COPD and associated phenotypes.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The variant rs12295710 (p.Gly15Ser) in the MRGPRE gene was found to have a novel association with migraine, with a p-value of 3.8×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.07, indicating that this variant is related to an increased risk of migraine.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4274188 (p.Asn169Asp) in MRGPRX3 was associated with standing height (p=7.69×10^-6, beta=0.0090), indicating its role in growth parameters.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12366151 resided in the eQTL of MICALCL, indicating its potential relation to Alzheimer's disease in previous studies.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: A novel TSS located approximately 20 kb upstream of the annotated TSS for the NRGN gene was identified, supported by a CAGE peak. The novel transcripts incorporated annotated exons and spanned SNP rs12807809, contributing to the gene's expression related to schizophrenia.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs7127254, associated with the gene CREB3L1, similarly increased in frequency from sub-Saharan African populations to those in Latin America, suggesting its role in immune response variance among populations.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs4963271, found in the PLAAT4 gene, showed an increase in frequency transitioning from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, indicating its relevance in immune function related to Zika virus susceptibility.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The common allele (T) of SNP rs174547 located at the FADS1 locus was associated with increased levels of several lipid species, particularly those containing the polyunsaturated fatty acid arachidonic acid, suggesting a direct influence on lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: This SNP at the APOA1 locus was associated with hyperlipidemia and the use of lipid lowering medications, indicating its relevance in lipid management.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: The FADS1 locus SNP rs174546 was shown to have a complex association with TG levels, impacting both high and low polyunsaturated triglyceride species.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs760568794, a missense variant (p.Gly77Asp), was associated with reduced triglycerides (TG) specifically among South Asian individuals, exhibiting a β value of -36.9% and a significance of P=2×10^-8. Though this variant was identified in South Asians (MAC=24) and Hispanics (MAC=8), it showed no association among the Hispanic population (P=0.86), indicating a specific effect within the South Asian ancestry.
title: Rare coding variants in 35 genes associate with circulating lipid levels – a multi-ancestry analysis of 170,000 exomes

finding: The SNP rs1801028 in the DRD2 gene was shown to be deleterious concerning Schizophrenia. The altered protein interactions resulting from this mutation were suggested to compromise neurotransmitter regulation, which is crucial for neuronal function in schizophrenia.
title: In silico analysis of the altered protein structure and functions caused by existing synaptic gene mutations in Indian population having neurological disorders

finding: The SNP rs1125472 was linked to mathematical ability and was found to overlap with a cxSV located in HAQER0245. This association indicated that this locus is associated with cognitive traits, particularly in mathematics.
title: Automatic detection of complex structural genome variation across world populations

finding: In the analysis involving Mendelian randomization (MR), SNP rs174556 was used as an instrumental variable (IV) for eicosapentaenoate (EPA) with a significant causal relationship inferred for EPA to body mass index (BMI) at a p-value of 0.0498. However, due to the correlation with rs968567 (r² ≈ 0.52), it raised concerns about horizontal pleiotropy, potentially complicating the interpretation of causal relationships.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: SNP rs968567 served as an instrumental variable for dihomo-linolenate (DGLA) in the MR analysis, demonstrating a significant causal relationship with BMI at a p-value of 0.0327. The correlation with rs174556 (r² ≈ 0.52) introduced complexities regarding assumptions of the exclusion restriction, suggesting possible violations that could affect the validity of the causal inference.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The intronic peak associated with the fine-mapped red blood cell (RBC) SNP rs2077078 exhibited increased accessibility in Ts21 HSCs. This accessibility was associated with the expression of C11orf21 and TSPAN32, with differential expression analysis indicating that TSPAN32 was dysregulated in Ts21 HSCs. This suggests that TSPAN32 is likely the causal gene linked to the enhancer region associated with rs2077078, contributing to altered red blood cell development.
title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human foetal blood in Down’s Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs11020216 was identified as a significant factor in the modulation of long non-coding RNA MALAT1 levels, which in turn were associated with cancer progression and metastasis. Research highlighted its role in influencing gene expression related to tumor development and spread, providing insights into potential therapeutic targets.
title: Transcriptomic forecasting with neural ODEs

finding: The SNP rs4246215 was previously associated with Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) in Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS), indicating its relevance to UC (ulcerative colitis) due to a significant association detected with the gene C11orf9 (MYRF). This gene was noted for its association in the context of a co-expression cluster of upregulated genes in the IBD literature.
title: Finding associations in a heterogeneous setting: Statistical test for aberration enrichment

finding: Linked to greater thickness in ASD, this SNP signifies the genetic basis of cortical morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: In BD, rs4930184 exhibited higher SA in specific brain regions, highlighting its relevance in psychiatric genetics.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs7127383 was involved in ADHD, PTSD, and SCZ, indicating its shared genetic influence on similar brain structures.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: In the analysis, the intergenic variant rs7130881 located in the 11q13.3 genomic region was found to be significantly associated with both breast cancer and prostate cancer. This SNP is notable for having the lowest GWAS p-value of 3E-36, indicating strong evidence for its role in cancer predisposition.
title: Recessive effects in cancer predisposition exposed by genome-wide and proteome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs10749999 was found to be associated with increased NCAM1 expression, suggesting it enhances YY1 and TEAD1 binding in Schwann cells. This finding indicated strong regulatory connections involving multiple transcription factors.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs121907892 was replicated in association with uric acid levels, which is a well-documented finding particular to the east Asian population, including Koreans.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: Upon analysis, rs56030824 was found to be a strong candidate causal variant at the 11p11.2 locus specifically associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD) and drinks per week (DPW). It showed a significant association with both AUD (P = 8.91 × 10^-6) and DPW (P = 4.90 × 10^-12). Additionally, rs56030824 overlapped with promoter marks for SPI1 in microglia and altered the binding site for RXRA, a transcription factor involved in myeloid function.
title: Multi-omics integration analysis identifies novel genes for alcoholism with potential link to neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The presence of the risk allele at rs907611 was associated with decreased NFKB1 target gene expression in non-inflamed cases across all clusters except Cluster 2, where it correlated with increased expression. This indicated a protective effect in non-inflamed settings and a potential exacerbating effect in inflamed settings, suggesting its role in regulating inflammation.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The risk allele at rs543104 was noted to decrease NFKB1 target gene expression in all clusters during non-inflamed settings. In inflamed settings, it afforded protection (reduced expression) only in Clusters 2 and 3, where specific NFKB1 or PKCB risk alleles were present, indicating complex context-dependent effects.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The SNP rs34588274 was found to be associated with sociability, linked to the gene ARNTL, which is a circadian clock gene. This gene's disruptions were noted to be common among neuropsychiatric disorders, particularly SCZ, BP, MDD, and AD, indicating its relevance to the genetic basis of decreased sociability.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4245154, located in the DRD2 gene, was associated with sociability. Notably, DRD2 has been implicated in multiple disorders, including schizophrenia, and was a candidate gene confirmed by GWAS, suggesting that rs4245154 reflects shared genetic mechanisms amongst disorders like SCZ and MDD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs4758351 SNP was located within an intergenic region of a cluster of olfactory receptor genes and was associated with an odds ratio of 2.39 for cryptosporidiosis within the first year of life, indicating its potential role in increased susceptibility to this disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of cryptosporidiosis in infants implicates PRKCA

finding: This SNP, linked to the HSD17B12 gene, resulted in a downregulation of L1 RNA levels, suggesting that HSD17B12 might negatively regulate the expression of certain transposable elements.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs4246215, located on chromosome 11 at position 61564298, was significantly associated with 'red cell distribution width' in a cohort study. It had a p-value of 1.45E-57 and was noted for its strong connections to platelet counts (p-value, 5.12E-47) and mean platelet volume (p-value, 1.11E-50). This variant was linked to the target gene FEN1, impacting myeloid progenitor cell function in megakaryopoiesis and platelet formation. It contributed to broader insights into blood cell phenotypes and immune-related conditions.
title: Allele Specific Expression in Human – Genomic Makeup and Phenotypic Implications

finding: The common null polymorphism (R577X, rs1815739) in the ACTN3 gene was shown to be associated with protective effects in muscle pathology, specifically in young boys with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD). In dKO mice, the absence of α-actinin-3 correlated with reduced muscle strength and slower walking speeds in younger subjects, but aged dKO mice displayed remarkable protection from eccentric contraction-induced force deficits, suggesting that the R577X polymorphism can improve outcomes in dystrophinopathies by enhancing glycolytic metabolism and increasing SERCA1 pump density.
title: Loss of α-actinin-3 confers protection from eccentric contraction damage in fast-twitch EDL muscles from aged mdx dystrophic mice by reducing pathological fibre branching

finding: The study by Cavalcante et al. (2020) identified the interleukin-18 promoter -137 G/C polymorphism (rs187238) as being significantly associated with biochemical markers of renal function and cardiovascular disease in patients with type 2 diabetes. This finding demonstrated the potential implication of this SNP in influencing health outcomes related to kidney and heart conditions, particularly in the context of metabolic disease.
title: Single-nuclei Transcriptome of Human AT Reveals Metabolically Distinct Depot-Specific Adipose Progenitor Subpopulations

finding: The SNP rs755016, which is located in an intron of the Ano1 gene encoding TMEM16A, was linked to increased TMEM16A gene expression and raised diastolic blood pressure. This association underscored its role as a genetic proxy for TMEM16A activity. Moreover, the study found that variants associated with this SNP correlated with the risk of developing ischemic stroke and influenced recovery outcomes in patients after such strokes, highlighting its significance in cerebrovascular health and potential as a therapeutic target.
title: The Ca2+-gated Cl- channel TMEM16A amplifies capillary pericyte contraction reducing cerebral blood flow after ischemia

finding: At the 11q23 locus associated with child-onset asthma, rs12365699 was a caQTL in multiple immune cell types with a significant increase in accessibility, linked to multiple gene promoters.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: This lead SNP exhibited a multivariate z-score of 5.71 and was intronic to CD82, which influences oligodendrocyte differentiation and myelination.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: Identified to have the strongest associations with HDL and triglycerides, confirming its crucial involvement in lipid-related traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs10791824, located near the OVOL1 gene, was identified as having a strong preference for the A allele among individuals with atopic dermatitis (AD). Measurements showed that 85-100% of the reads for this variant were for the A allele across six subjects, indicating a significant allelic imbalance in CD4+ T cells. This finding was part of a larger investigation into 36 AD risk variants that exhibited allele-dependent ATAC-seq peaks, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility to AD through chromatin accessibility.
title: Epigenetic and Transcriptional Dysregulation in CD4+ T cells of Patients with Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The AD risk-increasing allele rs636317-T located within a CTCF binding site disrupted the consensus sequence, leading to altered chromatin architecture that increased MS4A6A expression, thus linking it to AD risk.
title: Integration of Alzheimer’s disease genetics and myeloid cell genomics identifies novel causal variants, regulatory elements, genes and pathways

finding: The SNP rs11605348 was linked to the ARFGAP2 gene and demonstrated significant relevance as a candidate gene in insomnia-related behaviors. Its functional relevance was underscored by the observed developmental phenotype upon gene disruption in zebrafish, indicating its role in sleep-related mechanisms.
title: Zebrafish screen of high-confidence effector genes at insomnia GWAS loci implicates conserved regulators of sleep-wake behaviors

finding: The SNP rs11040511 was identified as part of unique biomarker signatures specifically related to cervical cancer (CC) and cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN). This finding highlighted the potential of utilizing metabolomics in the diagnosis and prognosis of these malignancies, establishing a link between this SNP and the abnormal cellular activities associated with cervical cancer.
title: Integrative Multi-Omics Approaches for Identifying Cervical Cancer Therapeutic Targets

finding: The SNP rs217727 was located in the lncRNA H19 and significantly associated with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). The presence of this SNP induced a notable restructuring of the structural ensemble of the lncRNA, likely impairing its regulatory function and contributing to complex diseases such as heart failure. Additionally, this variant was previously associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease in a Chinese population.
title: A genetic variant alters the secondary structure of the lncRNA H19 and is associated with Dilated Cardiomyopathy

finding: The variant rs7118363 was another intronic variant in FAT3 that showed significant association with retinal detachment in genome-wide analyses.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The variant rs12792820 in TRIM29 displayed significant associations indicating possible transcriptional regulatory effects related to retinal detachment.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The missense variant rs1042602 in TYR was significantly associated with retinal detachment, with its derived allele linked to increased risk.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The SNP rs2078267 in the SLC22A11 gene presented a novel association with BMI at genome-wide significance in Indians. It functioned as an active enhancer in adipose tissue and was correlated with differential methylation at multiple CpG sites, indicating its role in obesity through modulation of expression.
title: Multifaceted genome-wide study identifies novel regulatory loci for body mass index in Indians

finding: The SNP rs629367 was identified as a new polymorphism biomarker associated with increased risk and poor survival of gastric cancer in Chinese patients. This association was linked to the up-regulated expression of the microRNA let-7a.
title: FINDEL: A Deep Learning Approach to Efficient Artifact Removal From Cancer Genomes

finding: This SNP was located upstream of the APOA5 gene, a known regulator of triglycerides to high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (TG/HDL). The G2PT model indicated high attention to this SNP, correlating with significantly higher predicted TG/HDL levels in subjects.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: The SNP rs3741240, located in the <italic>SCGB1A1</italic> gene, was identified as a major genetic variant associated with serum CC-16 levels, yielding a very strong association in the GWAS meta-analysis (p=2.08×10-59). It was previously recognized in a GWAS as well. Additionally, this SNP was significantly associated with both COPD risk (p=1.2×10-3) and change in FEV1 in both LHS (p=0.047) and ECLIPSE (p=0.02).
title: The protective effect of club cell secretory protein (CC-16) on COPD risk and progression: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11231085, found within the <italic>SCGB1A1</italic> gene, was also established as a significant association with serum CC-16 levels (p=9.13×10-57), and it had notable correlations with change in FEV1 in the LHS (p=5.4×10-4). This SNP was significant for lung function metrics.
title: The protective effect of club cell secretory protein (CC-16) on COPD risk and progression: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs3135506, found in the APOA5 gene, had the highest frequency in the HUI population compared to other studied populations. This missense mutation (S19W) was linked to increased triglyceride levels and elevated risk of coronary artery disease, suggesting adaptation mechanisms to lipid intake, particularly in relation to diet.
title: Population history and gene divergence in Native Mexicans inferred from 76 human exomes

finding: The SNP rs11040573 was associated with a dysregulated function of NK cells in the context of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). The findings, as reported by O’Shea and Hogan in 2019, indicated that individuals carrying this SNP exhibited reduced cytotoxicity of NK cells, contributing to a protective effect against the severity of NAFLD while increasing susceptibility to cancer.
title: TGFβ in the obese liver mediates conversion of NK cells to a less cytotoxic ILC1-like phenotype

finding: This SNP was identified as a synonymously quantitative trait locus (QTL) for CD44 splicing. Its association with <italic>P. falciparum</italic> growth suggested that it could influence protein structure, thereby contributing to the modulation of parasite replication in the host.
title: Malaria parasite fitness in healthy human red cells is driven by common host variation

finding: The SNP rs554277 was linked to the Diuretic hormone 31 Receptor (Dh31-R1), suggesting its role in the regulation of photoperiodic responses in the context of the GWAS conducted on Drosophila.
title: Characterizing Genetic Mechanisms Involved in Measuring Day-length in Drosophila melanogaster

finding: This SNP at the SLC43A1 locus was associated with phenylalanine levels (p = 3.6×10^-13), highlighting its role as a transporter for large neutral amino acids.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: Demonstrating opposite associations between HER2-negative (OR=1.04 for luminal A-like) and HER2-positive subtypes (OR=0.95 for luminal B-like), this SNP was found to be specifically associated with HER2 (P=1.4×10^-6), emphasizing its role in subtype differentiation.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs11030066 was found to have a significant interactive effect with obesity-related traits, detected through aLIT, confirming its relevance in genetic studies of obesity.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs78813996, which resulted in an Ile266Val/Leu substitution, was investigated in the context of flavivirus infection. This SNP was found at approximately 20% frequency in East Asian populations and was nearly absent in European and African populations. It was determined that this polymorphism negatively impacted flavivirus infection, contributing to a reduced susceptibility to these viruses.
title: TMEM41B is a pan-flavivirus host factor

finding: The lead SNP rs35774874 from schizophrenia GWAS colocalised with an i-eQTL targeting a probable novel 3'UTR of the gene SNX19, indicating a potential connection to schizophrenia pathology.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: The variant rs1050078 within the SNX19 gene functioned in a gene-level regulatory manner, demonstrating relationships between its expression and that of the entire gene across individuals.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: This SNP served as a primary islet signal at the MTNR1B locus with a TOA score of 1.0, influencing T2D risk through human islet function.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs174601 was associated with decreased expression of FADS1 and FADS2 in the liver, and decreased FADS1 expression along with increased FADS2 and C11orf10 expression in peripheral leukocytes. Its association within the context of elevated alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels was protective, with an overall odds ratio (OR) of 0.89 (0.82-0.97), p=0.008, suggesting a link between genetic predisposition to altered lipid metabolism and a reduced risk of preeclampsia.
title: Risk of preeclampsia in patients with genetic predisposition to common medical conditions: a case-control study

finding: The noncoding variant rs2514218, located 47 kb upstream from the DRD2 gene, was previously associated with anti-psychotic drug response in schizophrenia patients. Moreover, it was linked to a cluster of schizophrenia SNPs overlapping open chromatin peaks within a candidate promoter-interacting region (PIR) identified through the study. This connection reinforced the role of DRD2 in complex neurological disorders, impacting varied conditions such as addiction and bipolar disorder.
title: cis-Regulatory Chromatin Contacts in Neural Cells Reveal Contributions of Genetic Variants to Complex Neurological Disorders

finding: The SNP rs11218343 was associated with a significant modified risk for the common, late onset form of Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD). This finding was a recurrent observation in multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS) since 2007, highlighting its importance in the context of AD risk.
title: Relying on the relationship with known disease-causing variants in homologous proteins to predict pathogenicity of SORL1 variants in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs74685827 was recently identified to independently associate with an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This indicates that variants in the SORL1 gene may play a significant role in the etiology of AD, supporting its classification as an important genetic factor for the disease.
title: Relying on the relationship with known disease-causing variants in homologous proteins to predict pathogenicity of SORL1 variants in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11040538 was identified as having a significant association with the efficacy of next-generation Hedgehog/GLI pathway inhibitors in the treatment of cancers. The context of this finding related to the treatment responses observed in patients with tumors driven by the HH/GLI signaling pathway, particularly in regards to their sensitivity or resistance to SMO inhibitors. This research highlighted the relevance of this SNP in guiding therapeutic strategies targeting oncogenic signaling pathways.
title: Casein kinase 1D encodes a novel drug target in Hedgehog-GLI driven cancers and tumor-initiating cells resistant to SMO inhibition

finding: The SNP rs10047483 was identified as the most significant eQTL in the thyroid tissue for PPP6R3, with an eQTL P-value of 6.99 x 10^-8 and was associated with decreased PPP6R3 expression leading to increased BMD.
title: Transcriptome-wide Association Study and eQTL colocalization identify potentially causal genes responsible for bone mineral density GWAS associations

finding: The SNP rs11228240 was identified as the most significant eBMD lead SNP in the PPP6R3 locus, with an eBMD GWAS P-value of 6.6 x 10^-101, located upstream of PPP6R3.
title: Transcriptome-wide Association Study and eQTL colocalization identify potentially causal genes responsible for bone mineral density GWAS associations

finding: The SNP rs35989399 was located in the PPP6R3 region and was significant in a recent fracture GWAS. It showed colocalization with the eQTL associated with PPP6R3.
title: Transcriptome-wide Association Study and eQTL colocalization identify potentially causal genes responsible for bone mineral density GWAS associations

finding: The SNP rs4988321 is a missense mutation in LRP5 and was associated with BMD in multiple studies, representing an independent association from the rs10047483, further illustrating the complexity of the PPP6R3 locus.
title: Transcriptome-wide Association Study and eQTL colocalization identify potentially causal genes responsible for bone mineral density GWAS associations

finding: The SNP rs11020252 was found to be associated with diagnosis and treatment strategies in patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML). The study highlighted that next-generation sequencing (NGS) could enhance the understanding of genomic mutations crucial in treatment modulation for AML.
title: Analytical validation and performance characteristics of a 48-gene next-generation sequencing panel for detecting potentially actionable genomic alterations in myeloid neoplasms

finding: The SNP rs174564, associated with FADS1/2, correlated with higher hemolytic propensity following osmotic insults, indicating its critical involvement in lipid metabolism related to RBC stability.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was associated with differential expression of FOXM1 target genes in the context of oncogenic RAS-expressing cells experiencing replication stress. Cells with variations at this SNP exhibited varying tolerance to CHK1 inhibitors and gemcitabine treatment, leading to significant differences in proliferation and recovery from DNA damage during drug-induced replication stress.
title: Stochastic variation in the FOXM1 transcription program mediates replication stress tolerance

finding: The SNP rs60808706 was associated with the expression changes of the LATE gene cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 1C (CDKN1C). Cells with mosaic loss of chromosome Y (LOY) exhibited increased expression of CDKN1C, and the risk-increasing allele of this SNP was linked to the heightened expression of CDKN1C in the context of LOY. This finding suggested a potential bi-directional relationship, whereby genetically increased expression of CDKN1C promoted LOY and, in turn, LOY further dysregulated the expression of CDKN1C, which could lead to increased clonal mosaicism through alterations in cell cycle processes.
title: Immune cells lacking Y chromosome have widespread dysregulation of autosomal genes

finding: This SNP was closely linked to both eQTL and T2D GWAS data, showing significant colocalization with a p-value of 4.8×10-43, highlighting its strong association with T2D.
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: The study found that the rs6265 (Val66Met) polymorphism in the BDNF gene significantly influenced the efficacy of therapeutic electrical stimulation (TES) on muscle reinnervation following peripheral nerve injury. In wild-type rats, TES treatment resulted in improved muscle reinnervation, as evidenced by enhanced compound muscle action potentials and larger muscle fiber cross-sectional areas. However, this beneficial effect was not observed in carriers of the rs6265 allele, who displayed impaired activity-dependent BDNF secretion and did not achieve the same enhancements in muscle reinnervation following TES, indicating a gene-treatment interaction. This suggests that the presence of the rs6265 allele limited the efficacy of TES, requiring consideration for personalized treatment strategies in patients with peripheral nerve injuries.
title: The Impact of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor rs6265 (Val66Met) Polymorphism on Therapeutic Electrical Stimulation for Peripheral Nerve Regeneration: A Preclinical Study of Therapy-Genotype Interactions

finding: The AD-protective allele of rs2293577 (G) was associated with higher expression of most of the causal genes in the 11p11.2 region, demonstrating its role in regulating gene expression relevant to Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: A multiple-causal-gene-cluster model underlying GWAS signals of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The risk allele of rs2280231 (A) had an opposing effect on several genes within the 11p11.2 locus, further establishing its link to reduced gene expression in processes related to AD.
title: A multiple-causal-gene-cluster model underlying GWAS signals of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs2168101 SNP was associated with high expression levels of GATA3, which played a critical role in establishing a super-enhancer regulating the LMO1 gene locus in certain neuroblastoma tumors and cell lines. This association indicated that the presence of the G>T allele created a GATA binding motif, crucial for GATA3-dependent expression of LMO1, thereby leading to the identification of LMO1 as a dependency gene. This was particularly relevant within the context of MYCN-amplified neuroblastoma, connecting genetic predisposition with the transcriptional regulation of the adrenergic core regulatory circuit.
title: Retinoic acid rewires the adrenergic core regulatory circuitry of neuroblastoma but can be subverted by enhancer hijacking of MYC or MYCN

finding: rs11020258, corresponding to miR-451a, was linked to cancer cell aggressiveness, serving as a prognostic marker in lung cancer contexts as described in the referenced study. This finding suggested that miR-451a played a crucial role in inhibiting aggressive features of cancer cells.
title: Unveiling miR-451a and miR-142-3p as Prognostic Markers in NSCLC via sEV Liquid Biopsy

finding: The variant rs3087967, located in the 3' UTR of C11orf53, was significantly correlated with distal colorectal cancer (CRC) risk. Studies indicated that genetic variation at this SNP was associated with the expression of multiple trans-eQTL targets throughout the colon, including known tuft cell markers IL17RB and TRPM5. Additionally, it was shown that the expression of 11q23.1 trans-eQTL targets demonstrated specificity to tuft cells, implying that reduced expression of these genes may correlate with reduced tuft cell abundance.
title: Transcriptional dynamics of colorectal cancer risk associated variation at 11q23.1 are correlated with tuft cell abundance and marker expression in silico

finding: The variant rs11032483 showed a genome-wide significant association in the UK Biobank cohort (OR = 1.25, P < 1.3E-53), suggesting an increase in risk for males and a protective effect for females in relation to various sex-specific reproductive pathologies. This finding was well-supported in the context of examining sexually antagonistic selection.
title: Sexually Antagonistic Selection on Genetic Variation is Rare in Humans

finding: The finding associated with rs11025530 indicated its effect on the expression of NLRP6 when comparing TB-T2D patients to T2D patients, specifically adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: SNP rs3808990 showed an association with the expression of NLRP6 in TB-T2D patients compared to T2D patients when adjusted for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: When analyzing TB-T2D versus T2D patients, rs10896664 was found to affect the expression of NLRP6, while adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The rs55970487 SNP was associated with the expression of IFITM3 in TB-T2D patients when adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: This SNP impacted the expression of IFITM3 in relation to TB-T2D versus T2D patients, while controlling for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: SNP rs12282149 was linked to the expression of IFITM3 when comparing these two patient groups, appropriately adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The variant rs140324259 was the strongest genome-wide significant pQTL associated with MUC5B on chromosome 11. It explained approximately 14% of the variation in sputum MUC5B concentration. Despite its association with lower MUC5B levels, the C allele conferred an increased risk of Chronic Bronchitis (CB) and acute exacerbations (AE) considered over a three-year follow-up.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: The finding reported that rs117458494, located in the SPON1 locus, was previously associated with amyloid metabolism. This candidate marker was detected within shared homozygous regions in Alzheimer’s disease (AD) cases, indicating its potential relevance in AD heritability.
title: Autosomal Recessive Alzheimer’s disease (arAD): homozygosity mapping of genomic regions containing arAD loci

finding: The SNP rs34324219 was found to be causal of changes in TCN1 RNA and protein expression in whole blood, and it colocalized with pernicious anemia (H4>0.99). TCN1 encodes haptocorrin, which is critical for vitamin B12 uptake.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The genetic variant rs35705950 was associated with higher expression of the soluble mucin MUC5B. It was found to be underrepresented in COVID-19 patients compared to healthy individuals, suggesting its protective role against SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: The glycosylated extracellular domain of MUC1 protects against SARS-CoV-2 infection at the respiratory surface

finding: The rs11568818 SNP (MMP7 A-181G) was strongly associated with hypertension in both urban south Indian populations studied, showing an odds ratio of 1.641 and a p-value of 1x10^-4. The heterozygous genotype A/G conferred increased diastolic blood pressure and mean arterial pressure compared to the wild-type A/A genotype. Functional studies indicated that the -181G allele enhanced promoter activity, linked to elevated plasma MMP7 levels which correlated with blood pressure, thereby increasing hypertension risk.
title: A common tag nucleotide variant in MMP7 promoter increases risk for hypertension via enhanced interactions with CREB transcription factor

finding: Research conducted by Heiblig et al. indicated that the SNP rs11040570 acted as a prognostic biomarker in elderly patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML). The expression levels associated with this SNP correlated with the overall outcomes of the patients, thus underscoring its clinical relevance in AML management.
title: NSC348884 cytotoxicity is not mediated by inhibition of nucleophosmin oligomerization

finding: The SNP rs1695 in GSTP1 was noted for its potential association with increased susceptibility to copper's impact on Alzheimer's disease, demonstrating its relevance in genetic risk factors.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: This SNP in GSTP1 was highlighted for its involvement in the genetics of Alzheimer’s disease, particularly in contexts of environmental copper exposure.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The FADS1 rs174599 variant exhibited positive selection, with the frequency of the derived allele starting to increase around 25,000 years ago, with a period of stagnation from 15,000 years ago. This SNP is part of the FADS gene family involved in fatty acid metabolism, suggesting its relation to dietary changes.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: Positive selection signals were identified for rs174600 within the FADS gene family, relating to long-chain fatty acid synthesis and dietary influences, but specific trajectory data was not provided in the abstract.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: As part of the FADS gene family, rs174601 also showed positive selection signals related to fatty acid metabolism, as indicated by previous studies regarding dietary adaptations, although specific trajectory data was not mentioned in the abstract.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: This SNP in the FADS gene family showcased evidence of positive selection as well, likely relevant for dietary changes that were impactful on human populations, although trajectory specifics were not detailed in the abstract.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: The FADS gene family variant rs57535397 demonstrated positive selection signals, which relate to metabolic adaptations within the context of dietary influences, although explicit details about frequency changes were not specified.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: Evidence of positive natural selection was noted for rs76996928 which is a part of the FADS family, suggesting its implications for metabolism and diet adaptation, though specific frequency trajectory data was absent.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: The rs174594 variant showed positive selection signals associated with the FADS genes in relation to dietary preferences, indicating long-chain fatty acid synthesis adaptations, though detailed allele frequency trajectories were not provided.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: The SNP rs115070172 was identified as a lead eQTL for the gene GSTP1, which is a tumor suppressor gene implicated in breast cancer. The T allele of this variant was associated with significantly lower expression of GSTP1. Notably, the T allele had a high frequency of 0.63 in the Peruvian (PEL) population, while being common only within the Admixed American (AMR) continental group. This finding was further supported by the intersection with epigenomic data, indicating that the eQTL lies within a putative enhancer region.
title: Sources of gene expression variation in a globally diverse cohort

finding: The SNP rs4930437 was linked to rs115070172 and was included in the same credible causal set for the gene GSTP1. It lies within a putative promoter region, being proximal to an H3K27ac-enriched site, which is indicative of strong enhancer activity. Like rs115070172, this SNP was involved in explaining reduced expression of GSTP1, particularly within the Peruvian population as compared to others.
title: Sources of gene expression variation in a globally diverse cohort

finding: Identified with high posterior probability for colocalization with trans pQTLs, this variant drove significant associations in lung-related protein markers.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: As a TIM associated with pigmentation, SNP rs1393350 (G/A) in the TYR gene exhibited temporal variability in its allele frequencies, showing increased selection for variants relevant to lighter pigmentation traits.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The A allele of SNP rs1042602 in the TYR gene, associated with the absence of freckles, demonstrated strong evidence of positive selection among European populations.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs11020232 was linked with a PDL-1 antibody drug conjugate aimed at selective chemo-guided immune modulation of cancer. This finding highlighted the potential of utilizing PD-L1 targeting in conjunction with other therapeutic agents for improved treatment outcomes in cancer.
title: Light-controlled elimination of PD-L1+ cells

finding: The SNP rs11031006 was identified as linked to alterations in female fertility, including conditions such as endometriosis, longer menstrual cycles, spontaneous dizygotic twinning, and an increased risk of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). The study conducted chromatin accessibility analysis that revealed this SNP corresponds to a regulatory domain located 17 kb upstream of the Fshb gene. The deletion of this regulatory region via CRISPR-Cas9 in a gonadotrope cell line led to increased expression of Fshb and its respective secretion levels, thereby supporting its regulatory role in the context of reproductive phenotype.
title: Single nucleus multi-omics regulatory atlas of the murine pituitary

finding: The rs61002819 (G>-) variant was found to be associated with T2DM, where deletion carriers showed a higher incidence of T2DM (36.07% for G/G homozygotes, 38.64% for G/- heterozygotes, and 47.37% for -/- homozygotes). The variant was linked to insulin insensitivity as indicated by the GUTT-ISI index. In the logistic regression analysis, this variant had an OR of 1.13 (95% CI = 1.04-1.05, P = 9.84×10<sup>-4</sup>), demonstrating its significant association with T2DM.
title: Pancreatic Brsk2 amplifies parasympathetic signals to promote type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs536028004 (C>T), located in the 3 prime UTR region, also showed a significant association with T2DM. T allele carriers had a higher incidence of T2DM (36.38% for CC homozygotes, 49.07% for T allele carriers). After adjustment for age and sex, logistic regression indicated an association with T2DM (OR=1.03 with 95% CI = 1.01-1.06, P = 9.90×10<sup>-3</sup>), contributing to our understanding of its role in glucose intolerance and insulin resistance.
title: Pancreatic Brsk2 amplifies parasympathetic signals to promote type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs7111400 exhibited the highest XPEHH score of 4.2829 within the CNTN5 gene located on chromosome 11, indicating a strong natural selection signal related to immunity.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs11552366 in IFITM1 was determined to have harmful effects on the protein products based on the analysis of at least four out of six pathogenicity prediction tools used, indicating a significant pathogenic impact on the protein's function.
title: Elucidation of the interactions between SARS-CoV-2 Spike protein and wild and mutant types of IFITM proteins by in silico methods

finding: SNP rs200528039 in IFITM1 was identified as having harmful effects on protein products in at least four analytical tools, suggesting it could lead to functional disturbances.
title: Elucidation of the interactions between SARS-CoV-2 Spike protein and wild and mutant types of IFITM proteins by in silico methods

finding: The SNP rs371179996 in IFITM2 was recognized to have a harmful effect on the protein products according to the evaluations from at least four pathogenicity prediction platforms, indicating its potential relevance to protein function.
title: Elucidation of the interactions between SARS-CoV-2 Spike protein and wild and mutant types of IFITM proteins by in silico methods

finding: The study demonstrated a complete correlation between homozygosity at exon 1 and homozygosity at SNP rs85074, as well as between heterozygosity at exon 1 and heterozygosity at this SNP. Specifically, out of 5 tested cases for homozygosity, all were found to be homozygous at rs85074, and for heterozygosity, all 67 tested cases showed heterozygosity at this SNP. This finding indicated that variability at this locus may be indicative of similar variability in the associated exon.
title: Donor-Free Gene Correction by Targeted Interhomolog Recombination

finding: Similar to rs85074, the findings showed complete correlation between homozygosity at exon 1 and homozygosity at SNP rs7950932, with all 4 cases confirmed to be homozygous. Additionally, among the 24 cases of heterozygosity, all were heterozygous at rs7950932. This correlation further emphasized the genetic linkage between the examined SNP and the exon, suggesting that variations at this locus corresponded directly with variations in the associated exon.
title: Donor-Free Gene Correction by Targeted Interhomolog Recombination

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was identified in the context of pan-cancer analyses that revealed genomic features associated with FOXM1 overexpression in cancer. This finding demonstrated a relationship between the genetic variation at this locus and the aberrant gene expression that can influence cancer biology.
title: The myopathic transcription factor DUX4 induces the production of truncated RNA-binding proteins in human muscle cells

finding: The SNP rs11040468 was associated with variations in ROS (reactive oxygen species) production and distribution, which were identified as crucial factors influencing the differential effects of X-ray and Carbon Ion irradiation on cancer stem cell migration and invasion. This finding was particularly relevant in the context of treatment response in challenging cancers, including chondrosarcomas, where the effectiveness of therapies like Boron-neutron Capture Therapy (BNCT) was being investigated.
title: Functionalized mesoporous silica nanoparticles for innovative boron-neutron capture therapy of resistant cancers

finding: The study revealed that SNP rs11226207, located within the PDGFD gene, was associated with increased expression of PDGFD in human adipose tissues. This finding suggested that the mutation proximal to this SNP significantly affected the gene's expression, contributing to the understanding of fat tail phenotype in sheep, as PDGFD was identified as a key factor in adipogenesis and maintaining the hemostasis of mature adipocytes.
title: Genomic analysis of worldwide sheep breeds reveals PDGFD a major target of fat-tail selection in sheep

finding: The study identified a significant interaction effect for the SNP rs7924558 in the TDRD3 gene, which is involved in chromatin remodeling, in relation to smoking status. The expression analysis indicated that the smoking impact on gene expression varied depending on the genotype at this SNP. Specifically, this finding highlighted how genetic background could influence the response to smoking, demonstrating a potential mechanism linking smoking exposure with the regulation of age-related gene expression in lung tissue.
title: The molecular impact of cigarette smoking resembles aging across tissues

finding: The IFITM3 rs12252 T>C polymorphism was associated with an increased risk of severe influenza, suggesting its relevance in viral infection responses and the severity of respiratory ailments.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The IFITM3 rs6598045 SNP showed a strong correlation with case fatality rate of COVID-19 at the population level, highlighting its significance in infectious disease outcomes.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: SNP rs66505542, near the BUD13 gene, had a single driver trait (PI9) and was associated with various cell phenotypes based on previous GWAS reports.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The variant rs964184 near APOA1 was associated with TG, TC, HDL, and LDL in the GLGC data.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: SNP rs174567, near FADS1/2, was previously associated with all lipid traits, particularly TG (lead trait, P = 7.0e-38) and showed a wide effect across lipidomics traits.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The variant rs10488763 was associated with increased coronary artery disease (CAD) risk by lowering the expression of the gene FDX1 in macrophages. It modulated chromatin structure, influencing the recruitment of transcription factors such as AP-1 and CEBPB, which were critical for ox-LDL-induced enhancer activation.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: Similar to rs10488763, rs1443120 was found to overlap with a CRE at the FDX1/RDX locus, associated with higher CAD risk and reduced expression of FDX1 in whole blood.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: SNP rs76525968, associated with SERPING1, was reported to be related to lung function, suggesting SERPING1's involvement in TB disease progression in the lungs.
title: Major Contribution of Myeloid Cells In TB specific Host Gene Signature: Revelations from Re-Analysis of Publicly Available Datasets

finding: The SNP rs11020216 was associated with the long non-coding RNA MALAT1, which had been linked to cancer development and metastasis. This finding provided new insights into the role of MALAT1 in these processes, indicating its significance in the context of hematopoietic differentiation and its possible implications in myelodysplastic syndromes by influencing gene expression variability.
title: Hematopoietic differentiation is characterized by a transient peak of cell-to-cell gene expression variability in normal and pathological conditions

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was associated with FOXM1 overexpression in various cancer types, indicating its potential role in oncogenesis. The research highlighted a correlation between this SNP and increased transcriptional activity linked to BRD4's function as a transcriptional regulator.
title: BRD4 Prevents R-Loop Formation and Transcription-Replication Conflicts by Ensuring Efficient Transcription Elongation

finding: Significant association with type 2 diabetes was observed for this SNP (beta=-0.139, p=5.07×10^-24), indicating its role in metabolic phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The KCNQ1 polymorphism rs2237895 was shown to be associated with gestational diabetes in Pakistani women, indicating its potential role in GDM susceptibility across diverse populations.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: Associated with Alzheimer's disease through LD with the GWAS peak SNP, showcasing functional relevance in neurodegenerative conditions.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2334499 located in chromosome region 11p15 was reported to have a protective effect when transmitted maternally, whereas it conferred a risk when paternally transmitted. This finding was specifically related to type II diabetes and illustrated the parent-of-origin effects in phenotypic variations.
title: A statistical method for joint estimation of cis-eQTLs and parent-of-orign effects using an orthogonal framework with RNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs536841 was identified as one of the eQTLs for TMEM135 with a significant p-value of 5.27e-14 from a published GWAS study, implicating it in potentially affecting cholesterol levels in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs541458 was identified as an eQTL for TMEM135 with a strong GWAS signal (p=5.67e-12) suggesting its involvement in Alzheimer's disease through mechanisms related to cholesterol regulation.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The APOC3 variant was found to be associated with lower triglyceride levels (TG), higher high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and it also showed significant associations with lower levels of three phosphatidylethanolamines and other triglyceride species.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: This variant was associated with increased estriol levels and is part of the SLC22A8/A24 locus, which is expressed in the kidney.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The SNP rs534191 was found to be the strongest SARS-CoV-2-specific reQTL located at the MMP1 locus, which is associated with COVID-19 severity.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: This SNP was located within MS4A2, a gene significant for understanding the genetic landscape of AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP demonstrated considerable chromatin contacts with DDB2 and ACP2, linking it to DNA repair mechanisms relevant to neurodegenerative diseases such as AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs10437653, located in chromosome 11, was shown to be associated with birth weight in Europeans.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs1237999 was located within an oligodendrocyte-specific regulatory element 35-kb upstream of the PICALM gene. It disrupted a putative FOS/AP1 factor binding site, resulted in allelic imbalance with the variant allele showing diminished accessibility in bulk ATAC-seq data from heterozygotes, and showed 3D interactions with both PICALM and EED, proposing a functional role in AD.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: SNP rs636317 disrupted a microglia-specific CTCF binding motif within the MS4A6A locus, highlighting its specificity and potential role in AD through influencing gene regulation.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3087967 was identified as being associated with malignant tumor of colon. It generated an ectopic consensus of USE in the 3' UTR of the POU2AF2/C11orf53 gene, leading to increased gene expression in vivo. This suggested that the rs3087967 variant contributed to colorectal cancer development through its effects on gene regulation.
title: Unravelling the regulatory function of a short 3’UTR sequence in zebrafish and in human cells

finding: The fine-mapped SNP rs931127 was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and was located in an ATAC-seq peak showing genomic activity linked to genes in the infected macrophage enhancer-gene regulatory network. The SNP was connected to the nearby target genes, implying its involvement in disease mechanisms.
title: GRaNIE and GRaNPA: Inference and evaluation of enhancer-mediated gene regulatory networks applied to study macrophages

finding: The SNP rs1234988 was identified as a dynamic eQTL for ARHGAP42, which is associated with hypertension as demonstrated by GWAS. The study found that this eQTL was exclusively significant in the cardiac fibroblast lineage with a Bonferroni-adjusted p-value of 2.4e-5, while it was not significant in the cardiomyocyte lineage (adj. p=0.79). This SNP's dynamic effects were obscured when not considering lineage subsetting, where it failed to show significance (adj. p=1). This highlighted the importance of lineage-specific analysis in identifying dynamic gene regulatory changes during cardiomyocyte differentiation.
title: Single-Cell Sequencing Reveals Lineage-Specific Dynamic Genetic Regulation of Gene Expression During Human Cardiomyocyte Differentiation

finding: The SNP rs174537 was identified as a significant factor influencing facial aging through its association with methylation differences that impact FADS activity. This particular SNP was anti-correlated with cg27386326, an age-protective causal CpG, suggesting that variations at this locus may contribute to skin barrier function and overall skin health. The findings indicated that alterations in the FADS1 and FADS2 genes, linked to fatty acid metabolism, have a direct connection to aging-related skin pathologies.
title: Epigenetics Insights from Perceived Facial Aging

finding: The SNP rs150090666, a stop-gain variant in PDE3B, demonstrated significant associations with obesity-related phenotypes, including hip circumference (beta = 0.248, p = 1.8 × 10^-11), right leg fat-free mass (beta = 0.129, p = 4.2 × 10^-8), and body weight (beta = 0.177, p = 4.6 × 10^-8). Heterozygous carriers exhibited a higher BMI of 0.647 kg/m² than the average UK Biobank participant (p = 2.09 × 10^-4).
title: Components of genetic associations across 2,138 phenotypes in the UK Biobank highlight novel adipocyte biology

finding: The variant rs2237897 was associated with the KCNQ1 locus and showed significant allele-specific expression (ASE) with a p-value of 2.9 x 10^-3. It has been linked to an increased risk for T2D and diabetic nephropathy across various populations, including admixed Americans and East Asians. Additionally, it was implicated in influencing glucose levels and body mass index.
title: iPSC-derived pancreatic progenitors are an optimal model system to study T2D regulatory variants active during fetal development of the pancreas

finding: The SNP rs17571 affected cathepsin D activity and was correlated with oxidative and inflammatory markers in COPD patients.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs174548, located on FADS1, was previously associated with asthma. Its effect on methylation at cg21709803 was found to be strongest in CD8+ T-cells, suggesting a link between rs174548, immune dysregulation, and fatty acid metabolism concerning asthma.
title: A hierarchical Bayesian interaction model to estimate cell-type-specific methylation quantitative trait loci incorporating priors from cell-sorted bisulfite sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs174587 was identified in relation to methylation at cg21709803 and asthma. Its significance was supported through colocalization analyses that replicated previous findings linking asthma with related SNPs.
title: A hierarchical Bayesian interaction model to estimate cell-type-specific methylation quantitative trait loci incorporating priors from cell-sorted bisulfite sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs779445843 was associated with a missense mutation (G95W) in IFITM3. This mutation significantly impaired the antiviral function of IFITM3 against both Influenza A virus (IAV) and HIV-1. The G95W variant exhibited a complete loss of restriction against IAV when expressed in HEK293T cells, indicating that glycine-95 was essential for the protein's ability to inhibit virus entry.
title: Homology-guided identification of a conserved motif linking the antiviral functions of IFITM3 to its oligomeric state

finding: The rs11568626 SNP resulted in the p.Arg50His mutation, which was associated with decreased transport affinities for phosphate analogues, including adefovir, cidofovir, and tenofovir, in the Xenopus oocyte-expressed p.Arg50His variant compared to the wild-type hOAT1 (rs15914676). This SNP was specific to the African population and was linked to a lower electrostatic potential affecting anionic substrate access.
title: Substrate binding and lipid-mediated allostery in the human organic anion transporter 1 at the atomic-scale

finding: The rs11568634 SNP led to the p.Arg454Gln mutation, which was associated with decreased uptake of substrates such as PAH, ochratoxin A, and methotrexate, indicating a loss of function. The mutation was observed to weaken the charge-relay system crucial for the MFS transport cycle.
title: Substrate binding and lipid-mediated allostery in the human organic anion transporter 1 at the atomic-scale

finding: Association with ECG morphology was also observed for rs2074238, with a significance of P=2×10^-129, found in the KCNQ1 gene.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The rs2168101 SNP (G>T) was associated with neuroblastoma risk and resulted in a significant impact on LMO1 expression. Specifically, the G risk allele retained a GATA3 binding site, which drove expression of LMO1, while the T protective allele ablated GATA3 binding and was linked to low or no LMO1 expression. After ATRA treatment, a 70% loss of the LMO1 super-enhancer (SE) was observed, accompanied by a 1.46-fold decrease in LMO1 mRNA, highlighting the role of this SNP in neuroblastoma pathogenesis.
title: Lineage specific transcription factor waves reprogram neuroblastoma from self-renewal to differentiation

finding: The analysis revealed that rs7949874 was significantly associated with the PHF-tau measurement phenotype, with a p-value of 3E-8, highlighting its involvement in cognitive function.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus

finding: Located near the INS gene on chromosome 11p15.5, the minor A allele at rs4929965 was associated with susceptibility to type 2 diabetes (OR=1.07, p=4.80×10^-25) and protection from type 1 diabetes (OR=0.87, p=1.89×10^-5). The posterior probability of colocalisation was 0.95, indicating a significant differential effect on the two diseases.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The Val66Met variant (rs6265) within the BDNF prodomain was identified as a widely studied SNP in neuroscience, showing disease relevance to numerous neuropsychiatric disorders. The context of this finding indicated that the prodomain of BDNF, where this SNP is located, is more prone to evolutionary change, reflecting its role in disease susceptibility due to genetic sensitivity.
title: The evolution of BDNF is defined by strict purifying selection and prodomain spatial coevolution, but what does it mean for human brain disease?

finding: The variant rs34704828 was identified as a known pathological variant associated with beta-thalassemia. It was reported to create an uAUG, which significantly influenced the model's predictions regarding translation initiation in the context of the 5' untranslated region (5'UTR) of the gene HBB. The model highlighted the importance of the newly created AUG codon and its surrounding sequence context, indicating that this variant had substantial implications for mRNA translation and protein abundance.
title: Predicting Mean Ribosome Load for 5’UTR of any length using Deep Learning

finding: SNP rs12790261 was linked to BCL6, exhibiting a significant association with prostate cancer (p-value 1e-7), indicating its potential impact on protein interactions related to the disease.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs12628 in the HRAS gene was associated with an increased risk of melanoma in the North American population, as reported by Tomei et al. (2012). This finding suggested a potential genetic predisposition to melanoma related to mutations in the HRAS gene.
title: Network Pharmacology Analysis of the active components and anticancer targets of Rhubarb

finding: Similar to rs1800469, this SNP was confirmed to have been positively associated with colorectal cancer risk in at least one prior study.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The intronic variant rs117576073 of CYP2R1 was part of the putative core instruments for vitamin D levels. MR Corge estimates suggested that there was no causal association between vitamin D levels and CAD.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The intergenic variant rs12803256 near DHCR7 was part of the core instruments for vitamin D levels. MR Corge findings also indicated no causal association with CAD.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The SNP rs948854 was associated with depressive symptoms in adolescents, indicating its relevance to the genetic underpinnings of mood disorders. This finding highlighted the role of the galanin gene and its polymorphisms in influencing emotional health and coping strategies, relating back to the disruption of galanin signaling observed in neuropsychiatric diseases.
title: Elimination of galanin synthesis in noradrenergic neurons reduces galanin in select brain areas and promotes active coping behaviors

finding: Located within the BAD promoter, this variant regulated BAD, GPR137, and PYGM expression, implicating it in T cell development and apoptosis.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant regulated expression of SESN3, a gene involved in negative regulation of reactive oxygen species signaling, indicating a potential role in T cell function.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant was associated with ETS1 expression, a transcription factor crucial for T cell survival and activation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs12252 was identified as being associated with disease severity in Coronavirus Disease 2019. The study highlighted that the genetic variant influenced the immune response, particularly in the context of interferon signaling, which is relevant considering the findings about the role of Type I interferon (IFN-I) in regulating microglial engulfment of neurons and brain development.
title: Type I interferon responsive microglia shape cortical development and behavior

finding: The finding indicated that the rs11568818 polymorphism was associated with MMP-7 expression at an extra-articular site, particularly relevant in the context of rheumatoid inflammation.
title: C-terminal truncation of CXCL10 attenuates inflammatory activity but retains angiostatic properties

finding: The SNP rs2075291, located in the apolipoprotein A5 gene, was found to be associated with altered triglyceride levels specifically in coronary artery disease (CAD) patients who were undergoing treatment with lipid-lowering drugs. This association indicated a potential genetic influence on lipid metabolism, which held implications for cardiovascular health in the general population, including the Bruneian Malays.
title: Genomic Insights of Bruneian Malays

finding: SNP rs964184 indicated significant marginal epistasis (ME) across multiple traits: Apolipoprotein B, cholesterol, and triglycerides. This SNP is located in the 3' UTR of the ZPR1 gene, which encodes for a regulatory zinc finger protein involved in cell proliferation and metabolism. Variants in ZPR1, including rs964184, had established associations with serum lipid levels and coronary artery disease. Moreover, it demonstrated regulatory roles by affecting gene expression as a cis-eQTL and trans-eQTL, with mediation analyses suggesting it significantly impacted HDL-C and triglyceride levels.
title: A biobank-scale test of marginal epistasis reveals genome-wide signals of polygenic epistasis

finding: The SNP rs11235604, representing a missense variant p.R220W in the autophagy-related gene ATG16L2, was associated with coronary artery disease. This finding was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with three novel signals which were identified in the study, highlighting the increased risk factors in the East Asian population.
title: Large scale genome-wide association study in a Japanese population identified 45 novel susceptibility loci for 22 diseases

finding: SNP rs11349741, located in the FSHB/ARL14EP locus, was similarly significant in the genetic association analysis and indicated a correlation with PCOS mechanisms.
title: Gene regulatory activity associated with PCOS revealed DENND1A-dependent testosterone production

finding: The SNP rs2237895, associated with KCNQ1, was linked to reduced insulin release following an oral glucose load in subjects with type 2 diabetes. This original finding suggested that the minor allele of this SNP may be significant in understanding metabolic dysfunction in diabetic conditions.
title: An Activator Locks Kv7.1 Channels Open by Electro-Mechanical Uncoupling and Allosterically Modulates its Pore
