title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The association of rs1783835 with drinking patterns was noted, providing insights into its potential role in alcohol-related traits.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The polymorphism rs35705950-T in the MUC5B gene was associated with increased gene expression and revealed a protective effect against severe disease and hospitalization in COVID-19 patients, as supported by multiple meta-analyses conducted by Fadista et al. (2021), van Moorsel et al. (2021), and Verma et al. (2021). This suggests that a higher expression of MUC5B may contribute to improved resistance to severe outcomes related to SARS-CoV-2 infections.
title: LY6E protects mice from pathogenic effects of murine coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs11040513 was linked to divergent dynamics and functions of ERK MAP Kinase signaling, with implications for development, homeostasis, and cancer. This relationship was detailed in the study by Muta et al. in 2019. The findings underscored the role of this SNP in modulating signaling pathways critical for disease progression.
title: Reusability and composability in process description maps: RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK signalling

finding: This SNP in the GSPT1 gene was linked to a lower risk of COVID-19 development, highlighting its relevance in the context of SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis, demonstrating a perfect correlation (r2 = 1.0), indicating its potential importance in structural variations.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The missense variant rs6265 identified in the BDNF gene was found to have a frequency of around 19% in modern Europeans. It was associated with the regulation of body weight and mechanistic roles in Type 2 diabetes.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: At the FADS1/FADS2 loci, rs174550 was significant and linked to decreased triglyceride levels, suggesting selection reflecting dietary transitions toward a starch-heavy diet, particularly noted after the Neolithic transition.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The variant rs528823 was linked to Alzheimer's disease through splicing rather than gene expression by affecting the inclusion of an exon in the MS4A3 gene. It was found to disrupt a YBX3 binding motif, supported by molecular experiments.
title: A Deep Dive into Statistical Modeling of RNA Splicing QTLs Reveals New Variants that Explain Neurodegenerative Disease

finding: The SNP rs145802670 was identified as being pleiotropic with T2D, and was associated with PGAP2, implicating its role in type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: For variant rs2785197, located in 11p13, it was associated with osteoporosis (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 6.5E-44) and suggested to regulate the expression of <italic>CD44</italic> (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 1.1E-32), establishing it as a likely causative factor in OP pathways.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The rs1815739 polymorphism of the ACTN3 gene was associated with good performance in strength activities, particularly noted in artistic gymnastics and swimming. In the study, a predominance of the RX genotype was observed among both gymnasts and swimmers, indicating that athletes engaging in power-related sports tended to have a higher frequency of the R allele.
title: Genotypic and allelic distribution of the ACE, ACTN3, and IL6 genes in athletes of Artistic Gymnastics and Swimming in the department of Norte de Santander, Colombia

finding: The SNP rs11040527 was linked to the regulation of breast cancer through its association with the PSMD3 gene, which plays a role in stabilizing the HER2 protein. This SNP was shown to have relevance in obesity-related cancer pathogenesis, thereby confirming its significance in the phenotypic manifestations of obesity.
title: Novel multiparametric bulk and single EV pipeline for adipose cell-specific biomarker discovery in paired human biospecimens

finding: The variant rs490972 was identified as a lead variant for serum triglyceride levels and showed significant allelic bias across multiple conditions in the MPRA study. The reference allele (G) demonstrated higher regulatory activity compared to the alternate allele (A), matching consensus motifs for the SP transcription factor family, particularly SP1, implying a critical role in transcriptional regulation linked to T2D and metabolic traits.
title: Functional dissection of metabolic trait-associated gene regulation in steady state and stimulated human skeletal muscle cells

finding: The SNP rs12252-C was identified as a splicing variant within the IFITM3 gene that negatively impacted its splicing efficiency. It was reported that 20% of Chinese individuals were homozygous for this SNP. This genetic variant was associated with heightened severity of influenza virus infections, indicating a significant role in host vulnerability to zoonotic infections.
title: Innate immune control of influenza virus interspecies adaptation

finding: The SNP rs34481144-A was described as a promoter variant impacting the efficacy of the IFITM3 gene promoter. Approximately 4% of Europeans were found to be homozygous for this SNP. Similar to rs12252, this variant was associated with increased severity of influenza, illustrating its critical role in the adaptation and response to viral infections.
title: Innate immune control of influenza virus interspecies adaptation

finding: The lead SNP rs28633403 was found to explain all of the signal at its loci when conditioned on AP006621.5, with a GWAS P value of 4.5E-07, indicating that AP006621.5 was a positive original finding in relation to ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11030406 was associated with the regulation of FGFR1 expression through the ZEB1/YAP1 transcription complex in glioblastoma stem cells. This connection led to enhanced proliferation and stemness characteristics of tumor cells, indicating its relevance in glioblastoma tumor biology.
title: Spatial distribution and functional relevance of FGFR1 and FGFR2 expression for glioblastoma tumor invasion

finding: The variant rs10219187, mapped to <italic>KCNJ5</italic>, was also detected under strong selection, supporting its role in common refractive error genetics and suggesting evolutionary adaptations possibly linked to environmental factors influencing myopia.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The SNP rs968567 was found to be highly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). It was located in the promoter region of the FADS2 gene and was demonstrated to alter the DNA methylation level of cg06781209, which is a binding site for the transcription factor SREBF2. This alteration disrupted SREBF2 binding, leading to downregulation of FADS2 expression and consequently reducing the risk of RA. Methven’s predictions indicated that the SNP showed diminished influence on CpG methylation levels in RA cases compared to controls, suggesting that its ability to modulate methylation at the cg06781209 site was less effective in RA conditions.
title: Predicting the effect of non-coding mutations on single-cell DNA methylation using deep learning

finding: Associated with the OSBPL5 locus, this variant was linked to the activation of the OSBPL5 promoter and adjacent enhancers in CLL, highlighting its potential role in altering disease progression in B cell malignancies.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The allele-specific methylation was examined, revealing a clear separation based on the T/G SNP at this locus. In the analysis, fragments carrying the T allele were found to be unmethylated, while those carrying the G allele were methylated. This finding was supported by a significant adjusted p-value of ≤7.1E-19, indicating a strong association between the genotype and the methylation status in a sample of adipocytes.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: Analysis of this SNP revealed it to be consistent with parental imprinting. The findings indicated that across various samples, bimodal methylation patterns were present, suggesting parent-of-origin effects influencing allele-specific methylation.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: The variant chr11:17574758G>A (rs552304627; p.V141M), located in the OTOG gene, was found in two unrelated families (F1 & F14) with Meniere's disease. This variant was characterized as likely pathogenic, had a minor allele frequency of .0008 in the NFE population, and demonstrated a significant enrichment in familial MD cases.
title: Rare Variants in the OTOG Gene Are a Frequent Cause of Familial Meniere’s Disease

finding: The variant rs61978648 was identified in individuals from 4 unrelated families (F2, F3, F4 & F5), contributing to the evidence of multiple shared variants in the OTOG gene among the familial Meniere’s disease cases.
title: Rare Variants in the OTOG Gene Are a Frequent Cause of Familial Meniere’s Disease

finding: Similar to rs61978648, the variant rs61736002 was also shared by individuals from 4 unrelated families (F2, F3, F4 & F5), reinforcing the significance of the OTOG gene in familial Meniere’s disease.
title: Rare Variants in the OTOG Gene Are a Frequent Cause of Familial Meniere’s Disease

finding: The variant rs117315845 was found in patients from two unrelated families (F1 & F14), indicating its possible relevance in familial Meniere’s disease cases.
title: Rare Variants in the OTOG Gene Are a Frequent Cause of Familial Meniere’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2128739 was associated with the proximal pulmonary artery diameter through the PDGFD gene, which has been implicated in pulmonary hypertension, indicating its relevance in cardiovascular health.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs3903072 was identified as a cancer-associated genetic variant that modulated immune cells in the tumor microenvironment (TME). This finding established a connection between the genetic variation at this locus and the behavior of immune cells within tumors, highlighting its potential relevance in studies of tumor immunity and cancer immunotherapy.
title: MetaTiME: Meta-components of the Tumor Immune Microenvironment

finding: The lead variant rs762019591, tagged a nonsense SNP in MRE11 (rs587781384), and was associated with increased vulnerability to clonal hematopoiesis (CH) through its consistent impact on CNN-LOH mutations affecting inherited alleles.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: The nonsense SNP rs587781384 in MRE11 was highlighted as a significant variant driving vulnerability to CH, influenced by CNN-LOH events that replicated the effect of other variants at seven loci associated with blood clones.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: The missense variant rs587779872 in ATM exhibited significant association with CNN-LOH events in a subset of individuals, indicating its role in independent vulnerability to clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: The stop gain variant rs786204751 in ATM was found to nullify the effect of another ATM missense variant (rs587779872), reinforcing its contribution to clonal hematopoiesis by affecting CNN-LOH associations.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: The rs629367 polymorphism was identified as a new biomarker associated with increased risk and poor survival of gastric cancer in the Chinese population, linked to the upregulation of miRNA-let-7a expression.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: This SNP in CYP2R1 was marginally associated with AAO (p=0.04), suggesting a potential but limited influence.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: Associated with a 2.9-year earlier AAO of MS with a p-value indicating significance (p<0.05).
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: This SNP was associated with gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD) and was located in the region of the DRD2 gene, a target for psychiatric disorders, indicating its relevance to gastrointestinal motility and nausea symptoms.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: This SNP was associated with PUD and is located upstream of the CCKBR gene, known to be a target for peptic ulcer treatment, linking it directly to gastrointestinal regulation mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The rs35248926 variant was located in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead i-rQTL of SIDT2-212, influencing multiple nearby genes and potentially altering regulatory effects across B-cells and monocytes.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: This SNP served as the lead i-rQTL variant affecting SIDT2-212 and was associated with an INDEL variant (rs35248926) which had eQTL effects on neighboring genes in the GTEx dataset.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: The variant located in ANO1 was replicated across multiple datasets, showing its significant association with intrinsic brain functional connectivity traits.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs508487 was associated with increased plasma concentrations of HDL-cholesterol, which relates to cardiovascular disease risk, particularly in the context of acute coronary syndrome.
title: Identification of genetic drivers of plasma lipoproteins in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs236911 demonstrated a significant association with triglyceride levels, highlighting its role in lipid metabolism and its potential implications for cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of genetic drivers of plasma lipoproteins in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs236918 showed an association with HDL-cholesterol concentrations, reaffirming its relevance in the pathways leading to acute coronary syndrome and lipid regulation.
title: Identification of genetic drivers of plasma lipoproteins in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The C/C genotype at rs11032578 was positively associated with increased utilization of an intronic polyadenylation site in the ABTB2 gene, indicating how genetic variation in this SNP can influence alternative polyadenylation (APA) and, consequently, gene regulation.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: The SNP rs35225972 was associated with asthma/allergy phenotypes in European cohorts and displayed moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with H1 variants of MUC5AC.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The SNP rs11245962 was implicated in asthma/allergy phenotypes and found to be in moderate LD with MUC5AC haplogroup H1.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The SNP rs28415845 was identified as a risk allele for asthma/allergy and was also moderately associated with H1 variants of MUC5AC.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The protective allele for SNP rs11245979 was associated with infection-induced pneumonia/meningitis and showed higher LD with H1 variants of MUC5AC.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The SNP rs28737416 was associated with severe tuberculosis-induced meningitis in a Vietnamese cohort, demonstrating moderately high LD with haplogroup H2.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The SNP rs28729516 represented a protective allele linked to infection-induced pneumonia/meningitis, showing higher LD with the MUC5AC H1 haplogroup.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: SNP rs35705950 was significantly associated with various respiratory phenotypes, including interstitial lung diseases, verified through PheWAS analysis with substantial significance after Bonferroni correction.
title: Structural and genetic diversity in the secreted mucins, MUC5AC and MUC5B

finding: The APOC3 rs4520 polymorphism showed that C/C homozygotes experienced lesser decreases in triglyceride concentrations after olanzapine treatment than T allele carriers, indicating its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: The BDNF rs6265 C/C genotype was associated with higher increases in insulin levels after aripiprazole treatment than other genotypes, suggesting it may influence insulin metabolism.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: The SNP rs3903072 was identified as an eQTL for CTSW in breast cancer. This SNP also presented a pan-cancer association with a beta of 0.21 (p=2.8e-36), suggesting its role in cancer risk related to immune processing.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The finding noted significant allele-dependent EBNA2 binding at the CD44 locus, validated in Ramos cells. This binding was previously observed in Mutu cells, highlighting a crucial interaction between EBNA2 and autoimmune risk variants.
title: Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 (EBNA2) extensively rewires the human chromatin landscape at autoimmune risk loci

finding: The SNP rs28456 was identified as a strong eQTL with a causal effect on the FADS1 gene in multiple brain regions from independent datasets using the SMR method. This association was linked to bipolar disorder, with overexpression of FADS1 estimated to have a protective effect against the disorder, indicated by a causal effect beta of -0.14±0.018.
title: Systematic comparative analysis of Mendelian randomization methods for inferring causal genes of complex phenotypes and the application to psychiatric diseases

finding: Linked to the expression of MTCH2 in excitatory neurons, indicating its relevance in specific cell type regulation.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: This SNP was tied to the expression of MS4A6A, showing consistent allelic effects across different cell types.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Identified due to its association with the expression of MS4A6A and its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's-related responses.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: There was a positive original finding associated with rs1042602 in the <italic>TYR</italic> gene, which was documented to be linked with increased expression in non-African and particularly European populations. This SNP was suggested to be an activity-reducing coding variant, occurring alongside selection that favored pigmentation changes. The analysis indicated that while this variant lead to decreased enzymatic activity, the overall increased expression of <italic>TYR</italic> was likely driven by gene regulatory variants to maintain the gene's function despite the increase in frequency of rs1042602.
title: Tracing the evolution of human gene regulation and its association with shifts in environment

finding: The PAS SNP rs1866562, found in the 3' UTR of RNF169, was categorized as a pA-QTL with the reference allele disrupting the PAS sequence. This SNP was also linked to decreased cleavage at its polyadenylation site, leading to increased 3' UTR length and lower gene expression levels.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: The rs1042838 SNP, located in the PGR locus, was associated with preterm birth and derived from Neanderthals in some European populations at frequencies as high as 18%. Further analysis established that a Neanderthal haplotype linked with this variant reduced miscarriages and decreased bleeding during pregnancy, suggesting increased fertility within a modern human genetic context.
title: Archaic Adaptive Introgression in Modern Human Reproductive Genes

finding: This SNP was identified as a GWS lead variant in the Japanese meta-analysis, specifically found to be part of a found novel locus on chromosome 11q22. It indicated a strong association with CAD.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: Identified as a lead variant within the novel locus on chromosome 11q22. This SNP was associated with CAD through its effects on the expression of RDX in monocytes.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs174556, located in the FADS2 locus on chromosome 11, demonstrated significant associations with CSF levels of four different phosphatidylcholines (range P=8.52e-15 - 2.11e-19). This finding was noted for both previously identified and novel pleiotropic effects.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11020135 was found to influence the activity of the hERG1 potassium channel, which was associated with the regulation of F-actin organization during cell migration in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells. This connection highlighted the importance of ion channel dynamics in tumor cell behavior.
title: An integrin centered complex coordinates ion transport and pH to regulate f-actin organization and cell migration in breast cancer

finding: The variant rs59921976 was confirmed by independent MPRA assays to cause significant expression changes, while the original reported lead SNP rs1784782 did not result in significant expression modulation.
title: Computational Assessment of the Regulation-Modulating Potential for Noncoding Variants

finding: The rs10792832 SNP was identified as the lead Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk variant at the PICALM locus, which contains microglia-specific enhancers harboring AD-risk variants. This variant was linked to gene expression in multiple cell types despite its primary association with regulatory regions in neurons.
title: Cell type-specific enhancer-promoter connectivity maps in the human brain and disease risk association

finding: This SNP was noted for its genome-wide significant association with imaging phenotypes in the multi-trait analysis, reinforcing its importance in the identified loci.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: Found in an intron of CD82, this SNP is involved in oligodendrocyte migration which is relevant for myelination.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The missense variant rs142863092 in NECTIN1 was found to have a significant individual effect on chin morphology. It was predicted bioinformatically to be deleterious to the nectin-1 protein and was associated with morphology alterations in craniofacial development as seen in zebrafish mutations.
title: Impact of low-frequency coding variants on human facial shape

finding: SNP rs137991779 in NECTIN1 exhibited a CADD score of 29.2, placing it among the top 0.12% of variants in terms of deleteriousness. This finding suggested its potential involvement in a variety of human traits and disorders, linking it to broader biological processes.
title: Impact of low-frequency coding variants on human facial shape

finding: The rs650585 variant, located in the intronic region of the RNF214 gene on chromosome 11, was significantly associated with lower plasma Aβ1-40 levels (effect size=-0.073 SD; p=2.56×10^-8). This variant is in linkage disequilibrium with a synonymous variant of BACE1 (rs638405), which also showed a negative association with plasma Aβ1-40 levels (effect size=-0.071 SD; p=1.21×10^-7). Additionally, rs650585 was associated with increased Aβ deposition in the brain among APOE ε4 positive individuals (p=0.02).
title: Plasma amyloid β levels are driven by genetic variants near APOE, BACE1, APP, PSEN2: A genome-wide association study in over 12,000 non-demented participants

finding: The rs638405 variant, which is a synonymous variant of the BACE1 gene, was shown to be negatively associated with plasma Aβ1-40 levels (effect size=-0.071 SD; p=1.21×10^-7). It was also in linkage disequilibrium with the intronic variant rs650585, which was similarly associated with plasma Aβ1-40 levels.
title: Plasma amyloid β levels are driven by genetic variants near APOE, BACE1, APP, PSEN2: A genome-wide association study in over 12,000 non-demented participants

finding: The SNP rs4988135, located in the LCT region, was associated with both strong and young selection. It exhibited maximum combined selection score (CSS) values, indicating it was targeted by significant selective pressures due to its phenotypic effects.
title: A genome-wide Approximate Bayesian Computation approach suggests only limited numbers of soft sweeps in humans over the last 100,000 years

finding: The SNP rs584961 was identified as a synonymous coding variant in exon 2 of the gene SERPINH1, which was determined to be the causal gene at this GWAS locus related to coronary artery disease (CAD). The G risk allele of rs584961 correlated with decreased expression of SERPINH1 and was associated with increased risk of CAD. This finding was consistent with observations that fibroblast Serpinh1 expression decreases during atherogenesis, indicating that decreased SERPINH1 expression could contribute to atherosclerosis progression.
title: Single-Cell RNA-Seq Reveals Adventitial Fibroblast Alterations during Mouse Atherosclerosis

finding: Identified as a known intellectual disability variant corresponding to the <italic>DEAF1</italic> gene, this SNP reflects genetic variation associated with intellectual disability outcomes.
title: Evolutionary constraint genes implicated in autism spectrum disorder across 2,054 nonhuman primate genomes

finding: This SNP was located in the promoter region of the ARAP1 gene and was also identified as an eQTL for the STARD10 gene. It was linked to significant transcriptional regulatory activity, with its PPA calculated to be high at 0.772 when considering TC information. The SNP is potentially causal for T2D and fasting glucose traits.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: This SNP was in strong LD with rs11603334 and was found in the promoter region of ARAP1. Its high regulatory activity was evidenced by a Z score of 4.90 in the STARR-seq assay, indicating its relevance to T2D and potential causality in glucose regulation.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: The SNP rs11040523 was associated with the Upstream Stimulatory Factor 2 (USF2), particularly in the context of its role in T cell signaling and HIV-1 expression. The original finding indicated that variations in this SNP impacted the phosphorylation of USF2, which contributed to T cell activation responses and possibly influenced carcinogenic processes. This finding highlighted the significance of USF2 in the regulation of HIV-1 expression and T cell function.
title: Upstream Stimulatory Factors regulate HIV-1 latency and are required for robust T cell activation

finding: The study indicated that the Val66Met polymorphism (rs6265) was associated with long-term cancer-related cognitive impairment (CRCI) in survivors of breast cancer. This SNP was relevant in understanding the role of BDNF levels in cognitive functions, particularly in the context of cancer treatments affecting neurogenesis and cognitive performance.
title: Cisplatin Induces BDNF Downregulation in Middle-Aged Female Rat Model while BDNF Enhancement Attenuates Cisplatin Neurotoxicity

finding: The Val66Met SNP (rs6265), a non-synonymous SNP in the brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) gene, was noted to significantly affect memory recognition processes. Specifically, Val/Val individuals demonstrated better performance in item-recognition tasks compared to Met allele carriers, suggesting that the SNP may influence the familiarity aspect of memory but not recollection. Furthermore, electrophysiological measurements showed that Val/Val individuals exhibited larger amplitudes of the late positive complex (LPC) associated with recollection, while no difference was observed in the N400 component related to familiarity. This indicates the SNP's role in memory performance, with carriers showing reduced recognition accuracy in line with prior findings.
title: Investigating the Influence of the Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor Val66Met Single Nucleotide Polymorphism on Familiarity and Recollection Event-Related Potentials

finding: The DRD2/ANKK1 TaqIA A1 allele (rs1800497) was implicated in the native Mexican populations, with frequencies of 67% in Nahua and 65% in HUI. This allele is associated with diminished DRD2 expression and suggests a lineage of adaptation to alcohol dependence. However, it was noted that this variant was not linked to excessive alcohol consumption or metabolic disturbances in these specific indigenous groups, contrasting with its association with heavy drinking in the admixed populations.
title: Dietary, Cultural and Pathogens-related Selective Pressures Shaped Differential Adaptive Evolution Among Native Mexican Populations

finding: The C allele of the DRD2 C957T SNP (rs6277) was found to be associated with increased sugar consumption and higher serum triglyceride levels. This finding indicates that while native populations have certain genetic adaptations, those from admixed populations exhibit different dietary patterns and risks linked to the same genetic variant.
title: Dietary, Cultural and Pathogens-related Selective Pressures Shaped Differential Adaptive Evolution Among Native Mexican Populations

finding: The rs174547 SNP at the FADS1 locus was associated with DGLA desaturation rates, where the CC genotype was linked to lowered DGLA desaturation. This genotype corresponded to reduced adipose tissue markers of senescence, particularly lower levels of P21WAF1 RNA in adipose samples from both men and women. Additionally, the CC genotype was correlated with lower incidence rates of stroke, cardiovascular disease, metabolic syndrome, and age-related macular degeneration, conditions tied to senescent cell accumulation.
title: Fatty acid desaturation guides cellular decisions between ferroptosis and cellular senescence

finding: The finding for SNP rs11222616 involved the validation of earth observation time-series data, facilitating a robust framework for assessing large-area land surface products. This SNP was fundamental for tracking ecosystem dynamics and changes over time.
title: Scientific opportunities for developing essential biodiversity variables from satellite remote sensing in the context of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework

finding: The GSTP1 rs1695 G allele was associated with decreased detoxification capacity, implying an increased efficacy of platinum compounds in CRC treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs7924896, mapped to METTL15, was associated with snoring in a study of up to 337,074 individuals, reaching a p-value of 1e-5. This association was considered significant after correcting for multiple testing.
title: Multi-ancestry analysis of gene-sleep interactions in 126,926 individuals identifies multiple novel blood lipid loci that contribute to our understanding of sleep-associated adverse blood lipid profile

finding: The rs12252-C allele of the IFITM3 gene restricted Chikungunya virus (CHIKV), Mayaro virus (MAYV), and influenza A virus (IAV) infection as efficiently as the wild-type IFITM3. It was indicated to have both antiviral activity against CHIKV and IAV and was associated with severe influenza infection in humans. Notably, no truncated IFITM3 protein associated with the rs12252-C allele was detected, contradicting earlier hypotheses regarding its functional impact.
title: Human IFITM3 restricts Chikungunya virus and Mayaro virus infection and is susceptible to virus-mediated counteraction

finding: Found at 11q13.3, this SNP was associated with both prostate cancer and lymphocytic leukemia.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The rs1800497 SNP, located in the DRD2 gene, was the focus of a study that suggested a significant role in the development of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). This finding was categorized as both positive and original because it highlighted the association of a specific genetic polymorphism with a psychological phenotype, providing insights into individual differences in PTSD susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide characterization of human minisatellite VNTRs: population-specific alleles and gene expression differences

finding: The study indicated that the interferon-induced transmembrane protein 3 genetic variant rs12252-C was associated with disease severity in COVID-19. This finding is particularly relevant as it connects genetic variation to the host immune response against SARS-CoV-2, aligning with observations made in the host response regarding the upregulation of genes such as IFITM3 in COVID-19 subjects.
title: Transcriptomic dysregulations associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection in human nasopharyngeal and peripheral blood mononuclear cells

finding: The rs74911261 variant resulted in a missense change from proline to leucine at position 144 of the Protein O-Xylosyltransferase (POGLUT3), involved in protein O-linked glycosylation. This variant was predicted to destabilize the protein and was statistically associated with lower protein levels in plasma. Furthermore, it was linked to an increased risk of breast, renal, and prostate cancer, indicating that POGLUT3 protein stability may serve as a risk factor for cancer.
title: Predicted mechanistic impacts of human protein missense variants

finding: Robust signals of selection were found for the light allele of rs1126809 near TYR, contributing to the understanding of pigmentation variations in ancient populations.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs7109255 near GRM5 showed a robust signal of selection, contributing to the genetic basis of pigmentation traits.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs3758833 near CTSC also demonstrated frequency changes consistent with alterations in genomic ancestry.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs6484833, which involved a C to T change at chr11:36273982, created a novel poly(A) site in the gene COMMD9. This resulted in the second-longest 3' UTR, which contained 3 miRNA binding sites and 19 RNA binding protein (RBP) binding sites. RNA-Bloom was able to reconstruct the transcript successfully, and Termin(A)n tor predicted this poly(A) site with a probability of 0.99. This site was also confirmed by PolyA-Seq data.
title: Termin(A)ntor: Polyadenylation Site Prediction Using Deep Learning Models

finding: rs867611 was connected to the PICALM gene with evidence from histone modifications and promoter regions, stressing its relevance in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs527162 was associated with the PICALM gene, particularly in histone modification studies, suggesting its role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs639012 was linked to multiple histone modifications related to the PICALM gene, reinforcing its significance in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs17817600 showed association with the PICALM gene through various histone modifications involved in Alzheimer's disease pathobiology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs10792832 was noted at the promoter flanking region of the PICALM gene, reflecting its role in regulating Alzheimer's disease-related pathways.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs302652, located near the gene RAB38 on chromosome 11, was identified as a local expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) that decreased RAB38 gene expression in monocytes. This finding suggested that rs302652 potentially influenced the risk of behavioral variant frontotemporal dementia (bvFTD) by modulating RAB38 expression levels in specific brain areas. The significance of this impact was underlined by the fact that gene expression of RAB38 was significantly associated with bvFTD risk across multiple tissue panels.
title: Gene expression imputation provides insight into the genetic architecture of frontotemporal dementia

finding: The SNP rs302668 was associated with a decreased risk of frontotemporal dementia in previous genome-wide association studies (GWAS), showing an odds ratio of 0.81 with a p-value of 2.44×10⁻⁷. This finding supported the role of rs302668 in influencing bvFTD risk, further corroborated by its significant association with RAB38 gene expression levels across multiple tissue types, particularly in the context of the behavioral variant.
title: Gene expression imputation provides insight into the genetic architecture of frontotemporal dementia

finding: The SNP rs1996 was associated with developmental processes in crustaceans, particularly in relation to the formation of the larval lateral protocerebrum. The studies indicated that there were no early indications of morphogenetic reorganization at this stage, suggesting a developmental stability which could impact subsequent larval metamorphosis. This connection to precursors for the formation and differentiation of neural centers hints at the importance of rs1996 in taxon-specific morphogenic rearrangements during the transition from larval to preadult forms.
title: Evolution of mushroom body inversion and associated gyriform neuropils parallel the evolved transposition of the mammalian hippocampus

finding: The finding related to the rs11555217 SNP, located in the DHCR7 gene, was connected with Smith-Lemli-Opitz syndrome (SLOS), an autosomal recessive disorder. The allele frequency observed in the Polish population was significantly higher at 1.17% compared to the global MAF of 0.07% reported in gnomAD v3.1.1. This specific mutation was the most frequent in Polish SLOS patients, indicating a potential founder effect.
title: ‘The Thousand Polish Genomes Project’ - a national database of Polish variant allele frequencies

finding: The NXPE4 variant caused a substitution from tyrosine (Y) to histidine (H), affecting the protein's structure and potentially its function.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The rs1815739 variant, also known as the ACTN3 R577X variant, was found to be significantly associated with the expression of the ACTN3 gene in skeletal muscle (P = 7.1 × 10−141). This association was demonstrated through a trans-eQTL scan using the GTEx skeletal muscle dataset. Furthermore, it was revealed that muscle AR (androgen receptor) expression was significantly reduced in individuals with the 577XX genotype compared to RR counterparts, with reductions of 65% (P = 0.0043) in males and 72% (P = 0.0112) in females, indicating a direct link between the ACTN3 genotype and AR levels.
title: ACTN3 genotype influences androgen response in skeletal muscle

finding: The researchers found that the CC genotype and C allele frequencies of rs10893872, an SNP in the Ets-1 oncogene and transcription factor, were significantly increased in patients with uveitis compared to controls, suggesting an association with uveitis predisposition.
title: Exploring MicroRNA Signatures in Pediatric Non-infectious Uveitis: Meta-Analysis and Molecular Profiling of Patient Samples

finding: The SNP rs149483638 at the IGF2 locus was associated with protection against type 2 diabetes. It exhibited an overall frequency of 23%, with population-specific allele frequencies of 0.06% in African populations, 0.05% in European populations, and 35% in Native Mexican populations.
title: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from the Mexico City Prospective Study

finding: The SNP rs11040564 was associated with variations in the immune response, revealed through the study of neutrophil populations in breast cancer (BC) patients. The research demonstrated that LDN, which were significantly increased in BC patients, especially those with metastatic disease, had pro-tumor characteristics correlating with the presence of this SNP. The study posited that the presence of rs11040564 could influence the prevalence of immunosuppressive LDN in the context of BC, linking it to poor chemotherapy response and worse prognosis.
title: Circulating Low Density Neutrophils of Breast Cancer Patients are Associated with their Worse Prognosis due to the Impairment of T cell Responses

finding: The SNP rs11020216 was associated with the long noncoding RNA MALAT1. Its overexpression was linked to the advancement of lung adenocarcinoma and metastatic dissemination in the context of K-ras/p53 mouse models. Specifically, the study indicated that increased expression of MALAT1 led to paracrine secretion of the inflammatory cytokine Ccl2, contributing to an inflammatory tumor microenvironment that was conducive to metastasis.
title: Overexpressed Malat1 Drives Metastasis through Inflammatory Reprogramming of Lung Adenocarcinoma Microenvironment

finding: SNP rs7127212 was reported to be associated with the risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) in a previous study. The SNP is located 51.6kb from the transcription start site (TSS) of the gene SLC37A4, which encodes a translocase involved in glucose metabolism. This finding highlighted a potential link between SLC37A4 and T2D.
title: Single-cell allele-specific expression analysis reveals dynamic and cell-type-specific regulatory effects

finding: Found within B cell-specific chromatin, this SNP was related to primary biliary cirrhosis, contributing to the context of immune regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Similar to rs4938541, this SNP was identified within the regulatory landscape of immune response, impacting primary biliary cirrhosis.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: MTNR1B rs10830963 was associated with an increased fasting blood glucose level. For each G allele, there was an average increase of around 1.3 mg/dl in fasting glucose. In the deCODE cohort, the likelihood of a null effect was 94.4% in CG individuals and 91.6% in GG individuals, indicating that only about 5.6% of individuals with one G copy and 8.2% of homozygotes would experience an increase in fasting glucose. Linear regression showed that approximately 1% of the variance in fasting blood glucose could be attributed to the MTNR1B genotype.
title: Using synthetic datasets to better understand and explain health outcomes associated with common single nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: The SNP rs116970203, located in intron 11 of the PDE3B gene, was a low frequency variant (MAF = 0.03) and a perfect proxy for the rs117913124 variant in the CYP2R1 gene, which has previously been associated with 25OHD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs12794714, another synonymous variant linked to the CYP2R1 gene, was significantly associated with lower 25OHD levels, with a minor allele frequency of 0.42.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs117913124, a low frequency synonymous coding variant in the CYP2R1 gene, was identified as a perfect proxy for rs116970203 and was associated with 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs10741657 was part of the identified significant variants and was noted as one of the common SNPs influencing 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs12803256 was located upstream of DHCR7, an important gene involved in vitamin D metabolism, contributing to the understanding of the genetic architecture of 25OHD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs61883501 demonstrated a complex association where its maximum change in significance was observed, indicating its potential importance in influencing 25OHD levels.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs12785878 was also among the previously reported significant variants and was implicated in the 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs7948623 was highlighted as significant for the gene TMEM216, with strong evidence of association and differentiation in pigmentation traits among East African populations, particularly the Mursi pastoralists. It was associated with melanin levels and has been linked to enhancer activity in melanocytes, despite not being significant in the GTEx whole blood dataset.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The SNP rs11230664 was identified as significant for the gene TMEM216, correlating with pigmentation variation in East Africans. It tagged a significant indel variant near an active melanocyte enhancer and was associated with gene expression in GTEx tissues, emphasizing its role in pigmentation traits among the studied populations.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The SNP rs3741265, while not significantly identified as an sQTL in Africans, showed high linkage disequilibrium with the top eQTL for TMEM216 and displayed moderate association with skin pigmentation, particularly among the Mursi population, suggesting its involvement in pigmentation-related traits.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The SNP rs7934229 was noted as the leading SNP for TMEM216 expression in the African cohort and was closely associated with pigmentation traits, demonstrating notable population differentiation and an important role in the region linked to PIX experiments for pigmentation.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The locus rs7118422 on chromosome 11 was identified as a strong risk locus specifically for the comorbid phenotype ADHD comorbid with disruptive behavior disorders (ADHD+DBDs), with a significance level of P=8.97×10^-9 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.16 in the primary analysis. In a separate GWAS of ADHD without DBDs, this SNP showed minimal evidence for association (OR=1.022, P=0.175), confirming its specificity to the ADHD+DBD phenotype.
title: Identification of risk variants and characterization of the polygenic architecture of disruptive behavior disorders in the context of ADHD

finding: The SNP rs983392 associated with MS4A2 was mentioned to show statistical significance in the context of late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD), though no specific odds ratio and p-value were provided.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs10792832 in the PICALM locus was also noted for its association with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD), similar to rs983392, without specific odds ratio details.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: This SNP resulted in an E2039V mutation in ATM, which is linked to Ataxia-telangiectasia and breast and ovarian cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The SNP caused an E2039K variant in ATM, also associated with Ataxia-telangiectasia and cancer forms.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: Resulted in a L1283P mutation in ATM, noted for links to breast and ovarian cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The SNP caused G12D mutation in HRAS, linked to multiple cancers.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The polymorphism rs12252 was associated with susceptibility and severity of influenza. It was highlighted in two meta-analyses which indicated that this genetic variant could influence how individuals respond to influenza infections.
title: dbGSRV: a manually curated database of genetic susceptibility to respiratory virus

finding: The study demonstrated that one of the biological replicates used was from a donor homozygous for the rs713040 allele. This context related to the efficiency of prime editing methods targeting the HBB gene in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells, suggesting a possible influence of this SNP on prime editing outcomes.
title: Nucleotide metabolism constrains prime editing in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells

finding: The <italic>rs35705950</italic> polymorphism was identified as the strongest genetic risk factor associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). The minor allele (T) was shown to disrupt a DNA methylation site, leading to increased expression of MUC5B. Moreover, the T allele created a novel binding site for the transcription factor C/EBPβ, which further promoted MUC5B expression. In various studies, carrying the T allele correlated with higher levels of MUC5B mRNA and protein in lung epithelial cells, significantly impacting the risk of developing IPF. The polymorphism was linked to substantial variations in the prevalence of the T allele among different ethnic groups, especially among those of European descent compared to lower frequencies in Asian and African populations.
title: A MUC5B polymorphism associated with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis mediates overexpression through decreased CpG methylation and C/EBPβ transcriptional activation

finding: The study reported on the Taq1A genetic variant near the DRD2 gene (rs1800497) and its influence on weight loss response when treated with Naltrexone/Bupropion. This finding indicated that the genetic variant plays a significant role in modulating how individuals respond to the pharmacological treatment aimed at reducing obesity.
title: Mesolimbic opioid-dopamine interaction is disrupted in obesity but recovered by weight loss following bariatric surgery

finding: The rs1048220 SNP, involving the conversion of arginine R125 to methionine in the cleavage site of proBDNF, was associated with the inhibition of proBDNF cleavage, leading to high levels of proBDNF in the brain of the BDNFmet/leu mouse model. This knock-in model displayed numerous ASD-like phenotypes, suggesting a link between this SNP and autism spectrum behaviors.
title: Inhibiting proBDNF to mature BDNF conversion leads to autism-like phenotypes in vivo

finding: The rs1048221 SNP, facilitating the conversion of arginine R127 to leucine at the cleavage site of proBDNF, similarly inhibited the cleavage of proBDNF. The BDNFmet/leu mice also showed a significant association with ASD-like behaviors, indicating that this SNP may play a role in the neurodevelopmental aspects of autism spectrum disorders.
title: Inhibiting proBDNF to mature BDNF conversion leads to autism-like phenotypes in vivo

finding: The SNP rs174546 at the FADS locus showed a derived allele that was selected in parallel in both Europe and East Asia over the past 10,000 years. It exhibited a selection coefficient between 0.007 and 0.012 in Europe, with a broader estimated range of 0.004-0.015. This finding suggested adaptation to agricultural diets and demonstrated consistent selection trajectories across different European regions.
title: Estimating time-varying selection coefficients from time series data of allele frequencies

finding: The rs12252 SNP in the IFITM3 gene was associated with influenza susceptibility and severity, as found in the meta-analysis by Prabhu et al. (2018). This finding provided insight into the genetic factors affecting the immune response to viral infections, which is relevant in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection and Covid-19 severity.
title: Functional characterization of SARS-CoV-2 infection suggests a complex inflammatory response and metabolic alterations

finding: Associated with NRIP3, this SNP was validated as a key regulatory variant influencing CAD through enhanced gene expression in specific experimental conditions.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: This SNP also exhibited a significant <trans> interchromosomal connection with <RAD21> and was linked to the regulation of <RCN1> transcript levels. These findings indicated that rs10639528 may be involved in the mechanisms that underlie oncogenesis through its regulatory effects.
title: Genetic Variation as a Long-Distance Modulator of RAD21 Expression in Humans

finding: The SNP rs11212527 was initially found to be associated with climatic drivers affecting vegetation greening trends in alpine regions. Specifically, the positive finding indicated that variations at this locus could influence how dwarf shrubs respond to environmental stressors, which are linked to changes in climate and land use. This discovery was relevant as it helped to explain the temporal trends in shrub encroachment observed in the study.
title: Dwarf-shrubs dynamics in Mediterranean high mountain ecosystems

finding: The SNP rs10830963 showed strong evidence of co-localization between its lead T2D variant and MTNR1B expression, enhancing understanding of its role in T2D susceptibility.
title: Influence of genetic variants on gene expression in human pancreatic islets – implications for type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP, associated with DRD2, has been previously noted for its relevance in addiction-related behaviors, supporting the overlap of gene networks influencing nicotine dependence and broader addiction susceptibility.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: Identified within a significant locus for cigarettes per day, this SNP was correlated with nicotine dependence traits, highlighting its importance in the genetic architecture of smoking.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: rs10791097 was identified as an eQTL associated with the gene SNX19, which functions in sorting vesicles and may have implications in neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This SNP regulated the FADS1 gene in the fetal cortex, where it was found to influence fatty acid metabolism, important for neurodevelopment.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This SNP was the sentinel variant associated with IPF, mapping to the promoter region of the MUC5B gene. Each copy of the risk allele conferred a five-fold increase in the odds of developing IPF, highlighting its significant role in disease susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs878913005 (Arg1201Trp) was strongly associated with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF). The analysis showed a significant increase in frequency among COPD patients (0.3740) compared to controls (0.3397), achieving statistical significance (p<0.05). Furthermore, a notable increase was observed in IPF patients, with a frequency rise of 0.1556 (46%) at statistical significance (p<0.01). The study also established that the co-occurrence of this SNP with rs35705950 in MUC5B substantially increased the association with IPF.
title: Structural mechanism of MUC5AC mucin net-like polymer formation and its SNP variability that affect risk of the lung diseases COPD and IPF

finding: The SNP rs35705950, affecting the promoter region of MUC5B, demonstrated a strong association with IPF. It showed a frequency of 0.3194 in IPF patients. Analysis found that the presence of this SNP in conjunction with rs878913005 from MUC5AC significantly enhanced the risk for IPF, with increased co-occurrence noted in IPF patients compared to controls.
title: Structural mechanism of MUC5AC mucin net-like polymer formation and its SNP variability that affect risk of the lung diseases COPD and IPF

finding: The Taq1A polymorphism (rs1800497) in the ANKK1 gene was highlighted for its role in influencing the interaction between BMI and temporal impulsivity in men, where increased temporal impulsivity coupled with a disadvantageous DRD2/ANKK1 genotype was indicated as a vulnerability factor for the development of obesity. This suggests that the genetic variability represented by this SNP interacted with behavioral traits to impact obesity measures.
title: DRD2/ANKK1 Taq1A but not COMT single nucleotide polymorphisms contribute to the link between temporal impulsivity and obesity in men

finding: The A allele of TPH1 rs623580 was found to negatively predict creativity in youth when paired with paternal indifference and neglect in early life. This suggests a risk association where individuals carrying the A allele exhibited decreased creativity. Additionally, male individuals with the A allele showed lower flexibility compared to those with the TT genotype, indicating a potential moderator role of this SNP in the relationship between early paternal care and creative outcomes.
title: Paternal Indifference and neglect in early life and Creativity: Exploring the Moderating Role of TPH1 genotype and Offspring’s Gender

finding: The SNP produced significantly increased expression with the alternate T allele (FC=1.62, FDR q=0.036).
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: This hQTL produced increased expression with the reference A allele (FC=0.61, FDR q=0.038), suggesting its potential regulatory role.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: This SNP produced an AE (FC=0.57, FDR q=0.0005) and demonstrated interaction with the promoter of BCL9L.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: rs4936277 was identified in the meta-analysis of AUD as being significantly associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD) diagnosis, classifying it among the 10 independent loci found in European ancestry (EA) populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: Similar to rs4936277, rs61902812 was also found in the meta-analysis for AUD, representing another significant locus related to the AUD trait in EAs.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: The SNP rs141845179 in the HBB locus was significantly associated with eGFR (p = 3.0×10^−8), although this association was not significant upon conditioning on previously reported SNP rs334. Fine-mapping analysis suggested that rs141845179 had a posterior probability of 0.61 of being the causal variant at the HBB locus, establishing it as an original finding despite being conditional.
title: Discovery and fine-mapping of kidney function loci in first genome-wide association study in Africans

finding: The rs11222369 SNP was identified as a significant functional variant influencing the expression of the SNX19 gene in the prefrontal cortex, showing reduced expression for the GG genotype based on eQTL data.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: The study referenced by Helfrich and Singer (2019) identified the SNP rs11030356 as a significant marker linked to the functional role of CEACAM1 isoform signature. This finding suggested that variations at this locus could affect NK cell-mediated killing in melanoma, indicating its potential relevance in therapeutic strategies targeting immune responses in cancer.
title: A novel bioinformatics pipeline for the identification of immune inhibitory receptors as potential therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs174559 was identified as an eQTL for miR-1908 and was found to colocalize with genetic signals for glycemic traits including blood glucose and HbA1c. It also showed strong evidence of colocalization with red blood cell distribution width (RCDW). This suggests potential pleiotropic effects of this locus that influence multiple physiological traits.
title: Human pancreatic islet microRNAs implicated in diabetes and related traits by large-scale genetic analysis

finding: The variant rs1800057 resulted in a missense mutation in the ATM gene, associating it with MPN risk through contributions to hematopoietic malignancies.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: In the GSTP1 gene, rs625978 was linked with N-acetylglycine levels, showing a significant correlation specifically in females.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The SNP rs12798472 was significantly associated with systolic blood pressure (P=1×10^-58). A 928-bp deletion located upstream of the INSR gene at chromosome 19 (chr19:7,258,353-7,259,281) was shown to be in strong LD (r^2=0.979) with this SNP, suggesting that the deletion may have a regulatory role impacting blood pressure.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: The variant rs17309874 was associated with the causal effects of lifetime smoking on waist circumference (WC<sub>adjBMI</sub>), underscoring its relevance in abdominal adiposity mechanisms.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the recurrence of mild malaria infections (RMI) located in the ACER3 gene at the 11q13.5 region, having a p-value of 6.85×10−8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The SNP rs34013602 in the PICALM gene was noted for showing a nominally significant burden of rare nonsynonymous variants in carriers of the LRRK2 G2019S mutation, indicating its potential role in the genetic landscape of Parkinson's disease.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The risk allele of rs4938573 was associated with impaired CXCR5 expression and increased homing of CXCR5+ cells to the salivary gland in SjD patients, suggesting a disease-specific role. It modulated promoter and enhancer activities affecting CXCR5 expression in EBV B and Jurkat cells.
title: Variants in the DDX6-CXCR5 autoimmune disease risk locus influence the regulatory network in immune cells and salivary gland

finding: The risk allele of rs57494551 exhibited increased enhancer activity and was implicated in the expression regulation of DDX6 and CXCR5 in various immune cells, exhibiting allele-specific nuclear protein binding.
title: Variants in the DDX6-CXCR5 autoimmune disease risk locus influence the regulatory network in immune cells and salivary gland

finding: The risk allele of rs4938572 showed increased enhancer and promoter activity in Jurkat cells and was involved in regulating expression levels in other immune cell types, affecting long non-coding RNA lnc-PHLDB1-1.
title: Variants in the DDX6-CXCR5 autoimmune disease risk locus influence the regulatory network in immune cells and salivary gland

finding: The risk allele of rs4936443 exhibited increased binding affinity for nuclear proteins and enhanced transcriptional activity in immune cells, suggesting modulation of gene expression in the context of SjD and SLE.
title: Variants in the DDX6-CXCR5 autoimmune disease risk locus influence the regulatory network in immune cells and salivary gland

finding: The risk allele of rs7117261 increased promoter activity in immune and epithelial cells, contributing to the dysregulated immune response seen in SjD and SLE.
title: Variants in the DDX6-CXCR5 autoimmune disease risk locus influence the regulatory network in immune cells and salivary gland

finding: The SNP rs11030287 was linked to the implications of voltage-gated potassium channels in neoplastic cell proliferation. This research underscored the significance of these channels in tumor growth and development, aligning with the findings related to epithelial cell dynamics and their membrane potential.
title: Voltage-dependent volume regulation controls epithelial cell extrusion and morphology

finding: The SNP rs2403254 was associated with the metabolite 2-hydroxyisovalerate. Initially, the association was incorrectly attributed to the HPS5 gene in the original GWAS. However, it was later clarified that the true causative gene for this SNP-metabolite relationship was LDHA, which is located at the SNP's genetic locus. This refutation of the earlier claim demonstrated the importance of accurately identifying genetic variants linked to specific biochemical reactions. This finding highlighted the capacity of piTracer to reveal correct molecular associations that will aid in understanding metabolism in cancer cells.
title: piTracer - Automatic reconstruction of molecular cascades for the identification of synergistic drug targets

finding: This SNP was associated with neuroticism and broadly defined depression, replicating previous findings from genome-wide association studies (GWAS).
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This SNP was linked with several psychiatric phenotypes, including schizophrenia, validating previous GWAS results.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs34481144, located in the IFITM3 promoter region, was associated with lower IFITM3 mRNA levels. This decreased expression was linked to increased severity of disease in influenza cohorts. Specifically, the substitution of the majority G allele with the minority C allele led to reduced levels of antiviral CD8+ T cells in IAV-infected lung tissue, indicating its role in viral pathogenesis.
title: IFITM3 regulates virus-induced inflammatory cytokine production by titrating Nogo-B orchestration of TLR responses

finding: The CC genotype of the rs12252 SNP, located in exon 1 of IFITM3, was found to be associated with increased severity of influenza A virus (IAV) infections. Human genetic studies suggested that individuals with this genotype experienced severe disease characterized by high levels of the cytokine CCL2, which drove pathogenic monocyte responses and hypercytokinemia, ultimately leading to fatal outcomes in some cases, such as during H7N9 infections.
title: IFITM3 regulates virus-induced inflammatory cytokine production by titrating Nogo-B orchestration of TLR responses

finding: The SNP rs4246215 was found to be selectively targeted by miR-1236, with specific binding to the G allele over the T allele in the 3' UTR of the Flap endonuclease 1 gene. This revealed a mechanism of miRNA-mediated regulation of gene expression associated with this SNP.
title: An alternative miRISC targeting a coding mutation site in FOXL2 links to granulosa cell tumor

finding: The SNP rs10437655 was identified as a significant variant within the LOAD GWAS locus involving the genes CELF1 and SPI1. This SNP presented notable association statistics illustrated by a Manhattan plot, highlighting its importance in the context of LOAD. It was involved in complex interactions with various gene promoters and chromatin elements in human brain cell types, demonstrating its relevance in the genetic risk for late-onset Alzheimer’s Disease.
title: A systems biology-based identification and in vivo functional screening of Alzheimer’s disease risk genes reveals modulators of memory function

finding: The rs9344 variant in the CCND1 gene demonstrated an association with breast cancer phenotype and prognosis.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs28514987 was associated with adaptive introgression as indicated by U20 and Q95 statistics (p-values of 0.022 and 0.031) and acted as a GTEx eQTL for BRSK2. This gene negatively regulates insulin secretion and is expressed in pancreatic islets, highlighting a potential link to metabolic adaptations.
title: A signature of Neanderthal introgression on molecular mechanisms of environmental responses

finding: The SNP rs3794087 in the SLC1A2 gene was associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease (PD) in a Chinese population. The study highlighted that this SNP was not associated with other conditions such as essential tremor, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or multiple system atrophy. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing the risk of developing PD.
title: Defining specific cell states of MPTP-induced Parkinson’s disease by single-nucleus RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs11232752 was also highlighted as a positive and original finding, being relevant in establishing plot-yield prediction models for soybean breeding programs. The research emphasized the utility of UAV-based hyperspectral remote sensing for improving predictions related to AGB.
title: Time-series Multi-spectral Imaging in Soybean for Improving Biomass and Genomic Prediction Accuracy

finding: The SNP rs3794087 was found to be associated with the SLC1A2 gene, linked to a risk assessment for restless legs syndrome. This finding indicated a genetic component that could influence neurological conditions related to the regulation of dopaminergic activity, which aligns with the broader context of studying the role of Hox genes in maintaining neural function.
title: A novel post-developmental role of the Hox genes underlies normal adult behaviour

finding: The SNP rs73036086 demonstrated significant allelic differences in both K562 and SH-SY5Y cell lines, indicating its potential role in regulating gene expression related to schizophrenia or Alzheimer's disease.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The rs33930165 variant, a missense variant in the HBB gene associated with hemoglobin (HGB) levels, was found to be significantly associated with higher white blood cell count (WBC) in individuals of African ancestry, achieving genome-wide significance with a p-value of 8.1×10^-12. In contrast, the same variant showed no significant associations with HGB or hematocrit (HCT), indicating a unique role in influencing WBC.
title: Use of >100,000 NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium whole genome sequences improves imputation quality and detection of rare variant associations in admixed African and Hispanic/Latino populations

finding: The rs11549407 variant, a stop-gain variant in the HBB gene, demonstrated a significant association with lower hemoglobin (HGB) and hematocrit (HCT) levels in Hispanic/Latino populations, with p-values of 1.59×10^-12 for HGB and 1.13×10^-9 for HCT. This variant was notable for its rarity and was imputed with high quality, underscoring its relevance in the hematological trait analyses.
title: Use of >100,000 NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium whole genome sequences improves imputation quality and detection of rare variant associations in admixed African and Hispanic/Latino populations

finding: For rs4244842, it was identified as an eQTL associated with ejection fraction (EF) and showed substantial differential gene expression effects in heart-related tissues, although limited to the 1-2 heart cell types studied.
title: Transcriptional Variabilities in Human hiPSC-derived Cardiomyocytes: All Genes Are Not Equal and Their Robustness May Foretell Donor’s Disease Susceptibility

finding: The rs11228427 SNP was similarly classified as an eQTL for EF and exhibited significant differential expression; it notably had opposite expression effects in left ventricle (LV) versus aorta.
title: Transcriptional Variabilities in Human hiPSC-derived Cardiomyocytes: All Genes Are Not Equal and Their Robustness May Foretell Donor’s Disease Susceptibility

finding: Identified as an eQTL for LV mass and located within an intron of MRPL21 on Chromosome 11, rs636049 had significant positive effects across various heart-related tissues.
title: Transcriptional Variabilities in Human hiPSC-derived Cardiomyocytes: All Genes Are Not Equal and Their Robustness May Foretell Donor’s Disease Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12252 in the IFITM3 gene resulted in a significant N-terminal truncation associated with increased severity of influenza virus infection. A meta-analysis confirmed the link between this variant and enhanced risk of severe influenza in a wide population, establishing it as a prevalent genetic variant impacting influenza outcomes.
title: A rare variant in ANP32B impairs influenza virus replication in human cells

finding: The rs1582763 variant in the MS4A locus was associated with increased MS4A4A expression, which was upregulated by DSS treatment alone. This variant was linked to a reduced risk of Alzheimer's disease by promoting healthy lipid metabolism and reducing chemokine signaling in microglia.
title: Locus coeruleus injury modulates ventral midbrain neuroinflammation during DSS-induced colitis

finding: The SNP rs7949048 was found to be associated with bone mineral density (eBMD) and reached genome-wide significance with a P value of 3.1E-12. This finding highlighted the potential importance of the SLC37A2 gene in bone metabolism and suggested that variations in this gene could affect bone density, making it relevant for understanding metabolic bone diseases.
title: Sugar transporter Slc37a2 regulates bone metabolism via a dynamic tubular lysosomal network in osteoclasts

finding: The SNP rs174541 was reported in association with factor 7, which pertains to blood lipid studies. It showed a significant association with a p-value of 4.3 × 10⁻⁵, indicating its relevance to lipid metabolism and type-2 diabetes.
title: Multiset correlation and factor analysis enables exploration of multi-omic data

finding: The SNP rs174549 was associated with factor 7 in blood lipid studies, demonstrating a significant p-value of 5.6 × 10⁻⁵. It was also previously reported in GWAS concerning white blood cell count.
title: Multiset correlation and factor analysis enables exploration of multi-omic data

finding: The SNP rs1535 exhibited association with factor 7, related to blood lipid studies, with a p-value of 8.3 × 10⁻⁵. It has been reported in GWAS of inflammatory bowel disease, further linking it to important health conditions.
