title: Multiset correlation and factor analysis enables exploration of multi-omic data

finding: The SNP rs11020216 was associated with the long non-coding RNA MALAT1, which had previously been implicated in cancer and metastasis. The finding provided new insights into the role of MALAT1, suggesting that this SNP might influence the expression or function of MALAT1, thus contributing to cancer-related phenotypes. This connection highlighted the potential for targeting lincRNAs in therapeutic strategies against cancer.
title: Identification and Functional Annotation of Long Intergenic Non-coding RNAs in the Brassicaceae

finding: The SNP rs1973765 was found to be significantly associated with breast cancer (BrCa) incidence and outcome. It led the most significant linkage disequilibrium (LD) block that contained three functional SNPs (fSNPs) predicted to disrupt LSP1 regulatory regions.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs4980389 was identified as a functional SNP within the LD block led by rs1973765. It was predicted to disrupt binding sites for immune regulatory transcription factors, highlighting its role in immune signaling related to BrCa.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs588321 was another fSNP identified within the LD block associated with rs1973765, predicted to disrupt transcriptional regulatory elements impacting LSP1 and consequently influencing immune responses in BrCa.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs8181588, previously recognized as a T2D risk variant, was nominally shown to influence KCNQ1 expression negatively. Although KCNQ1 expression was downregulated in patients with HbA1c levels >= 6.5%, this SNP did not alter expression in diagnosed T2D patients.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: The rs11031005 locus was associated with higher PCOS risk (OR 1.17, P=8.7x10^-13) and lower circulating follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) levels (-0.166 standard deviations, P=2.0x10^-6). This locus highlighted FSH as a potential mediator for PCOS pathophysiology due to its role in follicular development and ovulation.
title: Colocalization highlights genes in hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis as potentially mediating polycystic ovary syndrome risk

finding: The SNP rs1061810 was identified to have a significant association with the transcript expression of the gene HSD17B12, which encodes for 17 beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase involved in long-chain fatty acid metabolism. It was found that this SNP had a top signal with a P-value of 2.3×10−117. The study also reported that an NRS (GNRS_4918), located in the 3'UTR and in high linkage disequilibrium (r² = 0.87) with rs1061810, provided an even stronger association at P = 5.6×10−120, indicating the NRS might play a role in regulating gene expression.
title: Graph pangenome reveals functional, evolutionary, and phenotypic significance of human nonreference sequences

finding: The genetic variant rs7120118 in the NR1H3 gene was associated with significant increases in mRNA levels among Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients as determined by qPCR analysis. This finding suggested that the CT genotype of rs7120118 correlated with elevated NR1H3 expression, although disease severity did not have an effect on NR1H3 expression.
title: Identification of common molecular biomarker signatures in blood and brain of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs2279238 in the NR1H3 gene conferred a 1.35-fold increased risk of developing progressive multiple sclerosis (MS), highlighting its impact on disease risk. Additionally, protein expression analysis indicated that mutant NR1H3 altered gene expression profiles, suggesting a disruption in transcriptional regulation as a potential mechanism underlying MS pathogenesis.
title: Identification of common molecular biomarker signatures in blood and brain of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs143445068 was highlighted as a significant association on chromosome 11 in the analysis for recurrent miscarriage, presenting a MAF of 0.8% with a P-value of 5.2×10^-9. This variant was associated with multiple candidates, including NAV2 and other genes related to miscarriage.
title: The genetic architecture of sporadic and recurrent miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs11826236 in RIC3 was significantly associated with a lower age at smoking initiation, showing a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.45 (p = 0.028), suggesting that this variant may contribute to earlier tobacco use.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs149514849, located at 11p13 near the gene ABTB2, showed a suggestive association with red blood cell (RBC) deformability with a p-value of 8.08 x 10^-8, indicating potential influence on this phenotype. This SNP was asserted to affect CD44 expression in macrophages, relevant in processes such as immune response and splenic clearance, which are linked to malaria protection.
title: Splenic clearance of rigid erythrocytes as an inherited mechanism for splenomegaly and natural resistance to malaria

finding: The SNP rs3842753 was associated with increased beta-cell INS messenger RNA levels, as reported in meta-analyses of single-cell RNA-sequencing data related to Type 1 diabetes risk. This finding indicated a potential relationship between the at-risk allele and altered insulin production in pancreatic beta-cells.
title: Dynamic Ins2 gene activity defines β-cell maturity states

finding: rs983392 was shown to be a trans-eQTL affecting a component with 54 genes, significant in relation to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs9326418 in the FADS2 gene was associated with an increase in TNFα production after the in vitro β-glucan-induced trained immunity. The analysis was performed in a cohort of 325 healthy volunteers, with a significance level of p=0.00016.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: Variation in the SNP rs11600019 in the FADS2 gene was associated with an increased fold change of TNFα after BCG vaccination. This finding was noted in analysis of the in vivo BCG vaccination model, with a significance level of p=0.00078.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: The SNP rs12252 in the Interferon-Induced Transmembrane Protein 3 (IFITM3) gene was associated with severe influenza in Chinese individuals. This genetic variant influenced the severity of Hemorrhagic Fever with Renal Syndrome (HFRS), demonstrating its role in viral infections and immune response.
title: The furin cleavage site of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission due to enhanced replication in airway cells

finding: rs71475909 demonstrated increased risk for breast cancer while exhibiting protective effects for prostate cancer, underlining its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: rs58876856 was linked with breast and prostate cancer risk, supported by significant expression levels in affected tissues.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs4262739 was associated as an eQTL for the <italic>ETS1</italic> gene and linked to human trait variation, specifically lymphocyte percentage. It resided in a human-specific <italic>cis</italic> regulatory element affecting enhancer activity and influencing regulatory outcomes on a large scale.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: Similar to rs4262739, SNP rs4245080 was recognized as an eQTL for the <italic>ETS1</italic> gene, contributing to human trait variation related to immune responses. Its proximity to a key enhancer region demonstrated its relevance in mediating changes in regulatory element activity.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: The rs108499 SNP was linked to the positively selected FADS1 haplotype and demonstrated an increase in number of children ever born by 0.0134, indicating its importance in reproductive success and selection.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The SNP rs964184 on chromosome 11 showed a genome-wide significant overall GxE effect across lipids, specifically in a multivariate context. Although univariate tests did not yield genome-wide significant p-values, it had strong evidence for pleiotropy, being associated with HDL and triglycerides based on interactions with environmental factors such as sleep duration and physical activity. It was also noted to be marginally associated with various phenotypes, including lipid levels and cardiovascular disease.
title: A two-step approach to testing overall effect of gene-environment interaction for multiple phenotypes

finding: SNP rs4265625 was found to create regulatory activity in HepG2 cells but not in K562 cells. This SNP is within the POU2AF1 gene, which has been linked to primary biliary cirrhosis in GWAS studies, indicating its functional significance in liver disease.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The study reported that the DRD2 Taq1 A polymorphism (rs1800497) was found to have a higher frequency of the A2 allele compared to the A1 allele in the population of Eastern Uttar Pradesh. Specifically, the frequency of the A2/A2 genotype was 0.24, A2/A1 genotype was 0.64, and A1/A1 genotype was 0.12. This polymorphism was implicated in various psychiatric disorders, including ADHD and drug abuse, with individuals having the A1A1 genotype showing a 49% reduction in dopamine receptors, which potentially increases craving for alcohol.
title: DRD2 TaqI A polymorphism in Eastern Uttar Pradesh population

finding: The SNP rs12252-C was associated with severe influenza in Chinese individuals, indicating that variations in the IFITM3 gene might affect antiviral immunity and contribute to the severity of influenza infections.
title: Interferon-Induced Transmembrane Protein 3 Blocks Fusion of Diverse Enveloped Viruses by Locally Altering Mechanical Properties of Cell Membranes

finding: The SNP rs2168101 G>T was identified as a noncoding causal mutation located in the enhancer of LMO1. This mutation disrupted GATA3 binding, subsequently affecting LMO1 expression in neuroblastoma patients. This finding illustrated the significant role of noncoding regulatory sequences in the context of pediatric cancers.
title: Diverse noncoding mutations contribute to deregulation of cis-regulatory landscape in pediatric cancers

finding: This SNP was associated with asthma and eosinophil counts, as it overlapped with CAMBUS+ OCR in regulatory T-cells. Its nearest gene, LRRC32, serves as a marker for T-reg cells and was implicated in the immune regulation of asthma.
title: Predicted constrained accessible regions mark regulatory elements and causal variants

finding: The SNP rs10835310 was associated with childhood obesity. This finding suggested a significant involvement of the METTL15 gene, which is related to mitochondrial RNA modifications, in the pathogenesis of childhood obesity. Although the exact molecular mechanisms behind this association remained unclear, it pointed towards the potential role of METTL15 in metabolic regulation.
title: The human mitochondrial 12S rRNA m4C methyltransferase METTL15 is required for proper mitochondrial function

finding: The variant rs11819995, associated with T2D, was shown to have significant effects on regulatory activity depending on the presence of an HNF1 motif. Deletion of the motif led to significant decreases in enhancer activity for both reference (C) and alternate (T) alleles (Wilcoxon rank-sum test p = 0.008). This variant is found in the first intron of the ETS1 gene and overlaps an alternative transcription start site active in pancreatic islets.
title: Using a modular massively parallel reporter assay to discover context-specific regulatory grammars in type 2 diabetes

finding: Wang et al. in 2014 reported an association between the genetic polymorphism of SAA1 (rs12218) and the risk of myocardial infarction in a Chinese population.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: In 2021, Agundez et al. examined polymorphisms CYP2R1 rs10766197 and highlighted their relevance in multiple sclerosis within a case-control study.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The FADS2 rs3834458 gene polymorphism was associated with both nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and coronary artery disease in a Chinese Han population, indicating its possible implications in lipid metabolism.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The FADS 2 rs174575 (C/G) polymorphism was found to be associated with circulating lipid levels and susceptibility to type-2 diabetes mellitus, which intersects with fatty liver disease risks.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs11030413 was associated with a finding that indicated its involvement in the modulation of RAD51 phosphorylation by c-met, which agreed with the context of RAD51's role in maintaining genome integrity through processes like DNA damage response. This set a link between the SNP and potential variations in presynaptic filament stability, with implications for understanding its role in cancer biology.
title: Aurora A mediated new phosphorylation of RAD51 is observed in Nuclear Speckles

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was found to be associated with genomic features of FOXM1 overexpression in cancer, as demonstrated in the pan-cancer analyses conducted by Barger et al. in 2019. The finding indicated that alterations at this locus could contribute to the progression and characteristics of various cancers.
title: The role of APOBEC3B in lung tumour evolution and targeted therapy resistance

finding: The SNP rs1790218, which encodes the A-allele and is associated with the p.Trp96Ter mutation, demonstrated significant associations with decreased transcript levels of SLC22A10 in human populations. This mutation was prevalent, observed at allele frequencies of approximately 20% in African populations and up to 50% in European populations, leading to a considerable decrease in protein expression in liver tissues for bearers of the A-allele.
title: Illuminating the Function of the Orphan Transporter, SLC22A10 in Humans and Other Primates

finding: The rs1800497 SNP, associated with the Taq1A polymorphism in the ANKK1 gene, was significantly linked to various psychiatric conditions and metabolic responses. The homozygous expression of the A1 allele correlated with a reduction in striatal DRD2 levels, which is observed in conditions like addiction and overeating. Furthermore, a study indicated that weight-loss response to naltrexone/bupropion was modulated by this genetic variant. In the context of energy homeostasis, differential nutrient partitioning was documented in humans based on the presence or absence of the A1 allele.
title: The addiction-susceptibility TaqIA/Ankyrin repeat and kinase domain containing 1 kinase (ANKK1) controls reward and metabolism through dopamine receptor type 2 (DR2)-expressing neurons

finding: This SNP was an intergenic variant located 42kb from SCYL1, recognized for its association with height that had not been documented in previous genome analyses.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: Described as an intronic variant in OVOL1, this SNP emerged as height-associated under the new analytical framework after being absent from prior studies.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs3842753 was identified as an at-risk allele associated with increased beta-cell INS messenger RNA levels. This finding was established through a meta-analysis of single-cell RNA-sequencing data, providing insights into the genetic risk factors for Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). The association indicated that this variant could potentially play a role in the mechanisms underlying beta-cell dysfunction in T1D.
title: Delineating mouse β-cell identity during lifetime and in diabetes with a single cell atlas

finding: The SNP rs174570 had a significant selection signal (PBS=0.2533) and was associated with lipid metabolism disorders, impacting levels of long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids by influencing genes FADS1 and FADS2.
title: Malaria resistance-related biological adaptation and complex evolutionary footprints of Tai-Kadai people inferred from 796 genomes

finding: The SNP rs867611 was implicated in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and was associated with 16 actively expressed circular RNAs (circRNAs) detected under its peak in the pyramidal neuron samples from the PICALM gene. This SNP's association was confirmed with a statistically significant p-value of 2.19×10^-18, highlighting its relevance in the context of neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.
title: Circular RNAs in the human brain are tailored to neuron identity and neuropsychiatric disease

finding: The SNP rs10767744 was associated with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) cases in the European sample, achieving genome-wide significance (p=1.75×10−10) and was found nearest to the gene METTL15.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The SNP rs10767739 emerged as a genome-wide significant variant (exact significance p-value not specified) in trans-ancestral analysis and was in linkage disequilibrium with rs10767744, nearest to METTL15.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The SNP rs12225230 was found to be significantly associated with circulating apoA-I concentrations at genome-wide significance (P<5×10^-8) in a study involving 20,370 Finnish participants. It showed a per-C allele beta of 0.076 SD (SE: 0.013; P=1.5×10^-9). This was considered a robust association as it was previously reported in another GWAS. Additionally, this SNP did not show any significant correlation with risk of coronary artery disease (CAD), with an odds ratio of 1.13 (95% CI: 0.98, 1.30). Hence, the genetic evidence available did not support a cardioprotective role for apoA-I as mediated by this SNP.
title: Genetic variation in apolipoprotein A-I concentrations and risk of coronary artery disease

finding: The rs34481144 SNP was found to be a functional QTL influencing NPC sensitivity to Zika virus infection. Donors homozygous for the reference allele (C) expressed IFITM3 at levels 4.82-fold higher than donors homozygous for the alternate allele (T). This SNP accounted for 58% of the variation in ZIKV infectivity across various genetic backgrounds, and it reached genome-wide significance (p = 9.0 × 10^-10) in association with ZIKV infectivity.
title: Natural variation in gene expression and Zika virus susceptibility revealed by villages of neural progenitor cells

finding: The SNP rs174548 was identified in a previous study by Wang et al. as being associated with circulating polyunsaturated fatty acids. Although the current study focused on metabolic changes related to memory decline, the findings suggest a potential broader impact of this SNP on lipid metabolism that may relate to cognitive functions such as memory.
title: Untargeted Metabolomics Shows Alterations in Homocysteine, Lipids and Fatty Acids predicting Memory Decline in Healthy Middle-Aged Individuals

finding: This variant was identified as a regulatory variant disrupting CTCF binding and validated to decrease expression of MS4A6A in THP-1 cells.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The SNP rs74771917 was associated with extreme PBS values, indicating a potential signal of selection in Native American populations, specifically noted in LD block 2. Its significance diminished when using Mesolithic hunter-gatherers as an outgroup, but it remained important as part of a retained signal of selection among individuals with the ancestral haplotype.
title: Limited evidence for selection at the FADS locus in Native American populations

finding: Similar to rs74771917, SNP rs7115739 also exhibited extreme PBS values, reflecting a selected status in Native American groups within LD block 2. The connection to selection was diminished with different outgroups, yet it indicated a strong association with adaptation in the context of the broader analysis.
title: Limited evidence for selection at the FADS locus in Native American populations

finding: The SNP rs117956829 downstream of the NOX4 gene was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ), bipolar disorder (BIP), MD, autism spectrum disorder (ASD), and AN. NOX4 is involved in superoxide production and neural stem cell growth.
title: Genome wide meta-analysis identifies genomic relationships, novel loci, and pleiotropic mechanisms across eight psychiatric disorders

finding: This variant provided a protective effect against AD across all populations tested in GWAS studies.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: This SNP was associated with increased risk of AD in NHWs, and subsequent studies highlighted its impact on expression of SPI1.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The SNP rs1557765, associated with Body Mass Index, was linked to the ABCC8 promoter, indicating its relevance in metabolic traits.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: The SNP rs5215, associated with Type 2 Diabetes, showed enhanced binding motifs for TCF7L2, suggesting it plays a significant role in transcriptional regulation.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: The SNP rs5219 was associated with Type 2 Diabetes, and like rs5215, led to enhanced TCF7L2 binding motifs.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: SNP rs757110 was identified as having associations with Type 2 Diabetes through its linkage with KCNJ11 intronic regions.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: The SNP rs3903072 had a strong association with ER+ breast cancer (p = 2×10^-12). It was also found to regulate the expression of CTSW in tumor infiltrating lymphocytes, suggesting a role in immune response modulation. Higher expression of CTSW correlated with better survival outcomes in breast cancer patients.
title: Can cancer GWAS variants modulate immune cells in the tumor microenvironment?

finding: The SNP rs658524 was identified as a putative functional SNP regulating CTSW expression in immune cells, showing significant association with breast cancer and was in high LD with several other GWAS SNPs for inflammatory traits.
title: Can cancer GWAS variants modulate immune cells in the tumor microenvironment?

finding: The SNP rs11227311 was identified as a potentially functional SNP within a putative regulatory element that may modulate CTSW expression in immune cells, showing strong linkage to rs3903072.
title: Can cancer GWAS variants modulate immune cells in the tumor microenvironment?

finding: This SNP was previously identified as robustly associated with vitamin D levels and had a replicated result indicating that higher vitamin D levels decrease the risk of adult/pediatric multiple sclerosis.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: This SNP was also previously identified as associated with vitamin D levels and was part of the replicated findings showing that higher vitamin D levels decrease the risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: The rs3092836 variant, located in the 3-prime UTR of the ATM gene, demonstrated a strong association with mosaic chromosomal alterations (mCAs) at the ATM locus, with an odds ratio (OR) of 26.41 and a p-value of 0.0013. This finding was significant in individuals of African ancestry, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 8%, highlighting its relevance in that population.
title: Mosaic chromosomal alterations in blood across ancestries via whole-genome sequencing

finding: The rs56009889 variant at the ATM locus displayed a significant association with mCAs, with an extremely high odds ratio (OR = 92) and a p-value of 2.5e-8. Its profound impact was noted despite its rarity, with a minor allele count (MAC) of only 7 in the analyzed population.
title: Mosaic chromosomal alterations in blood across ancestries via whole-genome sequencing

finding: Although rs2075290 lacked strong evidence for functional importance like its leading counterpart rs964184, it displayed a MACIE-regulatory score of 0.88, suggesting some level of potential regulatory role.
title: A Multi-dimensional Integrative Scoring Framework for Predicting Functional Regions in the Human Genome

finding: The SNP rs174535 was the lead SNP for the MYRF locus, linked to asthma. This missense variant caused a serine to arginine substitution and was predicted to be 'probably damaging', and it was also in linkage disequilibrium with a significant eQTL for TMEM258.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs149663839 was discovered as part of the HFpEF genetic loci, located 50 Kb upstream of CAT, a key antioxidant enzyme, suggesting its potential role in chronic diseases, including HF.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: Findings for rs11231693 indicated a significant reduction in the consistency of pleiotropic patterns due to its association with height, revealing a potential irrelevance of this trait to the SNP's broader effects on anthropometric traits, supported by non-significant GWAS results for height.
title: Beyond power: Multivariate discovery, replication, and interpretation of pleiotropic loci using summary association statistics

finding: The IFITM3 rs12252 SNP was associated with disease susceptibility in relation to environmental factors like BMI and diabetes incidence.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs527619 was identified as spatially interacting with the promoter of the CXCR5 gene, which is crucial for TFH function. This relationship was confirmed through CRISPR-Cas9 editing leading to induced expression of CXCR5.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Similar to rs527619, SNP rs71041848 also interacted with the CXCR5 promoter, supporting its role in the transcriptional regulation relevant to SLE pathology.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The variant rs694539 in the NNMT gene was linked to bipolar disorder, highlighting its relevance in psychiatric genetics.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The MPPED2 gene variant rs10767873 demonstrated an association with kidney function and the risk of cardiovascular disease in patients with hypertension, connecting it to cardiovascular health.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs10830963 was recognized as a regulatory variant at the MNTR1B locus, previously shown to alter enhancer activities, linking it to type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk.
title: Deep learning models predict regulatory variants in pancreatic islets and refine type 2 diabetes association signals

finding: The SNP rs11568818 was recognized as an eQTL associated with the gene MMP7, showing significant expression levels in prostate cancer. This finding linked the regulatory function of rs11568818 to disease susceptibility.
title: xQTLbiolinks: a comprehensive and scalable tool for integrative analysis of molecular QTLs

finding: The KCNQ1 S140G gain-of-function variant was generated, which biased I<sub>Ks</sub> channels to the open state at lower membrane potentials and increased cellular K<sup>+</sup> efflux. This finding suggested alterations in ionic currents that could impact cardiac physiology.
title: High-throughput functional mapping of variants in an arrhythmia gene, KCNE1, reveals novel biology

finding: The SNP rs4944958 was identified as the risk allele for multiple diseases, where it increased the expression of DHCR7 and acetylation of a nearby actQTL while simultaneously decreasing the expression of NADSYN1, suggesting complex regulatory mechanisms.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: This SNP, acting as a lead variant at a locus associated with multiple immune diseases, influenced gene expression and chromatin modifications, suggesting it plays a critical role in immune response mechanisms.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: This SNP was associated with Cystatin C through various PofO effects, contributing to the understanding of type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: Associations were found for rs231362 with phenotypes linked to T2D, supporting the understanding of its PofO effects.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP exhibited opposite effects on weight-related phenotypes based on parental inheritance, adding evidence to PofO associations with T2D.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10838629 was found to be significantly associated with wellbeing in a Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS), specifically linked to the LDL receptor (LRP4). This association suggested a genetic influence on wellbeing through lipid metabolism.
title: The association between metabolite concentrations and wellbeing in adults

finding: The SNP rs61905145 was associated with Apolipoprotein A1 (APOA1) and showed significant correlation with wellbeing. This finding reinforced the connection between lipid metabolism and wellbeing, echoing results from other genomic studies.
title: The association between metabolite concentrations and wellbeing in adults

finding: SNP rs140735484 was part of the credible set in the STARD10 locus associated with T2D. It was one of the variants that demonstrated regulatory activity and was included in the 4.1 Kb interval that interacts with enhancer regions.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs79430446 was identified as part of the credible set within the STARD10 locus relating to T2D. It exhibited marked differences in DNA-protein complex mobility in context of allele-specific transcription factor binding, indicating its potential regulatory function in islet tissues.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs7103836 was classified as part of the significant credible set for T2D risk at the STARD10 locus and contributed to allele-specific transcription factor binding differences, suggesting a regulatory role.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs613937 was another variant included in the credible set linked to T2D within the STARD10 locus. It was involved in allele-specific activity indicating its possible role in gene regulation.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The T2D-associated variant rs75896506 showed lower expression levels of the FCHSD2 gene in individuals carrying the risk alleles, suggesting its relevance in the context of T2D susceptibility.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs11603334 was associated with lower expression of STARD10 in carriers of risk alleles in a T2D cohort study, underscoring its potential impact on diabetes risk.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The variant rs1552224 showed a significant association with reduced expression levels of FCHSD2 among carriers of risk alleles, correlating with T2D susceptibility.
title: Chromatin 3D interaction analysis of the STARD10 locus unveils FCHSD2 as a new regulator of insulin secretion

finding: The variant rs511217 was associated with refraction error and myopia, functioning as a sc-eQTL of KCNA4 and a nominally significant sc-caQTL of its residing OCR in bipolar cells.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: SNP rs1079596 demonstrated significance in this analysis with a beta of 0.010 and a p-value of 1.3e-10, marking it as significant within the context of cEF associations.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Over 427,000 Individuals Establishes Executive Functioning as a Neurocognitive Basis of Psychiatric Disorders Influenced by GABAergic Processes

finding: The SNP rs2075654 was found to be genome-wide significant, with a beta of 0.010 and a p-value of 1.4e-100, thus exhibiting a strong association with cEF.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Over 427,000 Individuals Establishes Executive Functioning as a Neurocognitive Basis of Psychiatric Disorders Influenced by GABAergic Processes

finding: The common rSNP rs368698783 A-allele was identified to attenuate the binding of LYAR and the epigenetic regulators DNMT3A and PRMT5 from the HBG promoter. This resulted in elevated levels of fetal hemoglobin (HbF) in individuals diagnosed with β-thalassemia, indicating its significance in modulating gene expression related to this condition.
title: Fibrillarin modulates fetal hemoglobin silencing

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was associated with overexpression of FOXM1, which was shown to have significant implications in various cancers. This association was established through pan-cancer analyses that highlighted genomic features contributing to FOXM1 overexpression, indicating potential roles in chromatin regulation and cell cycle progression.
title: The intrinsically disordered region of the E3 ubiquitin ligase TRIP12 induces the formation of chromatin condensates and interferes with DNA damage response

finding: This variant in <italic>PPFIA1</italic> was associated with processing speed and influential in protein expression regulation between various brain areas.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs11020161 showed a significant influence of synthetic cannabinoids on the invasion of glioblastoma cell lines. This finding highlighted its role in the modulation of GBM invasiveness based on cannabinoid receptor interactions, suggesting potential therapeutic avenues.
title: Discovery of Novel Small Molecule CB2 Agonist for the Treatment of Glioblastoma Tumors

finding: The SNP rs3087967 was identified as the likely causal eQTL at the 11q23.1 locus, co-localizing with the expression of genes POU2AF2, COLCA1, and POU2AF3. This variant was associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) risk, showing a strong eQTL effect on these genes in human colonic tissue. Moreover, it was determined that the risk genotype (T) of rs3087967 correlated with reduced tuft cell abundance in colonic epithelium, indicating a link between this genetic variant and CRC risk due to its regulatory effects.
title: Genetic variation at 11q23.1 confers colorectal cancer risk by dysregulation of colonic tuft cell transcriptional activator POU2AF2

finding: Analysis confirmed that rs3802842 exhibited significant cis-eQTL effects for the expression of POU2AF2, COLCA1, and POU2AF3 in healthy colorectal mucosa, providing evidence supporting the association of this SNP with CRC risk and confirming specificity to these genes.
title: Genetic variation at 11q23.1 confers colorectal cancer risk by dysregulation of colonic tuft cell transcriptional activator POU2AF2

finding: The SNP rs11213801 was found to be significantly associated with the expression of POU2AF2, COLCA1, and POU2AF3, indicating its role as a potential genetic variant influencing CRC risk through eQTL mechanisms.
title: Genetic variation at 11q23.1 confers colorectal cancer risk by dysregulation of colonic tuft cell transcriptional activator POU2AF2

finding: Similar to other variants, rs7130173 was shown to significantly affect the expression levels of POU2AF2, COLCA1, and POU2AF3, thus supporting its classification as a variant associated with CRC risk via eQTL effects.
title: Genetic variation at 11q23.1 confers colorectal cancer risk by dysregulation of colonic tuft cell transcriptional activator POU2AF2

finding: The study reported that the JunoH177Q variant (associated with SNP rs76779571) was present in 9% of a female idiopathic infertility cohort. Its prevalence was later estimated at 0.15–0.18% in sequenced populations. Furthermore, despite being classified as an infertility-associated mutant, this variant displayed a high binding affinity with Izumo1, with a dissociation constant (K_D) of 64 ± 14 nM, indicating unexpected stability in binding despite its association with infertility. The findings provided new insights into the mechanostability associated with the Izumo1:Juno complex.
title: Force-dependent Reorganization and Mechanostability of the Izumo1:Juno Complex Involved in Human Fertilization

finding: The SNP MS4A14:rs12226367 was found exclusively in the immune-compartment-mediated eQTL analysis, indicating its specific involvement in immune cell regulation. This SNP was reported as a novel eQTL effect and was previously linked to the expression of MS4A6A, suggesting a broader role for the MS4A gene family in immune responses, particularly in the context of coeliac disease.
title: Gene expression and eQTL analysis reflect the heterogeneity in the inflammatory status of the duodenal epithelial lining in coeliac disease

finding: The Q5H variant (rs1138800) was identified as a gain-of-function polymorphism in the human population, leading to hyperactive Panx1 channel activity, particularly in response to P2X7 receptor activation. Its amino acid substitution of glutamine (Q) with histidine (H) at position 5 confirmed this gain-of-function characteristic.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: The E390D variant (rs74549886) was associated with a loss of function in Panx1 channels, showing insensitivity to P2X7 receptor stimulation, which indicates that this mutant forms nonfunctional channels.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: The R217H variant (rs143240087) was noted to have a dominant-negative effect, resulting in nonfunctional Panx1 channels. It provided further evidence of diverse impacts of PANX1 missense variants on channel functionality.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: SNP rs1712814 also demonstrated a strong association with the hardness trait in yam tubers.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: This SNP had a significant association with elevated triglycerides, total cholesterol, and LDL-C, supporting its role in lipid metabolism as related to the TAGLN gene.
title: Transgelin: A New Gene Involved in LDL Endocytosis Identified by a Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with elevated triglycerides, total cholesterol, and LDL-C, indicating its involvement in lipid traits within the TAGLN locus.
title: Transgelin: A New Gene Involved in LDL Endocytosis Identified by a Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen

finding: This SNP had a significant association with elevated triglycerides, total cholesterol, LDL-C, and was also associated with soluble transferrin receptor (sTfR) indicating a potential role in transferrin/iron metabolism.
title: Transgelin: A New Gene Involved in LDL Endocytosis Identified by a Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with elevated triglycerides, total cholesterol, LDL-C, and was also linked to soluble transferrin receptor (sTfR), suggesting involvement in both lipoprotein and iron metabolism.
title: Transgelin: A New Gene Involved in LDL Endocytosis Identified by a Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen

finding: This SNP showed significant associations with soluble transferrin receptor (sTfR) and could indicate a role in transferrin/iron metabolism alongside lipid metabolism within the TAGLN locus.
title: Transgelin: A New Gene Involved in LDL Endocytosis Identified by a Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Screen

finding: The A-allele of rs45480496 was associated with autoimmune disease, demonstrating suggestive evidence from various biobank GWAS studies, including Finngen and a meta-analysis involving Biobank Japan and UK Biobank. Specifically, it was reported with an odds ratio of 1.04 in Finngen (p = 2 x 10^-7) and 1.08 in the meta-analysis (p = 2 x 10^-6). A subsequent meta-analysis confirmed its significance with a genome-wide p-value of 2 x 10^-12. Functional evidence indicated that rs45480496 resides in a regulatory element that interacts with the promoter of KMT2A in immune cells, specifically active enhancers in Th17 cells.
title: Gene regulatory network inference from CRISPR perturbations in primary CD4+ T cells elucidates the genomic basis of immune disease

finding: The variant rs610932 was associated with lower serum levels of TREM2 and increased genetic susceptibility to LOAD. It was confirmed to be linked with multiple proteins affecting serum levels.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The study demonstrated that the alternate base at rs1052373 was associated with the disease-associated allele in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. This allowed for the phasing of alternatively spliced isoforms to either the wild type or disease-associated allele.
title: Targeted Long-Read RNA Sequencing Demonstrates Transcriptional Diversity Driven by Splice-Site Variation in MYBPC3

finding: Manual phasing using reads with a base called at rs10769255 revealed that the truncated isoforms in the patient sample predominantly originated from the splice-site variant containing alleles, indicating its role in the splicing abnormalities observed.
title: Targeted Long-Read RNA Sequencing Demonstrates Transcriptional Diversity Driven by Splice-Site Variation in MYBPC3

finding: The SNP rs57153895 was also replicated in the ALM of the elderly cohort, further supporting its role in muscle mass variation as indicated in previous findings.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs11020208 was identified in a study by Sun et al. (2019) that examined statistical characteristics of cyclonic warm-core and anticyclonic cold-core eddies in the North Pacific. The findings related to the environmental influences of these eddies highlighted how rotational dynamics could impact ecological parameters, particularly within marine plankton communities.
title: Food or physics: plankton communities structured across Gulf of Alaska eddies

finding: The study found that the heterozygous variant in the RNASEH2C gene, specifically c.468G>T (rs61736590), significantly reduced RNase H2 activity in T cells of a patient with systemic sclerosis. This patient's condition was classified as 'limited disease' and the reduction was quantified, showing residual activity per cell at 80% of control levels and 63.5% of control levels per microgram of cellular protein, indicating a direct impact of this genetic variant on the enzyme activity related to the disease.
title: Validation of an RNase H2 activity assay suitable for clinical screening

finding: The SNP rs35705950 was positively identified as residing within an enhancer that was subject to lineage- and disease-dependent epigenetic remodeling. This finding was significant as it highlighted the role of this SNP in modulating transcriptional responses to environmental exposures, in the context of airway disease.
title: Genomics-based deconvolution of multiplexed transcriptional responses to wood smoke particles defines rapid AHR signaling dynamics

finding: The SNP rs1293651 was found to be associated with bipolar disorder (BD) with psychotic features. This finding was part of a study that focused on the functional polymorphism of the AVPR1b gene and the polymorphism of the CRHR1 gene. The study indicated a significant overlap between certain genetic variants and the manifestation of psychotic symptoms in bipolar patients, pointing towards a genetic basis for this condition.
title: Abnormal features of human self-domestication in bipolar disorder

finding: The association of rs555105 with the lincRNA RP11-290F20.3 was noted in FCGR3A+ monocytes, suggesting its relevance in monocyte-related genetic regulation.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: Analysis revealed significant association of the rs10770141 SNP with schizophrenia, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.788 (p<0.0001). Individuals carrying the minor allele (T(+)) exhibited a 30%-40% higher gene expression of the TH gene compared to non-carriers.
title: Genetic risks of schizophrenia identified in a matched case-control study

finding: Significant association was found for the rs1800497 SNP with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.727 (p<0.0001). Imaging analyses suggested that A1(+) carriers had 12% less availability of striatal DRD2 compared to A1(-) individuals.
title: Genetic risks of schizophrenia identified in a matched case-control study

finding: The rs7117858 polymorphism in SOX6 was linked to osteoporosis and obesity-related phenotypes, indicating its potential significance in metabolic disorders.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The matrix metalloproteinase-3 gene polymorphism rs3025058 was shown to affect markers of atherosclerosis in individuals with type 2 diabetes.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs734094 (PIP=0.41) was located within a peak overlapping in both T and myeloid cell types, linked to TSPAN32 and C11orf21 gene promoters. It exhibited accessibility in T_A-4: CD8+ PRF1+ cytotoxic and M_A-3: CD1C+ AFF3+ DC chromatin classes, which suggested its involvement in negatively regulating T cell migration relevant to RA pathology.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs11222649 was associated with the ecological suitability of <italic>Gymnosporia senegalensis</italic> under various climatic models. Specifically, it played a crucial role in the habitat suitability assessments during the Last Glacial Maximum. The findings indicated that this SNP contributed to understanding the expansion of the species' ecological niche during periods of favorable climatic conditions, which had significant implications for the future conservation efforts of this endangered species.
title: The relict ecosystem of Gymnosporia senegalensis (Lam.) Loes. in an agricultural plastic sea: past, present and future scenarios

finding: The rs2514218 variant was identified as a lead variant in the SCZ GWAS, mapping to the DRD2 gene and being part of the shared genetic architecture with CompGaming.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: The rs2734837 variant also served as a lead variant in the CompGaming GWAS, mapping to the DRD2 gene, indicating its role in the genetic overlap with SCZ.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: Similar to rs2734837, the rs4648319 variant was a lead variant associated with CompGaming, mapping to DRD2, thus linking it directly to SCZ genetic architecture.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: The rs4936271 variant was identified as another lead variant from the CompGaming GWAS, contributing to the shared genetic linkage with SCZ through mapping to the DRD2 gene.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: This SNP was located in the 3'UTR of TMEM25 and exhibited a higher expression level in the PASSPORT-seq assay among heterozygous AUD subjects, compared to lower expression levels following ethanol exposure in SK-N-BE(2) cells. This indicated a significant interaction between rs45474901 and ethanol treatment.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: Found within the 3'UTR of a gene, this SNP also displayed significant differences in expression upon ethanol treatment in SK-N-BE(2) cells, consistent with its role in the adaptive response to alcohol exposure, although specific allele behavior was not detailed in the findings.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: Another SNP located within the PCDHB16 gene, rs45548238 showed significant changes in allelic ratio due to ethanol treatment in SK-N-BE(2) cells, indicating it may be involved in the metabolic response to alcohol exposure, similar to other identified SNPs.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: The SNP rs11020185 was associated with the phenomenon of in vivo cell fusion between mesenchymal stroma/stem-like cells and breast cancer cells. This finding suggested that such fusions could contribute to genetic diversity within cancer cells, impacting the tumor's adaptive capabilities. The experiments demonstrated evidence of spontaneous cell fusions in multiple breast cancer cell line models, influencing clonal heterogeneity and phenotypic plasticity.
title: Spontaneous Cell Fusions as a Mechanism of Parasexual Recombination in Tumor Cell Populations

finding: The rs659366 SNP is associated with Ucp2, which was identified as differentially expressed in relation to locomotor response to novelty in bHR/bLR rats, highlighting its significance in behavioral phenotypes.
title: Transcriptional Profiling of the Hippocampus in an F2 Cross of a Genetic Rat Model of Internalizing vs. Externalizing Behavior and Addiction Liability

finding: This SNP was identified as a QTL for chromatin accessibility, H3K4me1, and methylation. It contributed to the understanding of how specific genetic variants could influence epigenetic traits that are vital for immune response.
title: Epigenetic variation impacts ancestry-associated differences in the transcriptional response to influenza infection

finding: The rs3851179 SNP located in the PICALM gene was found to be a risk allele for LOAD. Carriers of the allele showed altered fMRI connectivity and decreased EEG complexity. These findings pointed towards the involvement of PICALM in brain functionality that may be compromised prior to the onset of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Alzheimer’s disease-like features in resting state EEG/fMRI of cognitively intact and healthy middle-aged APOE/PICALM risk carriers

finding: This variant was highlighted as having a high effect size on body mass index (BMI) and was reported to exhibit between 2-3 times greater effect size than the lead colocalized variant (rs6591). It was associated with the expression impact on the gene CD151.
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: Similar to rs35835984, this variant was reported to have a high effect size on BMI, exhibiting between 2-3 times the effect size compared to the lead colocalized variant (rs6591), indicating an impact on expression related to the gene POLR2L.
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: This SNP also showed a high effect size linked to BMI and, like rs35835984 and rs184629044, demonstrated a significant impact, being between 2-3 times more influential than the lead colocalized variant (rs6591).
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs1800497, associated with the expression of the DRD2 gene, was found to influence migraine risk among Han Chinese individuals. This finding underscored the role of genetic polymorphisms in the susceptibility to migraine, suggesting that variations at rs1800497 might be utilized as a potential genetic marker for migraine risk assessment.
title: PACAP induces light aversion in mice by an inheritable mechanism independent of CGRP

finding: The SNP rs642803 was recognized as an outlier associated with 14 traits that exhibited conditionally independent influences on the outcome related to coronary heart disease (CHD), including anthropometric measures and cholesterol levels.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The lead variant rs3741360 exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with several other GWAS-significant variants at the BBS1 locus. This observation indicated meaningful colocalization between the BBS1 eQTL signals and LDL GWAS signals, suggesting a potential interaction between gene expression and trait associations in this genomic region.
title: eQTpLot: a user-friendly R package for the visualization and colocalization of eQTL and GWAS signals

finding: The rs12252-C variant was linked to a significant absence of truncated IFITM3 transcripts in immune cells. This was associated with a higher risk of severe influenza infection, emphasizing the variant's role in influenza susceptibility through its impact on IFITM3 expression.
title: Low basal expression and slow induction of IFITM3 puts immune cells at risk of influenza A infection

finding: The variant rs1039215 in HBG2/HBE1 was identified as an African-ancestry specific low-frequency variant (MAF=0.03) associated with HbA1c. This finding indicated that this variant could influence HbA1c levels, potentially leading to underdiagnosis of diabetes in individuals carrying this variant when assessed using HbA1c.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The variant rs7484123 was confirmed as one of the best candidates based on the high level of coloration in the absolute metascores visualization. It was associated with increased PIDD1 promoter activity, as demonstrated by reporter assays.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: The variant rs11246314 was confirmed as one of the best candidates based on its high metascore ranking, demonstrating its role in increasing PIDD1 promoter activity.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: The SNP rs3842752, associated with the insulin gene, was found to interact with rs9273363, where individual alleles had opposing effects on T1D risk. This interaction highlights the complexity of its contribution to disease risk, a nuance that was captured by the GLN model.
title: Deep integrative models for large-scale human genomics

finding: This SNP was associated with MS4A6A and showed significance in the context of PART with a p-value of 0.01. It reflects the shared genetic risks between PART and AD.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: Another SNP tied to MS4A6A, rs2081545, registered a significance level of 0.01 in association with PART, suggesting potential involvement in tauopathies.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: Like the previous MS4A6A SNPs, rs7935829 demonstrated an association with PART, reporting a significance level of 0.02, indicating genetic convergence with AD.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: Identified as a key SNP in PC, linked to alternative TSS usage influencing obesity-related processes in distinct tissues.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs549893 was associated with Cluster 841 focused on tissue contrast in higher-order cortical areas. It resides in the HMBS gene tied to acute intermittent porphyria, with notable neurological implications.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs33950507 C>T in gene HBB was identified as having a carrier frequency of 4% (1 in 25) for Beta-thalassemia in the Vietnamese population. Its allele frequency was noted to be 12 times higher in this population (1.57%) compared to East Asia (0.13%).
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The FADS2 rs3834458 gene polymorphism was found to be associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and coronary artery disease in the Chinese Han population, suggesting its relevance in metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The C224T polymorphism (rs17571) of the cathepsin D gene was correlated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, indicating its impact on oxidative and inflammatory markers.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The fatty acid desaturase 2 (FADS2) rs174575 (C/G) polymorphism was linked to circulating lipid levels and susceptibility to type 2 diabetes mellitus, highlighting its metabolic significance.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The variant rs1104890 significantly reduced the expression of MRPL23 in multiple tissues, including colon-transverse and skeletal muscle, and was associated with intervertebral disc disorder, suggesting its influence on musculoskeletal health.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The variant rs686646 decreased RPUSD4 expression in the pancreas and was associated with diabetes, emphasizing its potential role in metabolic disorders.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The rs10767664 polymorphism within the BDNF gene was strongly associated with obesity in a study of 204,158 individuals, showing a significant p-value of 4.69×10^-26. Further analysis demonstrated a correlation between the A-allele of rs10767664 and increased feelings of anxiety and worry in human populations. Additionally, deletions of the BE5.1 regulatory region containing this polymorphism in mice led to a significant increase in anxiety-like behavior and BDNF expression in the amygdala of female mice, underlining the role of this SNP in modulating anxiety-related responses.
title: An ancient polymorphic regulatory region within the BDNF gene associated with obesity modulates anxiety-like behaviour in mice and humans

finding: The SNP rs11020251 was identified as a significant marker associated with the overexpression of the FOXM1 gene in cancer. This finding was part of a pan-cancer analysis that highlighted the genomic features linked to FOXM1, which is implicated in various malignancies and plays a crucial role in cellular processes including proliferation and survival. The context of this finding relates to its potential implications in cancer biology and therapy.
title: A genome-wide CRISPR functional survey of the human phagocytosis molecular machinery

finding: The allele tied to enhanced cognitive performance was linked to higher odds of completing the MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12252 was identified as a genetic variant associated with increased severity of influenza in hospitalized populations. It was also linked to a higher incidence of severe COVID-19 in a small human cohort. The variant appeared to express a truncated isoform of IFITM3, although this isoform was not detected in RNA sequencing of patient samples.
title: Site-specific lipidation enhances IFITM3 membrane interactions and antiviral activity

finding: The SNP rs34481144 was found to be a loss-of-function allele in the IFITM3 gene’s 5' untranslated region. It was associated with lower mRNA expression of IFITM3 and a reduction in airway resident CD8+ T cells during viral infection.
title: Site-specific lipidation enhances IFITM3 membrane interactions and antiviral activity

finding: The polymorphism rs3025058 in the MMP3 gene affected markers of atherosclerosis in type 2 diabetes mellitus, contributing to the understanding of metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11020257 was linked to lactate metabolism alterations in prostate cancer progression and metastasis. This finding was relevant as increased lactate production was noted to be a mechanism of resistance in treatment with combination therapies targeting the PI3K and Wnt/MEK pathways.
title: Suppression of tumor cell lactate-generating signaling pathways eradicates murine PTEN/p53-deficient aggressive-variant prostate cancer via macrophage phagocytosis

finding: The Manhattan plot analysis for the LDHC eQTLs indicated that several variants, including rs4757652, had comparable genetic effects across numerous tissues, aside from the testis. The FastGxC method emphasized the specificity of eQTL effects primarily in the testis.
title: Fast and powerful statistical method for context-specific QTL mapping in multi-context genomic studies

finding: SNP rs10835060 was found to impact the expression of multiple genes (KRTAP5-AS1, CCDC88A, KRTAP5-5, BRSK2) through eQTL analysis, highlighting its contribution to PD biology.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs11030317 was associated with metabolic peculiarities in tumor cells, specifically the modulation of glycolytic activity, which was highlighted in the study. The findings suggested that targeting glycolytic pathways could offer a therapeutic opportunity against breast tumor recurrence due to the treatment-resistant minimal residual disease (MRD) cells. This connection was significant as the MRD cells displayed metabolic profiles similar to their tumor counterparts, indicating a potential oncogenic memory linked with this SNP.
title: Oncogenic memory underlying minimal residual disease in breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs5002 located at chr11:10326521 (hg19) was identified as having a significant association with hemoglobin concentration, red blood cell count, and hematocrit levels. This finding was derived using phenoscanner techniques, and it highlighted the potential impact of DNA:DNA:RNA triplex formation in gene expression control, particularly related to the gene Adrenomedullin (ADM).
title: HIF1α-AS1 is a DNA:DNA:RNA triplex-forming lncRNA interacting with the HUSH complex

finding: The SNP rs28668859, while located within the MUC5AC gene, was also associated with MUC5B concentration, albeit dependent on linkage disequilibrium with rs140324259.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: A significant association was identified between the SAA1 genetic polymorphism (rs12218) and myocardial infarction risk in a Chinese population.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The rs2168101 G/T polymorphism located in the first intron of the LMO1 gene was shown to be a significant neuroblastoma predisposition locus. The G allele was associated with increased risk for developing neuroblastoma, as it enabled the binding of GATA3, facilitating the formation of a super-enhancer that upregulated LMO1 expression. In contrast, the T allele prevented GATA3 binding, resulting in lower LMO1 levels and a marked reduction in neuroblastoma risk. This was illustrated in genetically modified zebrafish, where the presence of T alleles decreased the penetrance of MYCN-driven neuroblastomas.
title: Genetic Predisposition to Neuroblastoma Results from a Regulatory Polymorphism that Promotes the Adrenergic Cell State

finding: The SNP rs11020263 was identified in a study that explored the unique hypoxia-induced signatures in gastric cancer associated with myofibroblasts. The findings suggested that this SNP might influence gene expression patterns related to tumor microenvironments, specifically in conditions that mimic hypoxia, which is a common characteristic of many cancer types.
title: Water as a reactant in the differential expression of proteins in cancer

finding: The SNP rs143883793 in the TNKS1BP1 gene was linked to suicide death, contributing to the identification of five novel, high-impact, rare SNPs with significant associations observed. This finding highlights its potential relevance in understanding genetic risk factors for suicide.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: This SNP associated with <italic>LGR4</italic> was shown to be critical in Wnt signaling pathways impacting bone density. Its presence in active chromatin suggested regulatory functions in osteoblast development.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: Identified as a missense SNP in <italic>LGR4</italic>, this SNP influenced protein structure and was associated with low bone density, emphasizing its significance in osteoporosis.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs12293670, located near the NRGN gene, was analyzed as part of the CRISPR Del/Rei strategy for scarless genome editing in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). This locus showed successful editing with high efficiency, and was confirmed through several sequential steps involving design of gRNAs, sequencing, and PCR-based screening. The findings indicated that this locus could be targeted effectively for generating isogenic clones, contributing to advancements in the modeling of genetic diseases.
title: CRISPR Del/Rei: A simple, flexible, and efficient pipeline for scarless genome editing

finding: The SNP rs1491818 in the lncRNA LINC02742 was also found to be up-regulated in excitatory neurons in ALS patients when compared to non-pathological neuronal populations. This finding indicates its relevance to the pathological mechanisms of ALS.
title: Transcriptional profiling of human brain cortex identifies novel lncRNA-mediated networks dysregulated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The rs2298813 variant was among candidates in the SORL1 gene, likely involved in retromer function, and deficits in retromer-dependent endosomal recycling were implicated as causal in Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The rs144215891 (c.1535A>G; p.Y512C) variant was found in Danish patients and had a frequency of 77/139948 in GnomAD and 71/120620 in ExAC. Although additional carriers were found in control cohorts, the variant's presence in PAM patients linked it to increased ROS levels, supporting the notion of its involvement in PAM pathogenesis.
title: Rare coding variants in NOX4 link high superoxide levels to psoriatic arthritis mutilans

finding: The variant rs765662279 (c.1105G>T; p.V369F) exhibited a population frequency of 9/245174 in GnomAD and 4/121010 in ExAC. In silico predictions indicated a high CADD score of 23, suggesting this missense variant was potentially damaging. It was among the identified rare variants strongly associated with the development of PAM.
title: Rare coding variants in NOX4 link high superoxide levels to psoriatic arthritis mutilans

finding: The presence of rs2282649 as a heterozygote was identified in L150P neurons. This SNP was associated with altered protein trafficking within the trans-Golgi, indicating its potential role in aggravating Golgi fragmentation and hence, contributing to Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk.
title: Golgi fragmentation - One of the earliest organelle phenotypes in Alzheimer’s disease neurons

finding: The rs2070045 was found to be homozygous in the L150P model. Like rs2282649, this SNP was linked to functional alterations in the Golgi apparatus, which could further disrupt protein trafficking in the context of AD.
title: Golgi fragmentation - One of the earliest organelle phenotypes in Alzheimer’s disease neurons

finding: The SNP rs4057749 (c.532T>C, p.Cys178Arg) in the OR8B4 receptor was associated with an impairment in the ability to perceive anisic aldehyde and muguet alcohol, suggesting a loss of function impacting olfactory perception.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The mutation rs4501959 (c.262G>A, p.Asp88Asn) in the OR52L1 receptor potentially affected the perception of carboxylic acids found in human sweat, influencing how carriers recognized certain smell components.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The rs12252 variant of the human IFITM3 gene was associated with severe influenza, HIV-1, and COVID-19. Studies indicated that this SNP predicted an alternatively spliced transcript, resulting in an N-terminus truncated IFITM3, linking it to increased susceptibility and severity in these viral infections. The findings underscored its role in the host immune response against these viruses.
title: Alternative splicing expands the antiviral IFITM repertoire in Chinese horseshoe bats

finding: At the <italic>SLC22A12/NRXN2</italic> locus, SNP <italic>rs2277311</italic> was indicated as a probable causal variant, influencing regulatory mechanisms.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
